loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cathrine wants to rent a plot of land to be growing rice instead of buying

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en: Farhad M. runs a small metal works shop in Aghsu city and is being trained in the family trade of ironworks by his father, along with his brother, Terlan. He opened his own metal shop five years ago making and repairing, by hand, knives, saws, shovels and other iron items. With this loan Farhad wants to purchase more raw materials for his shop and begin to repair and manufacture other items, such as carburetors for vehicles.

loans.use: Needs to purchase more raw materials for his shop

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria B. has 3 children, whom she raises along with her spouse, Roberto Ovidio Sánchez. Maria runs her own dressmaking business at her workshop in San Pedro de Macorís. She has been working hard to expand her business to support her family.

She received and successfully paid off a previous loan from Esperanza and is now eligible for this new loan of $600. She will use this loan to purchase more material as well as sewing equipment and spare parts to increase productivity. Maria says her goal is to make the clothing that she sells better every time.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and equipment to expand her workshop and increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two electric razors, two chairs, and three mirrors

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu Kulwa is a 37-year-old mother of 5 and a resident of Buguruni community, a Dar Es Salaam city suburb. She has run a small business for 20 years. For the past 6 years, she's been a wholesaler for cooking oil, bed sheets and the local garments commonly known as Vitengi . She buys her items directly from the local processing industries sells the items to retailers both in Dar Es Salaam and up country. She has also has a retail charcoal business. Her wish now is to build a permanent shop where she can offer her services comfortably from one location.  She requesting a loan of $550 to expand her stock and to help her accomplish the permanent housing for her business and expand her stock

loans.use: To build a permanent location for her store and expand her stock

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred Nzuki is 32 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in Kitengela Township on the outskirts of the city of Nairobi. Besides offering computer services, Winfred does voluntary work within her community by visiting institutions that care for orphaned and vulnerable children, especially those that have been affected by HIV/IADS. 

Winfred went through training in typing at the Salvation Army, a church sponsored institution that offers technical skills. Winfred had saved Ksh 20,000 USD 294 from her previous employment and together with Ksh 10,000 (USD 150), which her husband added Winfred was able to set up her business in 2003. 

Winfred offers a wide range of computer services such as typing and scanning. She also offers photocopying services. Winfred wants to expand her business by offering Internet services. She is therefore requesting for a loan of USD 1075, which will be given in kind, to enable her to purchase four computers and a wireless telephone set. This will result in better services for her clients whom she believe are going to increase in number. Her ultimate intention is to open a school where she can create employment becahse the EPZ, an exporting company that offered employment on a casual basis, has closed down and many young people who were employed there now have   nowhere to go. She also intends to start a cheap computer college. Winfred hopes to repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase 4 computers and a wireless telephone

loans.name: Thi Thiet

texts.vi:
Ms Thiết is 32 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She and her husband grind rice then sell it at the market. She also raises pigs which are fed with the bran & husk waste from the rice grinding. Their income is steady so she thinks that the weekly repayment is easy for her. She's requesting a loan to buy pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thiết, 32 tuổi có chồng và có 3 con đang đi học. Công việc hàng ngày của hai vợ chồng là đi thu mua thóc về xay xát thành gạo rồi đem bán ở chợ. Ngoài ra, chị còn kết hợp với nuôi lợn để tận dụng nguồn cám có được từ việc xay xát. Thu nhập của anh chị kiếm được khá ổn định nên chị thấy việc trả góp hàng tuần là rất dễ dàng. Chị muốn sau này được vay với số tiền lớn hơn để mở rộng chăn nuôi.

loans.use: buy pigs

loans.name: Donato

texts.es:
Donato holds a special place in his heart for the land on which he was born. He is happy to have shared many fond moments with his parents in this place, and although his parents were not able to give him a higher education, they gave him as an inheritance many attitudes of great value for the life that he shares today with his five children and beloved wife. He has been dedicated for many years to raising livestock, and through his hard work he has been able to bring security and well-being to his loved ones. He has a new project in mind, to raise and sell alpacas, since these animals are highly valued by families in the region for their high nutrition and low calories. In order to make this plan a reality, he is asking for your help to obtain the animals necessary to put his plan of raising alpacas in motion. Let’s make his request possible so that this noble father will continue raising the quality of life and education of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Donato, guarda en su corazón gran cariño por la tierra que lo vió nacer y está muy feliz de haber compartido muchos momentos agradables con sus padres en este lugar y aunque ellos no pudieron otorgarle educación superior le dieron como herencia muchas actitudes de gran valor para su vida que hoy comparte con sus cinco hijos y su amada esposa. Se dedica a la labor ganadera desde hace mucho tiempo y con su desempeño en esta actividad a podido otorgarle bienestar y seguridad a los suyos. Tiene en mente un nuevo proyecto, criar y vender alpacas ya que estos animalitos son muy cotizados por su alto valor nutritivo bajo en calorías, por las familias de su región.Para concretar este plan solicita tu ayuda a fin de obtener la cantidad que necesita para poner en marcha su gran criadero de alpacas.Hagamos posible su petición para que este noble padre siga incrementando el nivel de vida y educación de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: To purchase alpacas and to install breeding space in his home.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.ru:
Tahir is 43 years old and married with three children. He has been working as a barber for 30 years. Not long ago he acquired his own barbershop. Since he spent all his savings buying the shop, Tahir has applied to the Saalti branch of Normicro for a loan of $500, to be repaid over 12 months. He needs the money to buy new furniture.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Тахиру 43 года, женат, имеет 3 детей. Вот уже 30 лет работает парикмахером. Недавно он приобрел салон. Так как все свои сбережения он вложил в покупку салона Тахир обратился в Саатлинский филиал для получения кредита в сумме 500 USD на 12 месяцев. Эта сумма нужна ему на покупку новой мебели.

loans.use: To buy new furniture

loans.name: Maira Milady

texts.en:
Maira Milady is a teacher in a primary school located in the café community of Santo Domingo where she lives. Maira has three children, two boys and one girl. The girl attends a university and the boys go to secondary school.

Maira Milady has been producing an assortment of homemade sweets called sweet beans, for two years. She sells her goods in the school where she teaches. She explains that she continually has to buy goods such as milk, coco, sugar, sweet potato and so forth to prepare her sweets. With her loan, she plans on purchasing a large amount of raw materials so that she can produce more goods and increase her income.

Maira Milady wants to keep providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to produce sweet beans and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is the mother of four children. She sells pigs' feet at the local market in Kronum. All of Grace’s children are currently in school. Her eldest son is about to enter a polytechnic institute.

With the proceeds of the loan she is seeking, she would like to increase her inventory so that she can increase her sales. Grace expects to generate additional profits from her increased sales, which would enable her to pay for her son's school fees. In addition, she wants to start saving money so that she can build her own house someday.

Grace is a member of the trust group Eye Nyame (It is God). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs' feet

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đào Thị Lừng is 54 years old. She lives in Lương Bằng, Kim Động with her 3 children. Her husband passed away long time ago. Raising 3 children and providing them education all by herself was very difficult. Her main occupation is fish farming, raise pigs and cultivate fruit plants. With hard work, she was able to make ends meet. After joining TYM fund in 2003, she used the loans to invest in her pig raising business with success. Today, her monthly income is 150-180 USD. All her 3 children are grown up and they do help out their mother. Mrs Lừng would like to get a loan of 950 USD to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Lừng, 54 tuổi, sống cùng 3 con tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Chồng mất sớm, một mình chị lam lũ vất vả nuôi các con ăn học. Công việc chính của chị là chăn nuôi lợn, nuôi cá và trồng cây ăn quả. Luôn chịu khó làm lụng nên thu nhập cũng đủ nuôi sống gia đình. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ vào năm 2003, có thêm vốn, việc chăn nuôi sản xuất ngày thêm thuận lợi. Một tháng chị Lừng kiếm được khoảng 150-180USD. Hiện nay cả 3 người con đều đã trưởng thành và có thể hỗ trợ mẹ, chị Lừng muốn được vay thêm 950USD để đầu tư mở rộng dự án của mình.

loans.use: Buy pigs, fishes and food for them

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en:
Ibodat S. is a 45-year-old market vendor. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is currently unemployed, which is why her business is the main source of income for her family.

At the picture Ibodat and her friend Vazira are trading alongside one another, that is why they have been pictured together. Ibodat is standing to the right side and Vazira to the left. As previously stated, Ibodat is a market vendor. Indeed, for more than ten years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables, including apricots, apples, strawberries, tomatoes, and cucumbers, in the central local market. Her oldest son helps Ibodat with the business. Ibodat begins her workday early each morning at 5:00 a.m. In practice, she buys vegetables and fruits from the local farmers, and she then sells such produce in the market, where she is well-known among the local shoppers because of her friendliness and the fact that she sells her fruits and vegetables for reasonable prices. Accordingly, Ibodat’s business generates a stable, considerable income for her family.

Now, it is the prime season in which to sell fruits and vegetables, and (not surprisingly) her goods are in great demand. In addition, she wants to expand her business in order to generate even greater income to cover the higher education expenses that her darling children will soon need. For this reason, she is planning to purchase more fresh fruits and vegetables to sell in the market, and in order to do so she is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,500 Somoni ($450), to be repaid within 8 months. She asks that you lend your support to a dedicated mother so that she can make her children’s dreams a reality because, with your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To capitalize on an increase in demand by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mayi

texts.fr:
Originally from Bassar in the northwest of Togo, Mrs. Mayi K. was born on December 31, 1969 in Bassar. She is married to Mr. Kodzo Dentey who teaches driver’s education. She has 3 children and in 1998, she opened a bar in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. In her establishment, BAR LUCIOLE, she creates a welcoming atmosphere and serves her customers to their satisfaction.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 40 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Originaire de BASSAR au nord ouest du Togo, madame K. Mayi est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Bassar. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur DENTEY Kodzo qui est un moniteur d’Auto-école. Elle a trois enfants et a ouvert en 1998 un bar dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Dans son BAR « BAR LUCIOLE », elle accueille bien ses clients et leur rend un service satisfaisant.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 40 casiers de bières.

loans.use:
Purchase of 40 cases of beer

Achat de 40 casiers de bières

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mr. Phally S. lives in the Tbeng Khpos Village, Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 24 years old, married, and has a little child. His wife, Mrs. Thol Reab, is a farmer, while Mr. Phally S. earns income charging batteries. However, Mr. Phally S. currently faces an obstacle to his business, because the machine he uses to charge batteries is too old and uses a lot of fuel. Therefore, Mr. Phally S. is asking for a loan to buy a new charger to improve his business and, simultaneously, the environment. Previously, Mr. Phally S. took out a loan from Credit Co. Ltd to buy a cow, and has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Purchase of a new battery charger

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes B. has been selling shoes and bags at Abura for over 6 years. Agnes has received a senior high school education.  She is married to a teacher and has 5 children. She is responsible for providing most of the needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy dozens of shoes and bags for resale. She hopes to use the new profits for reinvestment into the business.

loans.use: To purchase dozens of shoes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat (her daughter is pictured)  was born in 1965. She is married, has two children, and lives in Khirdalan town in Azerbijan. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Djabrayil region of Azebaijan. She started this beauty salon business eight years ago. 
Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary things for improving her business and providing her clients with the best service.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Angela tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80 de la ciudad de Managua, es casada su esposo es docente de un instituto de educación, y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Tienen dos hijas, las cuales estudian y en su tiempo libre apoyan a su mamá en el negocio. Doña Angela tiene una librería en su vivienda y también vende ropa, tiene 3 años de experiencia, y por falta de financiamiento no ha podido crecer. El uso del préstamo será para la compra de ropa y ofertarla a sus clientes. Los planes para su negocio son tener una mayor rotación de inventario que le permita generar mayores ganancias, y también sus planes a corto plazo es poder remodelar su hogar
texts.en:
Angela is 46 years old and lives in the 3-80 section of the city of Managua. She is married and her husband is a school teacher, whom she helps with household expenses. They have two daughters, students who in their free time assist their mother in the business. Angela has a bookstore in her home and also sells clothing. She has been in the business for three years, but due to a lack of capital has not been able to expand. The loan would be used to purchase clothing to offer to her customers. Her business plan is to increase inventory turnover, which would enable her to generate higher earnings. In the short-term, she plans to renovate her home.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Thera

texts.en: Mrs. Thera P. is a villager in Trapeang Sragei village in Takeo Province. She is a chicken seller who buys from other people in the local village and sells in the market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand her business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy some chickens for selling. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Toeng Phon, is a car repairer. Mrs. Thera P. is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy some chickens for selling.

loans.name: Mpapai Group

texts.en:
Abdul K., age 40, is married with three children, ages 13, 2 and 6. He has sold second-hand shoes since 1998. He works daily from 8am until 9pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $281.

This will be Abdul’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his shoe business and has repaid the loan successfully. He now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes for good sales.

Abdul will share this loan with his loan group, Mpapai, which totals 17 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Abdul is the first one standing on the left.

loans.use: To increase his stock of shoes

loans.name: Ivania Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Ivania es una joven luchadora, que se ha esforzado para estudiar, para poder obtener mejores beneficios, ella se desempeña como  Secretaria ejecutiva desde hace dos años en una empresa privada que se llama Detodo.Com., tiene 26 años y habita en Lomas de Memorial Sandino  en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo es albañil y todavía no tiene hijos, pero quiere tener una casa digna para cuando los tenga, con esta solicitud es la tercera que hace en Afodenic pues se ha beneficiado para hacer las mejoras de su cada con este préstamo es la tercera solicitud y va invertir en infraestructura en cambio de del techo, de su cuarto que esta en mal estado, para esto va,  a comprar zinc, golosos, perlin entre otros y así poder estar mas tranquila ya que este invierno pasado tuvo mucha dificultades para relajar su sueño ya que se le mojaba y tenia que estar pendiente. Sus metas es poder seguir estudiando para obtener un cargo mejor donde pueda ganar mejor.
texts.en:
Ivania is a fighter who has worked hard to study so that she can earn more money. She has worked as an executive secretary for the past two years in a private company called Detodo.Com. She is 26 years old and lives in Lomas de Memorial Sandino, in Managua. Her husband is a mason and they do not yet have children, but they want to have a worthy home for when they do. This is her third loan with Afodenic. She has made home improvements with her previous loans. With this loan, she wants to invest in the infrastructure of her home: to replace the roof and to fix her room which is in bad shape. She will buy zinc, beams, purlins and other building materials so that she can have peace of mind as she could not relax this past winter as everything was getting wet and had to be hung to dry. Her goal is to continue her studies so that she can get a better job with better pay.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to replace her roof.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena O. is 30 years old. She is married and a mother of three, with twins. Currently all the kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood.  She has been selling yams for six years to support her family.

She treks to farming communities like Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her stock of yam from the yam farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Helena belongs to a village bank called ‘Agnes’. She also hope to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more and to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Doki

texts.fr: Doki A. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché d’Atakpame. Sa spécialité est la livraison en gros. Pour éviter des ruptures de stocks et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Doki souhaite avec ce crédit alimenter son magasin. Dans la vue elle est celle habillé en tricot bleu et la seconde l’une de ses clientes.
texts.en:
Doki A., age 45, is married and the mother of three. She is a retailer of grain at the grand marketplace of Atakpame. Her specialty is in bulk deliveries. To avoid inventory shortages and to satisfy her customers better, Doki would like to use this loan to stock her store. In the photo, she is the one dressed in the blue vest, and the other person is one of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, four boys and three girls. She says two of her children are in senior high school, two in apprenticeships, while the others are in junior high and basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband is cocoa/palm nut farmer.

Juliana also produces palm oil to make some income to help her husband financially. She procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. Juliana distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She also sells to food vendors and wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. Juliana is hopeful to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Analia

texts.es:
Analia vive en la calle “Juan Balsa”  de la zona Villa Dolores en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella es separada de su esposo actualmente vive con su pequeño hijo en unas habitaciones en alquiler.
 
Se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, queques y todo tipo de masitas, ya que recién termino un curso de reposteria en un instituto de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de  un horno semi industrial para la mejor calidad en su producción. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Analia lives on “Juan Balsa” street in the Villa Dolores zone in El Alto city. She is separated from her husband and today lives with her young son in some rented rooms. She makes tortes, cakes, and all kinds of baked goods, as she recently finished a pastry course in an institute in the city. The loan will be used to acquire a semi-industrial oven to improve the quality of her production. This is her first loan with Impro, and the completed evaluation qualified her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a semi-industrial oven to make her baked goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria P., 51, is married with 4 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells to the general public and tourists, 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used for the business and also paying children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase electric chainsaw, chisel set, sand paper and varnish. Also help with children's school fees.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca tiene 39 años, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 13 años; también vive junto a su madre y a su hermana quienes le apoyan mucho. La casa que habitan es de su madre. Cuenta con un negocio de venta de abarrotes, pasamanería y productos de primera necesidad que implementó en un espacio de la casa. Atiende durante todo el día y todos los días, esta actividad que la viene realizando desde hace 6 años y le gusta mucho, porque gracias al mismo está sacando adelante a su familia y en especial, pagando los estudios de su hija. Blanca comenta que la rentabilidad de su tienda se debe a tiene ingresos diarios y cuenta con una clientela regular. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque ha observado que existe responsabilidad y puntualidad, que es lo más importante para ella. Con el dinero solicitado ampliará el espacio de su tienda para seguir creciendo y aumentar la cantidad de productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Blanca is 39-years old and a single mother of a 13-year old daughter; she also lives with her mother and sister who support her a lot. The house belongs to her mother. Blanca has a business selling groceries, trim (braids and tassels) for upholstery, and basic goods, set up in a space in the house. It is open all day, every day. She has been doing this work for six years and likes it a lot. Thanks to her business she is able to provide for her family and most importantly, pay for her daughter's schooling. Blanca commented that the profitability of her store is due to daily income and regular customers. This is her first loan with MFP. She likes to work with her group because she has seen that they are responsible and punctual in their repayments, which is very important to her. With the requested money she will expand her store space to continue growing and increase the quantity of products offered.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of store space

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 32-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Ali has been working as a mason for 10 years. Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and electrical wire for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. Ali decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase tools and electrical wire for his work

loans.name: La Unión Group

texts.en:
The communal group “L. Unión”  has 11 members, most of whom are mothers and live in the Cusco area. Most of the group members are investing their loans to buy more merchandise for their small businesses such as kiosks and general stores. One general store owner will buy rice, olive oil and pasta to increase her merchandise. Another will buy more medicine to sell at his drugstore.

Maritza, the group leader, makes crochet and macramé bags by hand and sells them at a local market for between 35 and 45 soles (approximately $10 - $15 USD).  The crochet bags take one day to make, while the macramé bags maD. by hand take two days.  Martiza will buy supplies to make more bags with her loan.

As the group leader, Martiza says that it is her responsibility to proviD. support for the mothers to help them make their payments, achieve their personal goals, and get ahead in life. She is 46 years old, and married with two children. The women appreciate the loan and are dedicated to repaying it as scheduled.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Nasreen Kosar Muhammad Ali Group

texts.en:
Nasreen kosar baji is the wife of M. A. who has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 11 years. Her husband has a fruit selling business. He buys fruit wholesale from the wholesalers, sells to the fruit shops, and earns income. Nasreen baji is a very responsible lady. She takes care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to increase her husband’s fruits selling business. 

Nasreen baji is seated with her group members, carrying her grandson. The one next to her is named Shamshad baji and she wants a loan to buy wheat to sell. The third is Rubi baji who wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The fourth is Asifa Noreen who also wants an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme commerce la vente en détail de matelas et d’oreillers, elle est la seule à exercer ce commerce dans son quartier  ce qui lui permet de mieux vendre et de réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices. Son stock étant en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 17 matelas et 26 oreillers.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman runs a business retailing mattresses and pillows. She is the only person engaged in this business in her area, which allows her to sell better and to realize large profits. Her stock being low, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 17 mattresses and 26 pillows. She is married and has 3 children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mattresses, pillows, and sheets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products for the store.

loans.name: Magno

texts.es: Magno tiene 35 años, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 6 años. Desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio de venta de comida oriental, el cual atiende todos los días desde el medio día hasta altas horas de la noche. El local donde tiene su restaurante es arrendado y se ubica en una de las principales calles de su ciudad, lo que le garantiza las entradas económicas. Magno se encarga de cocinar la comida, pues tiene un gran talento para la cocina y de esta manera mantiene a su clientela satisfecha. Para más adelante Magno quiere mejorar la ambientación y presentación de su restaurante, adquiriendo nuevos artefactos y utensilios de cocina, pieza clave para la preparación de sus comidas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se siente muy motivado y comprometido a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita será destinado a la compra de sillas, mesas y utensilios de cocina como sartenes, pailas y espátulas nuevas.
texts.en:
Magno is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and his little son who is six. For the past three years he has had a business selling oriental food. He works every day from noon until very late at night. He leases his restaurant and it is located on one of the main streets in his city. This guarantees his business is good. Magno cooks the food. In fact he is a very talented cook and this is how he maintains satisfied customers. In the future, Magno would like to improve his restaurant’s ambience and appearance. He would like to buy new supplies and utensils for the kitchen. These supplies are key to his food preparation. This is the first loan he has had with MFP. He feels very motivated and committed to be punctual with his payments. The money that he requests will be used to buy chairs, tables and utensils for the kitchen such as frying pans, pans and new spatulas.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and supplies for his restaurant.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Miraculous Maria village bank. 
Sara is 58 years-old, married, and has five children who are 36, 35, 24, 18, and 16 years-old. Her last two are studying at an institute. 
She has a convenient store that she wants to expand. For this reason, she continues to work in the mornings cleaning houses. Her husband is a builder but there is not always work for him. 
Sara needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy a showcase and a desk. She is thankful to FINCA for the loans they give to her because they have helped her grow economically. Her dream is to continue progressing and to ensure that her children do not have as difficult a time as she did.

loans.use: buy a showcase and a desk

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega del departamento de Estelí, el señor Alvaro G. se dedica a atender su negocio de farmacia el cual lo inició desde hace nueve años y poco a poco lo ha venido desarrollando y ampliando.

Es importante destacar que el señor Alvaro es muy trabajador y se esfuerza mucho por mejorar la situación de su negocio y así suplir las necesidades de su familia que tanto depende de él.

loans.use: Compra de medicamentos

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero de Agosto” de distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Barrio Porteño, ella estudio educación superior completa (bellas artes).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de carne.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar degollados de cordero el cual vende en su puesto del mercado.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank “Primero de Agosto” (First of August), which is located in the District of Zepita, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children. Lucia lives in the Porteño neighborhood and completed her college education in fine arts.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan of 300 soles provided additional capital for her meat business. Lucia is now requesting a new loan of 2500 soles to purchase slaughtered lambs to sell from her market stall.

Her greatest hope is to continue working so that her children can get ahead. Lucia enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lambs

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
52-year-old Beatriz U. manages a hog-raising business in Sikatuna, Bohol.  She wants to expand her business in order to better support her family.  She has four children.  Her income is very helpful in sending her kids to school.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of Php 8,000.  This will help provide the feed for her piggery business.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan B. is a villager in Khnar Thum village in Takeo province. She is a weaver and she wants to expand her business by purchasing more raw materials. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Chheang Mao, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Phan B. is a mother of four children one of whom is a silk weaver while two others are employed in a garment factory and the youngest one is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave.

loans.name: Nathaniela

texts.en:
Nathaniela E. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Nathaniela is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Nathaniela owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling Ready to Wear items and cosmetics in the local community. Nathaniela has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nathaniela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nathaniela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nathaniela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Nathaniela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer D. 60 años, muy trabajadora y empeñosa; ella es viuda y vive en su casa propia con sus hijos y las familias D. ellos.

DesD. hace 3 años se dedica a la venta D. ropa, junto con una D. sus hijas, por lo que ambas se apoyan mutuamente saliendo a comprar juntas la mercadería.
Los fines D. semana salen a uno D. los mercados más concurridos D. su distrito para comercializar sus prendas y así obtener mejores ingresos. 
Victoria está muy contenta con su trabajo, pues le permite despejarse D. las preocupaciones y sentirse útil para su familia, apoyando con los gastos D. la casa. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy responsable, por lo cual no tendrá problemas con el pago D. sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería en ropa y así obtendrá mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Victoria is an enterprising and hard-working 60 year old woman. She is a widow, and she lives in her own house with her children and their families. For three years she has been selling clothes with one of her daughters. They both mutually help each other as they go to buy the merchandise together. On the week ends they go to the most popular markets in their district to sell their clothes and get better earnings. Victoria is very happy with her work. It allows her to leave behind her worries and to feel useful to her family, helping them with the household expenses. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to be very responsible, and she will not have problems with her payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of clothing in order to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Morn Orm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn O. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She also breeds pigs and chickens. She is a 39-year-old widow with a child who is attending the local school. She is applying for a loan to buy a cow to breed to earn more income.

This village bank loan is for 18 people located in Prey Ta Khab village in Takeo province. The members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Morn O. is the village bank president. Mrs. Em Yim is the group guarantor of this village bank and she is shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: José Alejandro Ramírez C. de 36 años de edad, reside en Olocuilta, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su compañera de vida la cual se dedica a trabajar para una empresa privada. José posee una venta de accesorios eléctricos, como extensiones y cables, así mismo comercializa controles, antenas y cables para televisores, y otros productos varios como pegamento, baterías y desarmadores. También posee un taller de reparación de radios y televisores, ambos negocios están ubicados en el centro de San Salvador, lugar muy estratégico en el cual transita una gran cantidad de personas, lo que resulta ser  de mucho beneficio para José, puesto que cuenta con muchos clientes. José solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar mayor cantidad de herramientas, así también comprar repuestos para los electrodomésticos que repara. Él es una persona muy visionaria quien anhela seguir adelante y mejorar su negocio, invirtiendo más en el y obteniendo nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
José Alejandro Ramírez C. is 36 years old and lives in Olocuilta, located in the department of La Paz. He lives with his life partner, who works for private company. Jose has a business selling electronic accessories, such as extension cords and cables. He also sells remote controls, antennas and television cables, and a variety of other products such as adhesives, batteries and screwdrivers. In addition he has a workshop where he repairs radios and television sets. Both businesses are located in the center of San Salvador, a strategic location since a large quantity of people transit through the area. This is a big benefit for Jose, since he is able to have a lot of customers. Jose requests a loan so that he can buy a greater quantity of tools. He will also use the loan to buy spare parts for the electronic devices that he repairs. He is a person who is very visionary and who desires to continue to advance and improve his business by investing more in it and getting additional customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for electronic devices

location.town: Olocuilta en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce, la señora María Teresa M. se desempeña en el secretariado con el fin de llevar a cabo su sueño de construir su casa de habitación que tanto lo requiere porque ha estado en malas condiciones y ella anhela brindarle a su familia un techo digno donde habitar. Por estas razones es que está solicitando el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción tales como ladrillos, cemento y arena y así continuar con dicha labor para brindarle a su familia las condiciones de vida necesarias.
Ella espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así hará realidad su sueño de tener un local digno donde habitar en familia.
texts.en:
María Teresa M. works as a secretary in the town of El Sauce. Her dream is to complete building her home, which has been in poor condition. She wants to provide her family with a worthy home in which to live. She is asking for funding to buy building materials like bricks, cement and sand so that she can continue with her project and provide her family with life's basic needs. She hopes to have the loan granted so that her dream of a worthy home for her family may come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building supplies.

loans.name: Fatou Diop

texts.fr: Madame Fatou Diop S. est une dame de 35 ans qui habite a Yoff Layenne. Elle est sociétaire de   la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis 2003. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont l’âgé  varie entre 2 et 8 ans. Après la terminale elle a commence à exercer le commerce de parfums, d’encens et de blousons et ceci depuis 10 ans. Dans un premier temps elle se procurait des produis chez d’autres commerçants qu’elle plaçait, récupérait ses bénéfices et remboursait le capital. Grace aux conseils de son père elle a décidé de solliciter de la mutuelle un prêt de 50 000 frs pour acheter lui-même les produits vendus à des prix plus compétitifs. La réalisation de bénéfices lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou Diop S. is a 35-year-old lady who lives in Yoff Layenne. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC Yoff savings group (one of Kiva's field partners) since 2003. She is married and has two children whose ages range from 2 to 8 years. After finishing high school, she has been selling perfume, incense, jackets, and so on for 10 years. At first, she used to procure her goods from other merchants whom she found, then earned her profit and repaid the capital. Thanks to her father's advice, she has decided to seek a loan through the savings group for 50,000 FCFA to buy the goods herself at more competitive prices. The realization of profits allows her to improve her children's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Nilda Karina

texts.es:
Nilda es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de La Unión, un distrito de la zona rural de la provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la preparación y venta de chicha (bebida típica del país); el lugar está ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha desde hace nueve años, adicionalmente también vende cerveza en su domicilio, este negocio es de mucha ayuda para los ingresos familiares, ya que su esposo trabaja como peón agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

La chicha es una bebida tipica de todo el país, esta elaborada  base de una variedad de maiz y es muy consumida por las personas que viven en las zonas rurales ya que se cree que les da energía para continuar con sus trabajos.

Nilda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para la elaboración de chicha, así como en la compra de más cerveza, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Nilda is a 30 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the District of La Unión, which lies in a rural area within the Province and Region of Piura. The majority of its inhabitants prepares and sells “chicha” (a traditional beverage of the country). This place is located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque Region.

Nilda has been making and selling chicha for nine years. She also sells beer out of her home. This business has been of great help for the family income. Her husband already works as a farm laborer, but his earnings are not enough to meet the family expenses.

Chicha is a traditional beverage found throughout the country. It is made from a variety of corn and is widely consumed by people who live in the rural areas since it is believed to provide a boost of energy needed to finish their jobs. Nilda hopes to grow her business by purchasing more supplies for making chicha, as well as more beer. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edypyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. She is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals and develop into good people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & ingredients for making "chicha"

loans.name: Ismatulla

texts.en:
K. Ismatulla is 56 years old. He is married with two children. From the time he was young, Ismatulla was learning to work in a small business with his parents. With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lived. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice and seeing his family progressing more and more. 

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children; he hopes to see them as professional, ethical and hard-working. For this reason Ismatulla is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni. He wants this loan to buy additional livestock. Be an important part of the growth of Ismatulla’s business!   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more livestock

loans.name: Hanatbek

texts.en:
Hanatbek is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. During the day, Hanatbek operates a taxi service business in his province. He has been operating his business since 2008 with his own car.

Recently, he purchased a Korean car in order to retire his old car. His daily revenue is between 20,000 and 25,000 tugrugs (~20 USD) and his net profit is 50%. Hanatbek is a hardworking person with a good personality. He is focused on the future and says, “I would like to improve my car in order to provide more convenient services to my customers and to earn more profits.” He is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~845 USD) loan for car repairs and to purchase new tires.

loans.use: For car repairs and to purchase new tires

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita L. y su esposo el señor Jorge Álvarez son padres de familia y tienen tres hijos pequeños que están actual mente estudiando, pero les están exigiendo que tenga que pagar la colegiatura y comprar útiles escolares que les está haciendo falta para poder terminar el siclo escolar de este año. 
Solicitan el préstamo ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir esta necesidad escolar. 
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe de su trabajo como operaria de una fabrica, ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que percibe de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes en el área de despachador.  
Desean que sus hijos tengan la educación y el estudio necesario para su futuro.
texts.en:
Margarita L. and her husband Jorge Álvarez are the parents of 3 small children. The children are currently in school, but the school is demanding that they must pay the tuition and buy school supplies if they want to be able to finish out the current school year. They are requesting a loan, as they do not have the money needed to cover these school expenses. They intend to pay off the loan with the income that she earns from her job as an employee in a factory, since her husband will take care of the household expenses with the salary he earns working for a transportation company as a dispatcher. They want their children to have the education and studies that they will need for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: school expenses

loans.name: Myrna's Group

texts.en: Myrna S. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 50 years old and is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Myrna is married and their main source of income comes from the income of her husband as a tricycle (a motorcycle with a passenger cab attached to the side) driver. Myrna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 24,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Julia Del Socorro

texts.es:
la sra. Julia del Socorro R. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene vaR. años de dedicarse a este tipo de actiividad, vive en la aldea de San Bernardo, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para empezar la produccion de las tortillas y luego salir a venderlas
Julia y su esposo han sido bien responsables con sus hijos, los han sacado adelante, Julia y su esposo solo viven con una hija que es la que le ayuda a hacer sus tortillas.  
doña Julia necesita incrementar su produccion ya que ahora tiene mas clientes y no se da abasto para cubrir con las necesidades de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para tener una mayor produccion.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con lso gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Miss Julia del Socorro R. makes and sells tortillas. She has been doing this for several years. She lives in the town of San Bernardo. Everyday she gets up at 5 in the morning to begin making tortillas and then she goes out to sell them. Julia and her husband have been very responsible with their children, whom they have provided for. Julia and her husband now live with one daughter who helps make the tortillas. Miss Julia needs to increase her production since now she has more customers and she does not have the supply to cover their needs. She will use the loan to buy more materials to increase her production. She needs the income in order to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood, water, matches, and cornflour

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en: Arnel D. is from Barangay Quezon, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 45 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Arnel owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP per harvest. In 2009, Arnel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Arnel is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This loan will be his second from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase his crop yield

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza R. is from the municipality of Salay in Misamis Oriental Province. She is 36 years old. Analiza is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years, and she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Haby B. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de BOYINGUEL depuis 2007. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Elle mène cette activité avec son mari qui l'aide dans l'entretien des animaux.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter une paire de bœufs et des produits vétos. Elle engraissera les bœufs pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone 

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Haby B. is a 46 year old married woman with the responsibility of bringing up 6 children. She has been a member of the Boyinguel Village Bank since 2007. Haby raises cattle. She manages this business along with her husband, who helps her with the animals. With this new loan she will buy two beef cattle and feed products. She will fatten the cattle for 5 months before selling them at the weekly market places in her area. Her goal is to meet her family's financial needs and increase her savings.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two beef cattle

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en: Chrispine is 26 years old and single.  He sells (mitumba) second-hand clothes to earn a living.  He also sells polythene bags for extra income.  He has been running his business for three years and has employed one person.  Being a member of Blessed group in Faulu Kenya, he has been motivated to work hard in his business.  He also uses his savings with the group to invest in his business.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to add to his clothing stock.  He hopes to expand his shop into a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To add to his stock of clothes

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 45-year-old lady who has been living in Borewala with her family for the last 15 years. Borewala is a small city which is located in south Punjab Pakistan.

She is the mother of two sons, both of whom are running their  own businesses. Her elder son has a business of selling cosmetics while the youngest one is operating a sewing business. 

She supports her husband financially by doing embroidery on dresses. She takes orders from nearby customers and fulfills them on time to make an income. She is good in her art and has a good reputation for her quality of work among her customers. 

Her husband is a tailor by profession. He runs his tailoring shop in the market. He can sew both gents & ladies clothes and gets a reasonable income. Due to having a tailoring business, Rukhsana gets regular orders every month and also provides her customers the services of sewing clothes as well.
  
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who will buy a sewing machine and hire an assistant to expand his income. This will enable him to fulfill larger orders in short periods of time. Rukhsana thinks that regular investment is very necessary for making a positive impact on a business. She is very confident that by using his work experience, her husband will be able to successfully upgrade his business.
 
She is in her 4th loan cycle. In the previous loan cycles she has maintained good credit and never missed single meeting.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and hire an assistant

loans.name: Yoro

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yoro D. est un jeune tailleur de 35 ans qui habite à Nimzatt      dans la localité de Guediawaye. C’est un chef de famille, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il a aussi en charge deux autres parents sous sa tutelle.
N’ayant pas réussi dans les études, il s’est orienté vers l’apprentissage du métier de tailleur qui est une activité qu’il a choisi par amour. Ainsi depuis 1994 il a commencé à exercer pleinement son métier  et c’est depuis 4 ans qu’il a acquit son propre atelier. Il fait du prêt à porter  et confectionne des boubous  qui sont très sollicités par les nigérians. Monsieur D. est sociétaire à la caisse de Baye Laye depuis le mois de mai 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui sera destiné dans son intégralité à la confection de prêts  a porter. Ce financement pourra contribuer au renforcement  du fond de monsieur D. ce qui lui permettra de répondre à la demande croissante de sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux subvenir à ses besoins de chef de famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Yoro D., 35, is a young tailor who lives in Nimzatt in the Guediawaye area. He is responsible for a family, married, the father of two children. He is also responsible for two other relatives who are his wards. Since he did not succeed in his studies, he took up an apprenticeship as a tailor which is an activity he chose because he loves it. Thus, since 1994, he has been working full time at this trade, and four years ago he got his own workshop. He makes ready-to-wear and "boubous" (long flowing traditional robes worn by men and women) which are much in demand among Nigerians. Mr. D. has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since May 2010. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs which will be totally used to fund the creation of ready-to-wear. This loan will bolster the working capital of Mr. D., who will then be able to meet the ever-growing demand of his clientele. The increase in profit will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: making ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Mahpurat's Group

texts.en: Mahpurat M. is the leader of this group. She is 37 and married; her husband is an employee of the highway organization. The couple brings up three children and all of them are schoolboys. Today, Mansura earns her living by working as a youth coordinator on a village board. The family needs a loan in order to buy a lorry-load (truck-load) of sand for house plastering. In the future Mahpurat wants to obtain a car. About the other members of the group: Turgunoi M., 51, is married and her husband is a farmer. Together, the couple brings up a son and two daughters. The son went to work in Russia and the daughters are students. In 1996, when the collective farms broke up. Turgunoi obtained a piece of land and started to cultivate wheat, maize, potatoes and tomatoes. By selling part of the harvest she makes 2,500 soms per month. With the loan, she wants to purchase fertilizers for farming. In the future she wants to build a house for her son. Zebi B., 59, is married with two daughters and a son. Her daughters are married and live separately with their own families and her son works in the police force. Zebi is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband is an employee of the social fund. Zebi resells cattle after fattening and in this way she makes 6,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to start repairing her house. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase a calf to raise. Sadyrbek T. is nineteen years old and is engaged in cattle breeding. He started to breed cattle two years ago with an initial investment of 1,500 soms and now sells cattle after fattening, making 6,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for him to purchase a TV and a DVD player. With the loan, he wants to purchase feed for his cattle. In the future he wants to build a house and open a bakery. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sand for house plastering

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Like most people in Surallah, 39-year-old Arlene is into the farming business. She is married with three children. Their education is her top priority. Aside from farming, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells products like soy sauce, detergent soap and many others. 

She applied for a loan to finance their school expenses and to buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She aims to increase profitability of her business. Her income will go to her family’s daily consumption, to her children’s education and to savings for the future.

loans.use: Farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Givaa

texts.en: Givaa B. is a 25-year-old single woman who lives with her parents in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her parents live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Givaa has been operating a cafe and computer service business since 2009 and relies on her parents’ previous experience of running a cafe. In the near future, she is planning to open a consumer goods business in a rented stall at the Baku trade center.  She is planning to have her boyfriend be responsible for managing the cafe business while she operates her retail business. Givaa is a modest, optimistic, and hard working woman who really wants to expand her businesses. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more food supplies for her cafe and buy a variety of consumer goods for her new business.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies

loans.name: Lida Johanna

texts.es:
Lida Johanna M. S. tiene 21 años. Es soltera vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene  hijos.

Lida pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Lida se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita  el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es hacer una casa.
Le gusta estudiar ingles
texts.en:
Lida Johanna M. S. is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. She does not have children.

Lida is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Lida is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. She purchases her supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in her community. Lida is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of her family. Her dream is to build a house

Lida enjoys studying English.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.en:
Jessica is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in a home which they own in the district of Tambogrande. It is a tropical region which is primarily populated by farmers and people who raise animals. There is also a small commercial sector.

Jessica sells clothing out of her home and in the streets. She has a number of loyal clients and is well known within the region. In addition, Jessica sells soy juice and tamales to the locals during breakfast and lunch hours. Her husband is a nurse in a nearby town and he comes home on a monthly basis to support her and spend time with the family.

This loan will be used to purchase additional clothing for sale. Jessica hopes to be able to expand her inventory and thereby increase the number of clients she reaches. By slowly building her business, she plans to increase her profits and the quality of life for her family. Jessica is well respected in the region and is a very hard worker. We are happy to be able to provide her with a loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing for sale

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en: Marie Josee is 39 years old. She is married and has four children who are between seven and thirteen years old. Her husband owns a shop. Marie Josee sells cassava and yams and has spent thirteen years in this business. She has requested a loan to buy more yams and cassava because it is in much demand by her customers. The profit from this business will be used for savings and to care for her family. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler, selling a variety of foodstuffs, in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and yams to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Nuris Isabel

texts.es: La señora Nuris C. S. es una alegre mujer que vive en Cartagena en compañía de su esposo y tres hijos. Tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en el cual ofrece el servicio de peinados, corte, tintes y planchado de cabello. Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica hace varios años con sus hermanas menores y luego perfeccionó sus técnicas con varios cursos en academias de educación técnica en Cartagena. Al principio la microempresaria sólo atendía a su círculo de amigos y familiares cercanos, pero con el paso del tiempo, su clientela fue creciendo y empezó a comprar herramientas y accesorios profesionales. Ella también vende carne de res en horas de la mañana a vecinos y amigos del barrio a quienes les acredita el producto para que le cancelen semanal o quincenalmente. Este es el segundo crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer Credikiva que planea invertir en la remodelación del piso de la sala donde funciona el salón de belleza y comprar más carne de res. Entre los dos negocios la usuaria obtiene una utilidad mensual aproximada de $700.000. Ella sueña con instalar un gran salón de estética en un lugar diferente a su residencia, con aire acondicionado y otras comodidades que le permitan ofrecer un mejor servicio. La mayor satisfacción que le genera el negocio a la señora Nuris es generar unos importantes ingresos que ayudan al sostenimiento del hogar y especialmente poder atender la educación y los tratamientos médicos de una hija discapacitada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nuris C. S. is a cheerful woman living in Cartagena with her husband and three children.  She has a small beauty salon where she offers hair styling, haircuts, hair coloring and hair straightening.  She learned this occupation empirically several years ago with her younger sisters and then perfected her techniques through several courses at technical education academies in Cartagena.

At the beginning she only took care of a small circle of friends and close family members at her micro business.  But with the passage of time, her clientele grew and she started buying tools and professional accessories.  

She also sells beef during the morning to friends and neighbors in the neighborhood.  She sells it to them on credit and they repay weekly or biweekly.

This is the second loan she has negotiated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first Kiva loan.  She plans to use it to remodel the floor in the room where her beauty salon operates and to buy more beef.

The two businesses together produce a monthly profit of approximately $700.000.  She dreams with setting up a great beauty salon in a different part of her residence with air conditioning and other comforts that will make it possible for her to offer better service.

Most of the satisfaction that the business generates for Nuris is in generating important income that helps support the household especially for the education and medical treatment of a handicapped daughter.

loans.use: To remodel the floor the living room where the beauty salon operates and to buy more beef.

loans.name: Mukisa Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en: 35-year-old M. Zulaika has been in the retail shop business for the last 7 years in Butiiki-Jinja. Before she embarked on this business journey, she was doing mostly house chores by virtue of the fact that she was a house wife. The need to sustain herself and her family however spawned ambitions in her to own her own business.   Zulaika, who is happily married with 5 kids, says rearing cows is her other business. Monthly, this business generates for her 300,000 shillings in profit. With this loan, Zulaika says she will purchase more retail commodities to resell in her shop.

loans.use: The purchase of more commodities to resell

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Don Julio César C. L., es trabajador de una empresa de Acueducto y Alcantarillado ocupando el puesto de Fontanero desde hace 20 años.

El es Casado de 51 años de edad, con tres personas a su cargo, dos de estas son menores de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Managua, en el barrio Pedro Joaquín Chamorro desde hace 8 años.

Este es su primer crédito que tiene con CEPRODEL, está agradecido por haberle brindado este préstamo, debido a es por medio de este que va lograr sacar adelante a su familia, mejorando la casa.
texts.en:
Don Julio César C. L. has worked as a plumber at an aqueduct and sewage company for 20 years.

He is 51 years old and married with three people under his care, two of which are minors.  He has lived in the Pedro Joaquín Chamorro area in the city of Managua for 8 years.

This is his first loan through CEPRODEL.  He is grateful for the opportunity the loan will give him to improve his home and help his family.

loans.use: For home improvement

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un B., age 37, is a fish vendor. She sells small quantities of fish in and around the province of Kompong Tom province. This is a business she has operated for more than ten years. Un B. buys her fish from a wholesale supplier. She usually earns a profit of approximately $1.30 per day to help support her family’s expenses. The family has another financial source in her husband, who works in the farming business. 

Un B. currently uses an old motorcycle for collecting her fish from the supplier, but it is in disrepair and presently inoperable. She has spent considerable amounts of money on repairs. In order to deal with this problem, Un B. is asking for a loan from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle to replacing the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to replace the broken one that she used to use for transporting her fish from the supplier

loans.name: Everlyne Vugudza

texts.en:
Everlyne L. is a 28-year-old enterprising lady from the county of Kakamega in western Kenya. She is single and supports only herself at the moment. 

She is a hardworking business lady who buys and supplies Irish potatoes in Kakamega town. She has been doing this business for the last two years and she makes a monthly income of approximately $240. 

Everlyne is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy thirty bags of potatoes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business. Her hope and dream is to become a major distributor of Irish potatoes to higher institutions of learning and to hotels.

loans.use: To buy 30 bags of Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria lives in Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Shanti nagar for the past twenty-four years. She is 44 years of age and has three children, two daughters and a son.
