Her son left his education after intermediate level and started working to financially contribute to the family. Her daughters are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Gloria shares the financial burden with her husband by doing sewing work. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her sewing business. She will use the loan in buying a new sewing machine that will help her complete her work more quickly and make more income. She has been doing this business for the past five years and is hopeful that an investment will bring more money and she will be able to provide better living facilities to her family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Gloria.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña María Luisa, resiD. en San Miguel, vive con su esposo solamente porque sus hijos tienen sus respectivos hogares, ella tiene 64 años D. edad, viven en casa propia y junto a su pareja realizan las labores D. la ganadería, crían ganado vacuno para la venta D. leche y crías, además destazan reces para vender una vez por semana, también venD. ropa.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. ganado D. repasto, esta compra será oportuna porque los animales tienen dos años D. edad, lo que significa que su carne es suave para el destazo.
El objetivo D. doña María Luisa es mantenerse con estabilidad laboral y que con su familia hagan crecer el negocio y mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa lives in a house that she owns in San Miguel with just her husband, as her children have their own homes. She is 64 years old and together with her husband, they work in cattle farming. They raise cattle to sell their milk and calves and they also butcher beef to sell once a week. She also sells clothing.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of beef cattle. This purchase is timely because the animals are two years old, which means that their meat is good for butchering. Maria Luisa’s goal is to have job stability and to work with her family so that the business grows and generates more income.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal ”SOL RADIANTE”, está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Roxana. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: costura de deportivos, cafetería, venta de salchipapas, punto de cabinas, artesanías, confección de deportivos, costura de blusas, venta de refrescos.
 
La presidenta, la señora Roxana es una mujer joven de  23 años es soltera. Esta es su primera ves que participa en asociaciones comunales. 

En la actualidad vende salchipapas en la puerta de su casa todos los días, con el crèdito que sacara comprara por mayor su mercadería (verdura para la elaboración de las salchipapas)

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella respondió que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The ”SOL RADIANTE” communal association is beginning its first cycle with the Los Andes office and is made up of eight women.  The advisory council has Roxana as its president.  The members are involved in different businesses, including making sports gear, cafeteria sales, salchipapa sales, cabins, crafts, blouse making, and soft drink sales.

Roxana is 23 years old and this is the first time that she has participated in a communal association.

She sells salchipapas out of her home every day and will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients (vegetables) in quantity.  When asked what she liked best about Pro Mujer (Professional Woman), she said "everything."

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Chap

texts.en:
Chap S. is 61 years old and a married woman who is a local cultivator in the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh city. Chap S. currently generates an income of approximately $4 per day from her farming business. Chap S. is married to 62-year-old, Choun Chenda, who is a professional teacher. The couple is blessed with four married kids and two are working at different jobs to earn a daily income. 

Chap S. will take out her first loan to purchase a machine that she can use to pump water for her crops.

loans.use: to purchase a pump.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from the village of Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lorna raises hogs.

Lorna has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP with which she will purchase more feed for her hogs. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Lorna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Mamlakatkhon's Group

texts.en:
Mamlakatkhon is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised a daughter and a son. The son, 26, works in Russia and the daughter, 16, studies at school. Malakatkhon works as a librarian at school. At the moment the family keeps three cows, and the profits gained from milk sales help the family meet their daily needs. Selling the dairy products, the family makes an additional $55 per month. Mamlakatkhon applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a calf in order to increase the number of cattle stock. In autumn she plans to celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam  is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Le Xa village, Mai Hien commune, Dong Anh district. She and her husband are farmers. Her family has a monthly income of 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2009 and repaid her loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she is requesting a loan for  8,502,000 VND to invest in livestock.

loans.use: to invest in livestock.

loans.name: Bertha Piedad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bertha, tiene 65 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y la dejo sola con sus seis hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun vive en su casa.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que busco la forma de sacar adelante a sus hijos,  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, trabaja los tres últimos días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y nos cuenta que la mayor parte de sus ventas las hace bajo pedido, en estos tres días  ella  realiza las ventas, entrega los pedidos y cobra ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Compra su mercadería  en Guayaquil ya que allá consigue más variedad de productos. Lleva tres años en este negocio, antes se dedicaba a otra actividad pero no le fue tan bien como con el negocio de ropa.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar jean de mujeres y hombres, camisetas y blusas ya que tiene muchos encargos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por las reuniones educativas ya que aprende mucho.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener un almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Rosario Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture.  It is also known for its handicrafts, which are recognized on a national and international level.  Most of the inhabitants here devote themselves to making buttons out of “tagua” (Tagua has been called 'vegetable ivory' because the hard tagua nut has a white endosperm similar to elephant ivory), handicrafts, and general commerce.

This is where we meet Bertha, age 65.  Several years ago her beloved husband died.  His death left her alone with their six children.  Now they are adults, and the youngest still lives in her house.

She is a very good housewife who searched for the way to get her children ahead.  She sells all types of clothes.  She works the last three days of the week, and she sells door to door.  She tells us that the majority of her sales are done through orders.  On these three days she makes sales, delivers orders, and collects because she extends credit.  She collects every two weeks.  

She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil because that is where she gets a greater variety of products.  She has had this business for three years.  Before that she had another business activity, but it did not go as well for her as her clothing business.

She will use this loan to buy women’s and men’s jeans, t-shirts, and blouses because she has a lot of orders.  She has been in the communal bank from its inception.  She likes the educational meetings because she learns a lot.

Her goals are to get ahead in her business and to have a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy women’s and men’s jeans, t-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Yeral

texts.en:
Yeral was born to be a businessman. “It’s in my blood,” he says. Growing up in Chimbote, Peru, his interest in business was piqued early by watching his parents. His father worked at a local restaurant while his mother sold vegetables and fruits. Oftentimes, he would join his mother on these pursuits and learned the tricks of the trade from her.

His parents’ tremendous influence stayed with him as he moved from Peru to San Francisco in 2004. While working a series of miscellaneous jobs, Yeral’s desire to open up his own business grew. However, as a recent immigrant, he didn’t know how to get things started.

In 2010, his drive to become an entrepreneur propelled him to get into business the way he knew best:  Yeral began serving delicious Peruvian treats at food festivals.  In order to secure a spot at a Peruvian Food Festival, he needed a loan to pay the initial fee but when he turned to a major bank, he was refused credit because he did not have tax returns, a business license or a business bank account. 

Without a set destination, he marched through San Francisco’s Mission district, adamant that somewhere in the sea of pay-day loans and pawn shops, he would find a financial institution that would help him.  At last, he stumbled upon Opportunity Fund, where the staff recognized his potential and his passion.  Yeral got the cash he needed to capitalize his business, as well as a foothold into the mainstream American financial system.

At last year’s Peruvian Food Festival, Yeral sold over 400 plates of food and gained recognition for his talent making tasty Peruvian treats.  He wants to return again this year, and this time he expects to sell closer to 800 plates of food, doubling his business over last year. Yeral needs a second loan for $4,000 in order to buy more inventory and secure his spot at this year’s Peruvian Food Festival, which will be held in July.  

Currently, Yeral devotes 50% of his time to expanding his business and he spends the other 50% working at a bar. He aims to expand his business so that one day he can devote 100% of his energy to serving delicious Peruvian treats.

loans.use: to buy more inventory and secure his spot at this year’s Peruvian Food Festival.

loans.name: Racana Group

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe es casada, tiene 23 años D. edad, curso dos años D. educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales aun no estudian, se dedica a la confección D. blusas, inicia este negocio en la casa D. ella, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo  D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar telas para confeccionar blusas, ya que en el futuro espera tener un local propio para venta D. blusas y ropa típica. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, venta D. dulces y gomas D. mascar, venta D. leña y a la venta D. blusas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is married and is 23 years old.  She completed two years of elementary school.  She has 2 children who are not yet in school.  She has a business making blouses, which she started in her house.  She has 10 years of experience in this traD., and she has the support of her husband, who is a merchant.

She decided to organize a group with the objective of requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to buy fabric to make blouses, since in the future she hopes to have her own store where she can sell blouses and traditional Guatemalan clothing.  The other members of the group work in retail traD. selling sweets, chewing gum, firewood and blouses.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is married and her husband operates a construction supplies business. He is very good in his customer dealings and receives a good number of orders every month. 
Nazia is a housewife as well as a working lady. She sells cattle such as sheep and goats. She buys them when they are young and sells them after raising them up. She also operates a thread-making business. She purchases old warm clothes and gets thread out of them to earn extra income for her family. 
Nazia has a daughter who is four years old and has not started her education yet. She has a plan to enroll her daughter in a school next year. 
Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for buying sheep and goats for her animal sales business. She has a plan to sell sheep and goats on Eid (a Muslim occasion when people buy animals for slaughtering). She has been operating her business for some time now and hopes that she will make good profits. Nazia is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for animal sales business.

loans.name: Gerandia

texts.en:
Gerandia is a 49-year-old widowed woman. She has 3 adult dependents living with her in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is engaged in banana production to earn a living. Gerandia has been doing this for 15 years. With this kind of work,  she got the chance to send all her children to school. Approximately, she makes PHP 3,000 a month.

Earlier this year, Gerandia joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase young raised banana trees of a different type to plant. She hopes for a good production to gain more income. Gerandia plans to buy a motorcycle to transport goods easily.

loans.use: To purchase young raised banana trees of a different type to plant.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 50 años quien tiene una refresquería y carnicería desde hace 4 años. Ella inicio con la venta de refrescos naturales  y con las ganancias empezó a vender carne.
Ella con el préstamo invertirá en pollo y su meta es comprarse un frízer más grande.
texts.en:
Mrs Leticia is a hard-working and enterprising woman, age 50, who has had a drink store and butcher's shop for 4 years. She started off selling natural drinks, and with her income she started to sell meat.
With this loan, she will invest in chicken. Her goal is to buy herself a larger freezer.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo, de 41 años, es un hombre muy laborioso, vive en su casa propia y se esmera a diario por sobre salir adelante  junto a su esposa e hijos. El trabajo que realiza Pablo es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café y frutas cítricas, esta labor lo realiza junto a su pareja quien también se esmera arduamente en remolcar la tierra. Pablo vio por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene por sus granos. Cuando su trabajo se le acumula no duda en contratar jornaleros para que tenga mayor avance en cuanto a su faena. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la libertad de poder respirar el viento fresco que rodea todo el valle del Río Apurimac. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino de recorrido es muy largo y agotador desde su chacra hasta los tendales ya que es allí donde realiza el secado respectivo de sus productos. Más adelante espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este será su décimo préstamo de Pablo con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que no quiere causar problemas a la entidad financiera y agradece a los prestatarios por apoyarle en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los 3,000  mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y sacos de abono para mejorar  y aumentar su producción
texts.en:
Pablo, 41, is a very hardworking man. He lives in his own house and does his best daily to get ahead, together with his wife and children. Pablo works the land, where he cultivates cacao, coffee and citrus trees. He labors alongside his partner who also takes great pains to work the soil.

Pablo finds it convenient to take his products to the city of San Francisco since he states it is there where he can obtain the best prices for his crops. When his tasks are overwhelming, he does not hesitate to contract day laborers in order to speed up his work.

What he most likes about his work is that he has the freedom to breathe the fresh air surrounding the valley of Rio Apurimac. He has been doing this work for 15 years and considers his most difficult task that of transporting his products, since the road he has to travel is a very long and exhausting one from his farm to the drying area where his crops are dried. Later he hopes to buy new land in order to increase his production.

This will be Pablo’s tenth loan from MFP. He expects to be very punctual in his payments, since he does not want to cause any problems and is grateful to the lenders for supporting him in his work. With the 3,000 nuevos soles requested, he will buy cacao seeds and sacks of fertilizer in order to improve and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is married with four children. He is 36 years old and lives in Esperanza, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. Edwin has been in his business for 7 years. He raises pigs for sale to earn a living. He earns 15,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) with this line of business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase feed for his newborn piglets.

Edwin has been a member of GDMPC for one year. He is hoping to have his own motor cart or motorcycle that he can use to purchase feed and for the delivery of pigs to the buyer.

======================================

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

location.town: ESPERANZA, RAMON MAGSAYSAY, ZAMBOANA DEL SUR

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman. She has three school going children. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transportation. 

Asha has operated a weaving business for the past nine years. In addition, she has a motorcycle transport business, which contributes as her other source of income. Her potential clients are the area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her business standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ines Lucila

texts.es:
Inés de  47 años, una mujer muy trabajadora y honrada, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Suburbio”. 
Su negocio es una pequeña tienda ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda.  Ya que desde muy pequeña le gustaba el comercio.
Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo, inicia de las 6:00am hasta las 23:00pm.
Su dificultad es que le falta mercadería, no tiene muchos suministros necesarias para la venta.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el incremento de su negocio, para la compra de mercadería  como: arroz, aceites, atún, etc. y el mejoramiento de su pequeño local que está ubicado en su vivienda.
Su sueño es que su tienda crezca y así pueda tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Inés is 47 years old. She is a very hardworking and honest woman who lives in a suburb called "Suburbio". She has a small business located in the front part of her house, as since young she has liked business. She works from Monday to Sunday from 6:00am until 23:00pm. Her difficulty is that she doesn't have enough merchadise or supplies necessary to sell. 

She is asking for a loan to grow her business, to buy merchandise such as: rice, oil, tuna, etc., and improve the small locale located in her house. Her dream is that her business grow so that she can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, oil, tuna, etc.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband she is bringing up a daughter and a son. The daughter studies at school and the son is still preschool age. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 30,000 soms, Nazira started to breed cattle with the help of her husband. In her opinion it is an effective way of investing money. She is applying for this loan because she needs money to purchase more farm animals for breeding, fattening and reselling. In the future Nazira plans to expand a shed to be able to keep more animals.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding, fattening and reselling.

loans.name: Alex Omar

texts.es:
El señor Alex tiene 37 años de edad y vive en la aldea rural de Tapikilares en el municipio de San Francisco Yojoa. Lleva 15 años de casado con su esposa Mirna y la pareja tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 2 años de edad. 

Alex se dedica al cultivo de maíz y actualmente cultiva dos manzanas de tierra. Aprendió el oficio de sus padres, los cuales eran agricultores. Alex se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que fue niño y  continúa esa actividad heredada para mejorar su nivel de vida familiar. Sus hijos también colaboran en las actividades agrícolas cuando no están estudiando. 

Normalmente después de la cosecha, Alex se lleva el maíz al mercado para vender y negociar. Cuando hay abundancia de maíz, los precios bajan. Cuando hay escasez, Alex no tiene que ir al mercado porque los compradores salgan a buscar maíz en comunidades como el suyo. Alex se aprovecha para subir sus precios y así recibe mejores ingresos. 

Alex va a utilizar este crédito de L5000 para invertir en el cultivo. Es el primer crédito que él maneja. El espera continuar la actividad agrícola para terminar de educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alex, age 37, lives in the rural village of Tapikilares in the San Francisco Yojoa municipality.  He has been married to his wife, Mirna, for 15 years.  The couple has three children; ages 15, 13, and 2.

Alex grows corn, and he currently has two “manzanas” (a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters or 1.728 acres) of land.  He learned this trade from his parents, who were farmers.  Alex has devoted himself to farming since he was a boy.  He continues with this business activity that he inherited in order to improve his family’s standard of living.  His children also participate in the farming activities when they are not in school.

After the harvest Alex usually takes the corn to the market to sell and to trade.  When there is an abundance of corn the prices drop.  When there is a scarcity, Alex does not have to go to the market because the buyers come to look for corn in communities like his.  Alex takes advantage of this to raise his prices and get better income.

Alex will use this loan for 5,000 lempiras to invest in farming.  This is the first loan that he has managed.  He hopes to continue with the farming activity in order to finish educating his children.

loans.use: to invest in growing corn.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 51 years old and is married with one child. He lives in Candanay Sur, Siquijor, Siquijor. Virgilio runs an electronics shop and earns 14,000 PHP doing this work. He has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for seven months.

Virgilio is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to purchase assorted accessories for his shop. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase electronic accessories to sell

loans.name: Musalaba F.a Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Musalaba F. A. Group in Western Kenya! 

Philisters takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Philisters will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

Philisters is the facilitator of the Musalaba F. A. group. She is pictured with her group members. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Musalaba F.A. group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Philisters and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives). Florence has a business of raising chicken.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Florence sells her products from home. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chicks and feeds. The main business challenges for Florence include transportation of chicken feeds and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 1500 chickens and to own a delivery van to ease transportation. Florence lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and feeds

loans.name: Ligia Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Ligia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, Cuenca es muy rica en historia, cultura y tradiciones, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Ligia tiene 37 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 6 hijos  de 22, 19, 17, 14, 12 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo es soltero, su segunda hija es casada y viven independientemente, su tercer hijo trabaja, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. ligia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa usada encontrándose en esta actividad hace 13 años, también vende ropa nueva pero solo bajo pedido hace seis meses, su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad en su tiempo libre,. También se dedica a la limpieza de una casa actividad en la que labora medio día.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa usada para crecer en su negocio. 

Su meta es llegar a tener su propio capital y no tener que pedir prestado.
texts.en:
Ligia is a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that has been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity since 1999.  Cuenca is very rich in history, culture and traditions.  It has a varied cuisine and its residents maintain the culture and tradition of its peoples.

Ligia is 37 years old living in a common law relationship and has 6 children who are 22, 19, 17, 14, 12 and 7 years old.  Her oldest son is single, her next daughter is married and they live independently.  Her third son works, two of her children are attending secondary school and her youngest attends a local little elementary school.  Her husband works as a private employee.  She does not own a house, she rents.

Ligia sells all types of used clothes; she’s been in business 13 years.  She’s also been selling new clothes for the last six months but only on prior order.  She sells her merchandise throughout the city in her free time.  She also works half days cleaning a house.

This is the third loan she’s taken in the communal bank and will use it to buy used clothes to increase her business.  Her goal is to have her own capital and not have to ask for loans.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Herminia es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 2 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad que trabajan de forma independiente.
Herminia cuenta que tiene una Frutería y Verdulería en el Mercado Municipal de Santaní, gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ya pudo formarse una buena clientela, y como consecuencia un buen ingreso. Ella comenta que se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante y de esa forma tener un poco más de ingresos, para poder tener una vejez sin problemas.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar frutas de estación, como ser melones, sandías, uvas, y demás con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Sra. Herminia is from the city of Santaní. She is 64 years old, widowed, and has two grown children who work independently. She has a fruit and vegetable stand at the municipal market in Santaní. Thanks to the high quality of products that she offers, she has been able to establish a good customer base and earn a good income. She says that she strives to move forward so that she can generate a little more income and have a retirement that is problem-free.

Herminia is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits such as melons, watermelons, grapes, and other types of products so that she can restock her inventory and meet the demand of her customers. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is  a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya, aged 43 and with 12 years of experience in farming and specifically the dairy, tea and poultry farming business.She is married with two children aged 15 and 6 years and both schooling.

Irene has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her farming business. She has plans to use half of the loan to buy more poultry birds and the other half to buy a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to continue improving her farming so as to make it her core business and meet her family needs from it. She would also like to buy more land for more commercial-based farming.

Irene says the challenge is in their limited parcels of land and poor market prices for farm produce.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edwin Tomas

texts.en:
My name is Edwin and I sell new clothes such as blouses, shirts, boy's clothing,and underclothes. I have been in business for 1 year, whihc is located in Danli. My wife helps me with my business. We are able to grow with the income that we have, however we want to re-construct our house.

Me llamo Edwin y me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, ropa de niño y ropa interior, mi negocio lo tengo desde hace 1 año y esta ubicado en uno de los boulevares de Danli. El negocio es familiar es decir mi esposa me ayuda a vender. Con los ingresos que tenemos de las ventas hemos podido hacer crecer nuestro negocio un poco mas, pero ahora queremos construir nuestra casa, por eso necesitamos invertir en la compra de mas mercaderia para incrementar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de camisas, blusas, ropa interior y otros.

loans.name: Galib

texts.en:
Galib lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region  He is 42, married, has 2 children.  
He needs a loan of $1000 to buy a water heater for his hair dressing salon.
Galib has a strong belief that he will get more clients after purchasing all the equipment needed for a modern salon and this will lead to increased income.He has worked in this salon for 4 years.
This business has allowed him to provide a good source of income for his family .
He made an a strong effort to improve his services.
His salon attracts regular clients.

loans.use: To buy a water heater

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of quality shoes

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Sawing and selling wood is a good business for Mrs. Queen E. and she needs much funds for the business. She has zeal for expanding her business and that is why she needs funds. She hails from a semi-urban area of Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy additional machinery and wood to sell

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro lives in San Juanito, Chihuahua. She is married and has 2 children. Her children were her main motivation to start her own business years ago. She previously used to work in the United States in a mechanic shop. She learned the trade well, and when she went back to Mexico she decided to open up a mechanic shop with the help of her husband. Together they have been able to run a succesful business and provide great customer service.

In order to continue to grow, Socorro is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD which she will use to purchase the material she needs to do car repairs. Since car parts/material is scarce in the area where she lives, she needs to place an order and leave a deposit. She commits to repay this amount within 3 months. By helping this family, you will also help their quality of life. They will always be thankful!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de San Juanito vive Socorro, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio, anteriormente ella trabajaba en Estados Unidos en una carrocería, ahí aprendió este oficio y ante la falta de empleo que hay en México decidió emprender su negocio donde recibe la ayuda de su esposo, juntos han logrado hacer crecer el negocio y mejorar la calida del servicio que ofrecen.

Para continuar creciendo, Socorro está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra del material que necesitan en las reparaciones, y como es muy escaso en su localidad necesitan hacer un pedido y quiere dejar una parte en reserva, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán siempre.

loans.use: To purchase more material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase seats for cafe.

loans.name: Thi Cuc

texts.vi:
Ms Cúc is 24 years old. She is married and has a young child. She is a hard working woman. She has a small butcher stand at the market selling pork and pork sausages. Everyday she wakes up very early to pick up the pork and the sausages from her trusted suppliers to assure the quality. Usually she sells out everything before noon. She would like to obtain a loan so that she could add beef and chickens to her butcher stand. Her income is stable so she will be able to make weekly repayment.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Cúc 24 tuổi, có chồng và có 1 con nhỏ. Chị là người phụ nữ chịu khó làm ăn. Chị đi chợ bán thịt lợn và giò chả. Hàng ngày chị dậy từ rất sớm để đi lấy hàng. Chị lấy hàng ở những mối quen nên rất đảm bảo chất lượng và hợp vệ sinh. Hàng chị bán trong vòng buổi sáng là hết. Có những lúc không có đủ hàng để bán cho khách. Chị rất mong được vay vốn để mở rộng mặt hàng của mình có thể là thịt bò hoặc thịt gà. Thu nhập của chị rất ổn định nên việc hoàn trả vốn theo tuần là rất phù hợp với chị.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for sales

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina has lived entirely off agricultural activities over the last 20 years growing potatoes, peas, barley and broad beans; she desires to continue in her noble management because she wants her four children to continue to study until they can create a prominent future for themselves. She thinks this year she will directly market the products of her harvest, before she did it through intermediaries who reduced the prices of her products and she didn’t see the profits that she deserved for the arduous work that she did. Alejandrina and her husband leave their home when the first rays of the sun appear to check the growth of their vegetables, checking daily if the presence of a plague or sickness appears in their fields, they carefully fertilize so that they grow strong while letting the animals go free so that they can obtain their daily sustenance from mother nature. This last activity is important to support of the family economy and with the objective of bettering the breed of their dear little animals; they solicit the help of your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina, vive enteramente D. las actividades agrícolas desD. hace 20 años sembrando papa, arveja, cebada y habas, desea continuar en su noble desenvolvimiento porque quiere que sus cuatro hijos sigan dedicándose a estudiar a fin D. que puedan forjarse un futuro prominente. Piensa este año comercializar directamente los productos D. su cosecha, antes lo hacia por medio D. intermediarios que abaratan los costos D. sus productos y no veía las ganancias que merecía por el arduo trabajo que realizaba.Alejandrina y D. esposo abandonan su morada en cuanto los primeros rayos del sol se hacen presente para verificar el crecimiento D. sus vegetales, verificando diariamente si existe la presencia D. alguna plaga o enfermedad en sus campos, los abonan cuidadosamente para que crezcan fuertes mientras dejan libres a sus animalitos para que éstos obtengan su alimento diario D. la madre naturaleza. Ésta última actividad es el importante soporte D. su economía familiar y con el objetivo D. mejorar la raza D. sus queridos animalitos, solicita la ayuda D. vuestro noble corazón.

loans.use: Ther purchase of young animals of a better breed.

loans.name: Jerónima Esperanza

texts.es:
Jeronima P. has beeen selling a wide assortment of fruits and vegetables from her stand in the Leon station market for 50 long years. Before she began this work, she was a housewife, but she realized the difficulty of covering the household costs and decided to use her small savings to purchase fruits and vegetables to later sell.

It is clear that she needs to invest in the infrastructure of her stand. The roof is in poor condition and when it rains her merchandise gets soaked. Senora P. has been working with loans from Ceprodel to stock her business in larger quantities. Her primary goal is to be able to construct her own stand so she will be able to offer better service to all of her customers. She has received 5 loaons so far with Ceprodel.

Yuca, pipianes, repollos, hierba buena, naranjas agrias, etc. son los productos que muy esforzadamente vende la señora Jeronima P. en el mercado la Estación en León desde hace 50 largos años. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad su labor era desempeñarse como ama de casa, pero al contemplar que difícilmente cubría los gastos de su hogar decide invertir su poco capital en la compra de verduras para luego comercializarlas.

No podemos pasar por alto que le es de mucha utilidad invertir en la infraestructura de su negocio ya que actualmente su techo y pared están en malas condiciones por lo que en momentos de lluvia sus productos se mojan.

Muy sabiamente, la señora P. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para surtir su negocio con mayores volúmenes de productos de verduras, su mayor anhelo es construir su propio tramo para brindar un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes. Su record es de 5 créditos con ceprodel.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF HER SMALL MARKET STAND.  THE ROOF IS IN BAD CONDITION AND HER MERCHANDISE IS GETTING SOAKED WHEN IT RAINS.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
As a kid, Maricela S. observed that her parents used to raise pigs, in order to obtain an extra income to help with the household expenses. When she got married, she gave this activity a try as well, with good results. It has helped build her house. She presently wants to set up more pigsties, in order to increase the number of pigs she raises. For this reason, she is requesting a $300 loan, to be repaid in five months. With the money, Maricela will be able to buy more pigs to be fatten and sold. With your help, Maricela will be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde niña, Maricela S. observó que sus papás criaban cerdos y de ahí obtenían ingresos extras que contribuían al gasto familiar; por ello, cuando se casó, quiso también probar teniendo buen resultado; esta actividad le ha ayudado a construir su casa, y ahora desea construir más chiqueros para aumentar el número de cerdos de engorda. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300, que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 5 meses. Con este dinero Maricela podrá comprar más lechones (puercos), para poder engordarlos y venderlos. Con tu ayuda Maricela podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs to raise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose I. is 30 years old, married with 4 children and she lives in Benin City with her family. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $875 to buy more soup supplies for sale. Her mother taught her this business for 6 months. She will be glad if she finds favor with the KIVA lenders. She started her business in 2003 and has been with LAPO for 4 years as a client.

loans.use: To buy more soup supplies for sale

loans.name: Suyarhon

texts.ru:
Suyarhon Nazarov lives in the town of Yavan. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. He is in the retails business. He has his vendor space on the Yavan market where he sells dry fruits and nuts. He buys the products from wholesellers and brings it from different parts of Dushanbe. This helps supply the market with these type of products which the locals can buy without having to travel outside of town. Suyarhon want to increase commodity circulation and needs a loan. He plans to pay it off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Назаров Суярхон житель города Яван.Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет 2 детей. Занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке города Яван. Торгует сухофруктами и орехами. Скупает товар у оптовых продавцов , привозит из разных мест города Душанбе. Это помогает обеспечить рынок данным видом продукции и покупать они могут не выезжая за приделы Явана. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот он хочет получить кредит. Погасить его сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Chet R. is 41 years of age and works as a farmer in Siem Reap Province. She and her husband, Leng Ren, have had their farm since 1980 when the Vietnamese occupied Cambodia. Even together, they only earn $2.50 US per day. The couple has five children, one of whom is married. The younger children are all students, except for one who is developing his trade as a motorbike mechanic. Chet R. recognizes her son’s trade as potentially beneficial for the family and wants to buy him a good set of mechanics' tools to use. She also wants to buy a pig to raise on the family farm.

loans.use: To buy a pig and to buy mechanical tools.

loans.name: Atanimodom

texts.fr:
Ms. Atanimodom A. was born on May 5, 1985 in Guérinkouka, north of Togo. She is single and takes care of her two younger sisters who are still in primary school. In 2002, she started a shop sold beauty products and basic goods in the Adidogomé district in Lomé. At her shop, "ATANI ESTETIQUE", basic goods are more predominant than beauty products, for she's noticed that the latter does not sell as quickly. So she sells more milk, soap, canned goods, etc. This is the first loan that she seeks; it will allow her to buy 15 sacks of rice and other beauty products.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Mademoiselle A. Atanimodom est née le 5 mai 1985 à Guérinkouka au nord du Togo. Elle est célibataire et assure la charge de ses deux petites sœurs qui sont au cours primaires. En 2002, elle a crée une boutique de vente des produits de beauté et des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Dans sa boutique « ATANI ESTETIQUE », les produits de premières nécessités dominent les produits de beauté car elle a constaté que ses derniers ne coulent pas vite et s’adonne plus à la vente de lait, de savons, de boîte de conserve et autres. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 15 sacs de riz et quelques produits de beauté.

loans.use: buy basic goods

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un T., 26, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together making mortars and pestles and selling them to brokers who normally come their base twice a week. Un T. and her husband buy raw material like stone in bulk from the vendors in a nearby village and start designing and making good quality and pestle and mortars. This couple can typically make around $5 per day of net income.

In order to meet their growing customer demands, this couple would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase more stone and some tools accelerate their work.

loans.use: To purchase more stone to produce motars and pestles

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. née en 1966 à Mbacké est mariée avec 09 enfants plus 03 autres à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thièkène depuis 2 ans. Fatou fait un commerce de fruits locaux comme les pastèques, les mangues et autres. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assister sa famille.<b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Fatou D. was born in 1966 in Mbacké, and is married with 9 children and 3 others in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Thièkène for 2 years. Fatou has a business selling local fruit such as watermelons, mangoes, and such. Her income allows her to support her family. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell local fruit

loans.name: Thi Sơi's Group

texts.vi:
chị Lê thị Sợi năm nay 51 tuổi Ms 01050058 là một phụ nữ rất chịu khó, hàng ngày chị thường thu mua phế liệu của các hộ gia đình khác trong và ngoài thôn, sau đó chế tác, phân loại thành các sản phẩm khác nhau. Công việc này đòi hỏi phải mất nhiều thời gian và công sức, nên hàng ngày chồng, con chị cùng làm với chị, đồng thời con chị vận chuyển hàng đi bán, vì vậy mức thu nhập của gia đình chị thu được mỗi ngày từ 180.000 VND đến 200.000 VND/ ngày. Chị rất thích tham gia vay vốn của Bình Minh CDC vì chị được trả dần, đồng thời được vay vốn thường xuyên không phải thế chấp tài sản, ngoài ra chị còn tiết kiệm được tiền để lo kinh tế cho con, cháu chị được đầy đủ hơn. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000 VND để thêm vốn thu mua phế liệu và kinh doanh của gia đình. Các thành viên trong nhóm chị như sau :

  • chị N. thị Phượng Ms 01050054 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn
  • chị Lê thị Tân Ms 01050055 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ bán hàng hoa quả
  • chị Nguyễn thị Xoa Ms 01050056 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua gỗ sản xuất giường, tủ để bán
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thanh Ms 01050057 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua thức ăn gia súc
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi Soi (ID Number) 01050058, 51 years old, is a hard-working woman. Everyday, she buys scraps and discarded materials from other families inside and outside her village, then categorizes and sells them. This requires much time and effort, so usually, her husband and her children help her. Her children also transport and sell the materials. Thus, her family's daily income is from 180,000VND to 200,000VND (about 11USD to 12USD). Mrs. Soi likes to borrow through the SEDA Fund because she is allowed to repay the loans on an installment basis, as well as borrow regularly with no collateral required. Besides, she can also save some money to financially help her children and her grand children. This time, she would like to borrow 3,186,000VND to expand her inventory so that she can purchase more scraps and discarded materials. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. Nghiem Thi Phuong (ID Number 01050054) borrows 3,186,000VND to rear pigs.
  • Mrs. Le Thi Tan (ID Number 01050055) borrows 3,186,000VND to sell fruits in the market.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Xoa (ID Number 01050056) borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase wood to make bed frames and wardrobes for sale.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thanh (ID Number 01050057) borrows 3,186,000VND to purchase animal feed.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy scraps and discarded materials

loans.name: María Rosaria

texts.es:
La señora María Rosaria tiene 54 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana y al Comedor Popular de su zona. Vive en la calle Manuel González Prada s/n, distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer grado de primaria porque esa era la costumbre de los pueblos, se creía que las mujeres no deberían ser educadas porque sino iban a escribir cartas a los hombres para enamorarse, manifiesta. Es madre soltera, tiene un hijo que ya está casado.
Inició su negocio criando y vendiendo animales, se capitalizó pero lamentablemente se enfermó casi un año y nuevamente empezó de cero, manifiesta. Acumuló un capital y fue el Movimiento Manuela Ramos que a través de Credimujer la apoyó y ayudó tanto con sus temas de educación como con sus préstamos. Actualmente tiene una bodega en su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, el cual devolvió en 4 cuotas compró artículos para su bodega.
Con este crédito de 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en abarrotes.
María sueña con tener una casa linda para poder arreglarla y acoger a su hijo con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Rosaria is 54 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank Mujeres del Mañana and the Comedor Popular (an eatery for low-income families) in her area. Se lives on the street Manuel Gonzalez Prada s / n, district of Agallpampa, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until the third grade because that was the custom in the towns; it was believed that women should not be educated because they would write letters to the men to fall in love, she says. She is a single mother and has a son who is already married. She started her business breeding and selling animals, and had capital but unfortunately fell ill for nearly a year and started again from scratch, she says. She accumulated capital and it was the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, through Credimujer, that supported and helped as much with their education as with their loans.She currently has a wine cellar in her house. With the first loan of 300 soles, which was paid back in 4 months she bought items for her grocery store. With this loan of 1,200 soles (US $400 ), which will be repaid in 6 months, she plans to invest in groceries. Maria dreams of having a nice house to fix up to accommodate her son with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of groceries

loans.name: Gulru

texts.ru:
Назарова Гулру Пиримшоевна, 1974 года рождения, замужем и у них 2 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи кондитерских изделий. Со временем она перешла в продажу различных тканей. Сейчас в ассортименте ее товаров постельное белье, мужские свитера, женские пуловеры, детские зимние одежды, а также зимние носки. В бизнесе ей помогает дочка. Они вместе торгуют в отдаленных районах. Они возят товар прямо им домой, это куда выгоднее покупателям, чем тратить на дорогу. У нее 8 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Она покупает товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. У Гулру есть постоянные клиенты, которые заказывают все новые товары, она постоянно обновляет свой товар, чтоб не потерять постоянных клиентов. 
Гулру хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 1100 сомони чтоб закупить зимние товары.

loans.use: закуп зимних носков

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret A. sells bread at the grocery and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 23 years old and single. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her bakery.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga I., 45, is married with 8 children. She has many years of experience in a pancake business. She sells to the general public and villagers 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD). SPBD loans are Faaiuga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase things needed to run her pancake business as mentioned.

loans.use: To purchase sack of flour, melting dripping, baking powder, sack of sugar, cooking pan and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca se dedica a la elaboración de cómales, venta de leña para cocinas y a la siembra de maíz y fríjol.  Ella tiene un hijo.  Por el momento no cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, debido que a que el se encuentra en el extranjero y no tiene trabajo todavía.  El sueño de ella es salir adelante con su hijo.

Necesita su préstamo para comprar materiales y comprar leña, en esta época es cuando mas venden los comales, y ya tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes. Ella esta agradecida con Dios porque tiene trabajo porque le puede dar a su hijo todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rebeca works making 'cómales' (flat earthenware pans for cooking tortilla), selling firewood for cooking, and growing corn and beans. She has one son. She does not currently receive any economic support from her husband, as he is outside the country and has not yet found work. Her dream is to build a better life for her and her son. She is seeking a loan to buy raw material for making cómales and to buy firewood. At this time of year cómales are in high demand, and she already has several orders from her customers. Rebeca is grateful to God because she has work and is able to provide her son with everything he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making cómales, and to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin A. is 35 years old and married. Toyin has a shop where she sells palm oil. She is requesting a loan of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Sampson

texts.en:
Sampson B. is thirty-eight years old. He is married and has five children, two sons and three daughters. According to him, all his children are in basic school. His wife helps him with his business. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Sampson is a farmer and at the same time runs a provision store in which he sells products such as sugar, milk, Milo (a cocoa beverage), toffees, etc. He says he buys his goods from Nkawkaw, a nearby city. His shop is located at the market square. Sampson has been in business for three years. He wants a loan to procure various provisions to stock his shop. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: El carisma y optimismo de GracieL. L. impulsa a seguir creciendo, tanto como madre y como comerciante, pues sus hijos y pareja le motivan a continuar en su planes de vida. A pesar de que por motivo de trabajo, su esposo no está a su lado, trata de volcar todo ese amor en sus  dos hijos. Con gran alegría en su rostro, se ocupa de L. compra y venta de licores, negocio que tuvo sus inicios hace 16 años, desde que su hijo mayor le dio L. idea de viajar a L. ciudad de Ica (famosa por sus vinos y piscos) para comprar al por mayor y traer a L. capital las licores, donde toda L. familia terminan de decorar y prepara el producto para su respectiva venta. Esto realiza cada quince días, pues viaja constantemente para cumplir los pedidos que tiene. Los años de dedicación a esta actividad L. tienen agotada y está pensando L. manera de seguir trabajando pero de una manera más tranquiL., pues los viajes son muy cansados. En el futuro, desea instalar en su domicilio un restaurante, porque una de sus habilidades es L. cocina, sobre todo L. repostería, ya que un estudió al respecto y tiene conocimientos de cómo hacer de esta actividad un negocio rentable. Con gran empeño y responsabilidad GracieL. viene trabajando en MFP, donde junto a su banco comunal logró aprovechar las oportunidades y tuvo L. posibilidad de crecer, además, las socias hacen que el trabajo y las reuniones sean amenas. Los 1500 soles que solicita le permitirán adquirir grandes cantidades de botellas de vino para venderlas en las ferias y celebridades de su localidad.
texts.en:
GracieL.’s charisma and optimism have pushed her to continue growing as a mother and salesperson and her children and husband motivate her to continue with her life plans. Despite the fact that, for work reasons, her husband is not by her side, she tries to put all of her love into her two children. With great happiness she works in the buying and selling of liquors, a business that began 16 years ago when her oldest son gave her the idea to travel to the city of Ica (famous for its wines and piscos) to buy liquors wholesale and bring them back to the capital. Her whole family helps finish the decoration and preparation of the products for sale. She does this every 15 days since she must travel constantly to fill her orders. Years of working in this business have worn her out and she is thinking of a way to continue working, but in a more relaxed way, because the trips are very tiring. In the future, she wishes to open a restaurant in her home because she is also talented in cooking, especially baking. GracieL. studied cooking and she knows how to make a profitable business out of this skill. With much effort and responsibility, GracieL. began to work with MFP where, along with the communal bank, she was able to take advantage of many opportunities and had the chance to grow. Additionally, the other female members who do the work and the meetings are entertaining people. The 1500 soles (Peruvian currency) loan that she has applied for will allow her to acquire large quantities of bottles of wine to sell them at fairs and festivals in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise stock

loans.name: Jonibek

texts.en:
Jonibek B. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and parents. Jonibek is an animal farmer. He owns cows and sells their milk with the help of his father and mother. To further develop his business, he wants to take out a loan and buy one or two more cows and fodder for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. Then Jonibek will be able to use the profits from his business for the well-being of his family. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and fodder

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba B. une femme de 47ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle compte avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de vente d’huile de palme et d’embouche ovine. Son objectif est de mieux subvenir aux charges familiales dont elle fait face.
texts.en:
Coumba B., age 47, is a married woman and the mother of eight. She intends to use this loan to bolster her business selling palm oil and sheep feed. Her goal is to do better in coping with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil and sheep feed

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Nelly es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Nelly tiene un cafetín ubicado en la escuela de Santa Ana, en donde vende golosinas, bebidas y también prepara comida, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes con la ayuda de su esposo.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
Nelly sueña con ampliar su negocio, comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of Banco Comunal Rosas. She is married, 36, with 3 children. She has a cafe located in the Santa Ana School, where she sells candies, drinks and also prepares meals. She does this from Monday to Friday with the help of her husband. Nelly needs a loan of $350 to invest in more candy. Nelly dreams of enlarging her business and of buying land to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El socio es natural de Calca exactamente de Huarán, zona de clima cálido y tropical, lugar privilegiado de un verde y estupendo paisaje, ubicado a 1 hora y 20 minutos, se encuentra la casa de nuestro socio.

El socio NICOLAS, tiene 68 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos el menor tiene 22 años de edad, nuestro socio alterna desde hace años sus actividades diversas con la agricultura, el tiene tierras y siembra, maíz, alcachofa, habas, árboles frutales, peras, duraznos, frutillas, naranjas, manzanas, entre otros. Nuestro socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de semillas para la segunda siembra en sus tierras y así vender los granos y la producción que viene.

El socio está muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda.
texts.en:
This associate, Nicolas, is native to Calca, exactly speaking from Huarán, a warm tropical zone, a place priveleged by its green and stupendous scenery. Located 1 hour and 20 minutes from the city you will find his house. Nicolas is 68 years old, is married and has 5 children. The youngest is 22 years of age. For years Nicolas has alternated between diverse agricultural activities. He has land and sows maize, artichoke, broadbeans, fruit trees, pears, peaches, strawberries, oranges, and apples, among others. He wishes to invest his loan in the purchase of seeds for the second crop sowing in his land, in this way selling the grains and production that comes. Nicolas is very thankful for the support offered to him in this moment and promises to fulfill all the payments of his debt.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to for the planting season

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle V., 25, lives with her nine-month-old baby and her husband in a small house in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  Her husband works as a waiter in a nearby restaurant.

A young entrepreneur and mother, Rochelle scours night markets, bargain centers and bazzars to purchase her wares, from RTW (ready to wear dresses) to cosmetic items, which she then sells to her customers at a fairly low price.  She earns a weekly average of Php 1,500.00 on cosmetics alone, aside from other products she sells.

Rochelle dreams of having her own boutique where she can sell her items so she won’t need to leave her child in the care of relatives every time she leaves to tend to her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase inventory.

loans.name: Mary Njeri

texts.en:
Mary K. is a 36-year-old single mother who has one son. Her son is 12 years old and he is in the sixth grade at school.  Mary lives in Uthiru Village, which is a peri-urban estate.

Mary operates a beauty salon at Uthiru, a business she has had for the last nine years.  She got to know about KADET through a friend who was also a member in one of its borrowing groups.  Since Mary joined KADET she has taken out  two other loans, and this will be her third one.

Mary has plans to use this loan to equip her saloon with modern equipment so that she will be able to meet her clients' needs.  Likewise, she also intends to buy hair treatment and hair accessories which she can supply to other businesses or beauty salons.  In the future, she hopes to become a supplier of such products in the area of Uthiru.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer for a salon, and hair treatment and chemicals to resell.

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es:
Jovana es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Jovana es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Jovana vende neumáticos nuevos y usados, actividad que realiza en un local alquilado.
Jovana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos.
Los sueños de Jovana son tener una tienda mas grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Jovana is a member of the Amauta Community Bank. She is a 33-year-old mother of two and lives with her partner. Jovana sells new and used tires at a shop she rents. She is requesting a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $700), which she plans to use to purchase more tires. Jovana's dreams are to have a bigger shop and for her children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo Hernán de 44, quien es taxista, y con sus hijas: Zoila de 15 y Cecilia de 3, en su casa propia. Sara es una emprendedora mujer que siempre está al tanto de una ocasión de progreso, es así que hace algunos años no dudó en aprovechar la oportunidad que le dieron un grupo de monjas para poner una botica en su vecindario. Pues ella vive en una zona en la que no hay este tipo de establecimiento cerca, es así que se animó a incursionar en este negocio. Pero paralelamente, mantiene el negocio al cual se dedicaba, que es la venta de joyas. Sara considera su botica un negocio muy rentable, ya que no tiene mucha competencia y además le permite realizar su antiguo trabajo, además ahora quiere vender ropa y algunos adornos para aumentar su clientela y hacer que su negocio crezca. Es su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que sus amigas con las que conforma su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una mayor cantidad de medicinas, asimismo comprará joyas para enviarlas a su hermana para que las venda en su ciudad y también ropa para aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
La señora Elvis, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 22 años y 01 hijo, que depende de ella y son la razón por la cual ella trabaja día a día.
Elvis, es una mujer que ha su edad, ha podido salir adelante sola y con el apoyo de su esposo, logro implementar su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos de diferentes líneas como: Unique, Esika, Avon y cd´s de músicas religiosas, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes que día a día la visitan, de esta manera  pueda ofrecer sus productos y hacer sentir a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.  Hoy en día, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa del logro alcanzado.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Elvis, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela R., por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará productos de belleza.

loans.name: Afi Ewayo

texts.fr: Cette femme joue un rôle financier très important dans son foyer ; elle contribue en effet dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs 04 enfants, en apportant son aide financière à son mari. Elle est spécialisée uniquement dans la vente de tomates naturelles. Elle exerce son activité dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso, plus précisément à Ouagadougou, qui dispose l’une des meilleures tomates en Afrique de l’Ouest. C’est pourquoi cette dame dispose de nombreuses clientes ; et surtout les restaurants en mets africains font des commandes chez elle, à cause de la qualité de ses produits. Actuellement elle a besoin de lancer de nouvelles commandes, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 paniers de tomates fraîches.

loans.use: Achat de tomates

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reina es socia del Banco Comunal “Rió Desaguado” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 41 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos, vive en el jr. Leticia s/n, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de gaseosa.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar productos de la región como papa, chuño, quinua, etc, además gaseosas para venderlos en las ferias semanales.

Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su capital.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de papa, chuño, quinua, etc,

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
55-year-old Virginia has a food-vending business in Dauis, Panglao, selling a variety of snacks in her community. She has ten children to support so she’s saving a certain amount for the education of her children. 

Virginia needs additional capital to enable her business to grow. She’s now requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This loan will help finance her growing business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is a 33-year-old married man who owns and operates a small auto repair shop in Nablus city, Palestine. He and his wife have two children.
Isam is a hard-working and very responsible person. The clients value his skills as well as his honesty. Thus, he has many repeat clients. He works hard to earn a good income and support his family. Now he needs a loan of $3000 to buy the necessary tools for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary tools for improving his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients in bulk for her café.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 53 años de edad, estudiò secundaria completa, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.
Fabiana se dedica a la venta de golosinas y paralelamente a la artesanìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró los materiales necesarios para hacer las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar: golosinas, lana, plumón, bayeta y ganado.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Juli. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias y la promotora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fabiana is a partner of the Community Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima-Juli” for the last four years. The bank is in the district of Juli, provence of Chucuito in the area of Puno. She is 53 years old and has her high school studies completed. She is a single mother of one child. Fabiana sells candy along side of handicrafts and informs us that her first loan requested of the Manuela Ramos Movement was for S/300.00 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she bought the materials needed in order to make handicrafts. She is requesting a loan of S/2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she could buy: candies, wool, down, embroidery materials and livestock. Her dream for the future is to have her own house in Juli. What she likes the most about the Community Bank are the savings, meetings with partners and the bank promoter.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool, embroidery materials and livestock.

loans.name: Romeo's Group

texts.en:
Romeo C. is from the village of Centro 1, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 28 years old. Romeo is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI.
