While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Romeo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Romeo owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP daily.

In 2006, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 28,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan that he has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita P. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. She is 55 years old. Nelita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nelita owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Nelita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. Nelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Hà Thị Trương is 27 years old. (id: 010103080001). She is married and has one child. She has a store at home from which she sells goods like candy, cake, beer, soft drinks, fruit and so on. Her husband makes iron doors to sell. They have been working these jobs for about three years. They have a monthly income of about $220. 

She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by the Kiva field partner, SEDA.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

She has been with Seda for six years and has repaid her loans on time. This time, she wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or $295) to buy goods to sell, and also to buy iron for her husband's door-making business. 

About the other borrowers in her group: 
 Mai Thị Nguyễn is 26 years old. (id: 010103080003). She sells groceries. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to buy more goods to sell.
 Ngọc Thị Bích Bùi is 34 years old. (id: 010103080004). She sells pork in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to invest in her small business.
 Lý Thị Lê is 44 years old. (id: 010103080002). She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND (or $225) for her small business.
 Nam Thị Ngô is 25 years old. (id: 010103080007). She breeds pigs and poultry. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to buy food for her animals.
 Phuong T. T. P. is 26 years old. (id: 010103080005). She sells groceries at home. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to invest in her store.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell and iron to make doors

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Eulalia, llego a ser cliente en nuestra institucion, gracias a la recomendación de una de las clientes que trabaja en bancos de emprendimiento, con el asesor Nicolas, La Sra. Eulalia vive en el Barrio 30 de agosto de la zona del plan 3000, junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo, tiene su tienda en la que vende diario alimentos de primera necesidad y complementarios;   el prestamo solicitado es para aumentar capital en su tiendita, su esposo el Sr. Efrain es taxista presta servicios de transporte urbano. Hace un año atras ellos cuentan con su casa propia y un vehiculo propio, gracias a sus esfuerzos. estos Sres. tuvieron un fracaso el que casi les ocasiona deshacerce de sus pertenencias, pasa que la esposa se presto un dinero para el viaje de su esposo al extranjero donde el tendria un mejor ingreso, ya estando fuera del pais lo encontraron indocumentado donde lo deportaron para Bolivia, siendo que acaba de viajar. despues de esto volvio a salir fuera del pais donde trabajo por mas de un año, donde consiguio ganar un tanto de dinero con lo construyo su casita y se compro su movilidad con la que actualmente trabaja y ayuda en los gastos de la casa. Ellos comentan que esa experiencia que pasaron les ayudo a valorar mucho la union familiar que es el pilar fundamental para superar cualquier tipo de problemas.

Estan muy agradecidos a Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Eulalia became a client of our institution thanks to a recommendation from one of the clients that works with communal banks under advisor, Nicolas. Eulalia lives in Plan 3000 zone's 30 de Agosto neighborhood with her husband and two children. She has a small grocery store where she sells basic needs items. She is asking for funding to stock her store. Her husband, Efrain, is an urban taxi driver. Thanks to their combined efforts, they have owned their own house and vehicle for a year now. The couple had a recent setback that almost caused them to lose all their belongings. What happend was: the wife lent herself some money to pay for her husband's trip abroad where work conditions would provide higher income. However, once abroad he was discovered to be undocumented and he was deported to Bolivia; he had just recently left. After this, he left the country again and stayed out working for over a year. He was able to earn enough money to build the house and buy a vehicle, which he currently uses to work and help with household expenses. They comment that the experience they went through taught them to value family unity which is the fundamental pillar needed to overcome any adversity. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Odalia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Odalia del Carmen de 38 años de edad es casada con tres hijos menores a su cargo. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva de mujer, hombres, niños. Esta necesidad de buscar un nueva fuente de ingreso surge debido a que su esposo estaba en ese entonces desempleado y el era el proveedor para llevar el alimento diario. Este negocio consiste en la compra de ropa en el mercado el oriental de Managua la cual compra por docenas como es camisas, pantalones short, ropa interior, blusas, faldas, de esta forma le permite venderla  al por menor a mi clienta en un precio justo y equitativo. Hoy en día tengo una pequeña tienda ya que he obtenido mucho conocimiento y experiencia en el negocio. Ella sueña con brindarles seguridad emocional y económica a mis hijos, y en lo personal como mujer sentirme realizada porque se que tengo una fuente de ingresos. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento que es tan importante.
texts.en:
Odalia del Carmen, 38, is married and has three, minor children under her care. She sells new clothing for women, men and children. She needed to find a new source of income at a time when her husband became unemployed and he had been the sole source of support for the family. The business consists in clothing sales in Managua's Oriental market. She buys shirts, pants, shorts, underwear, blouses, and skirts by the dozen then sells them at retail for a fair price. "Today I have a small store and I have learned a lot and have experience in this business" She dreams with providing emotional and financial security for her children and personally, as a woman, "I want to feel fulfilled because I know that I have a source of income" For this reason she is asking for this important financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Makhmasharif

texts.en: R. Makhmasharif is 54 years old and sells household goods such as kettles, pails, basins and other items. He has been in this business for more than thirty years. Having a rich experience, Makhmasharif is able to choose such goods as meet the requirements of clients whose tastes differ. The business is quite successful and generates a stable income that allows Makhmasharif to improve the living condition of his family and make his kids happy. Makhmasharif has been provided with several loans by IMON during almost four years. He had shown himself to be an accurate client having a positive credit history. Today Makhmasharif requests 5,000 Somoni which he is planning to spend on purchasing new household goods to sell, thus enlarging his range of goods. With your help, this will be possible. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new household goods to sell

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa owns a sari-sari store located at her house. She is only 20 and still single. Because of financial struggles, she was not able to go to college. Now that she has a store, she wants to take this opportunity to save for her college education. She also wants to help her parents provide for the increasing needs in their household. 

Risa joined CEVI to gain access to its program. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000, which she will use to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store like soap, soy sauce and many others.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her store

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
Odilia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Reside en el barrio de Pampahuasi, ubicado en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Siempre le ha gustado diferenciarse de su competencia en cuanto a precio, calidad y buen servicio, por ello tiene 25 años dedicada al cultivo de cacao y café.
Pero no se queda contenta con lo que ha logrado, pues aspira extender sus plantaciones a otras zonas, donde pueda vender su producto desde la misma chacra y minimizar el gasto de traslado.
Cada día se despierta con las mis ganas de siempre y conjuntamente con su esposo se dirigen a sus tierras para el cuidado respectivo de sus cultivos. Por lo general trabajan 12 horas y sólo descansan los fines de semana para dedicarse de lleno a sus hijos, quienes están en etapa escolar, pero en tiempo de vacaciones les brinda su ayuda en el campo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos en fechas oportunas, además agradece a su banco comunal por la transparencia y veracidad con que se desarrolla. Con el dinero que solicita le dará mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo, con la finalidad de mejorar su cosecha en los futuros meses.
texts.en:
Odilia is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Pampahuasi, located on the fringes of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house.

She has always liked to differentiate herself from her competition through her price, quality and good service. She has dedicated 25 years to the cultivation of cacao and coffee. However, she isn’t content with what she has achieved, because she aspires to extend her plantations to other zones where she can sell her product from the same farm and minimize transportation expenses. Each day she wakes up with the same will as always, and together with her husband, they manage the lands and the respective care for the crops. In general, they work 12 hours and only rest on weekends to fully dedicate themselves to their children who are school-aged. During vacation time, they help them in the fields.

This is her first loan with MFP, for which she promises to be on time with her respective payments. In addition, she is thankful for her communal bank for the transparency and honesty with which it is developed. With the money requested, she will provide maintenance to her cultivation lands with the objective of improving her harvest in the future months.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her crops

loans.name: Agrepina

texts.en:
Agrepina N. is from the village of Siñan. She is 41 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Agrepina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of rice in the local community. Agrepina has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Agrepina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agrepina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Agrepina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of rice. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Agrepina from PMPC.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase aditional stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette D. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Janette is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Janette owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Janette has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Janette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. Janette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Janette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Janette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit H. is 54 years old. She lives alone, because her husband lives in Russia, and her children are married and live separately from their mother. For about 10 years, Anahit has been engaged in selling glassware in a shop which is located on one of Vanadzor's central streets. She sells kitchen utensils, tea things, vases, etc. Anahit purchases an assortment of products from Yerevan once or twice a month. Anahit needs a 300.000 AMD loan to buy dinner and tea services, and sets of forks and knives for her shop.

loans.use: To buy dinner and tea services, and sets of forks and knives for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more dry meat to improve business.

loans.name: Lucas Evangelisto

texts.es:
el sr. Lucas Evangelisto F. se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de camas de madera, tiene vario tiempo de dedicarase a este tipo de actividad.
Don Lucas es muy trabajador a pesar de que es una persona de la tercera edad, trabaja muy duro para sacar a su familia adelante. Lucas es padre de 6 hijos los cuales ya estan grandes de edad.
Lucas en sus tiempos libres asiste a la iglesia, nos comento sentirse muy feliz ya que el esta bien de salud y espiritualmente.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas madera a precio de mayorista y asi tener mas produccion. las ganancias las necesita para satisfacer sus necesidades y cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Lucas Evangelisto Fernández manufactures wooden beds. He has been in this line of work for a long time. Lucas is very hard working despite being a senior citizen. He works hard to get his family ahead in life. He is the father of 6 children who are all adults. In his spare time Lucas attends church. He tells us that he feels very happy because he is well both physically and spiritually. He will use the loan to buy more wood at wholesale prices in order to increase production. He will use the profits to meet his personal needs and to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, nails, adhesives, plastic.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en: Dorine is a married lady with two children aged 1 year old and 5 months.  She has been selling fish for the past three years.  She saves her money with a group in Faulu Kenya on a weekly basis.  Through the group, she previously took out a loan of 40,000 KES which she used to buy more inventory.  She has also learnt new business skills through the group.  She needs to add more stock of fish and fingerlings hence she has requested a loan of 80,000 KES.  Dorine hopes to buy a plot of land in the future.  She describes herself as determined, hardworking, and focused.

loans.use: To add stock of fish and fingerlings

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Presentacion; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la picantería, Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas, ella tiene un restaurante típico tradicional, La socia cocina a leña, también vende chicha de maíz amarrillo, llamada bebida de los inkas; La socia tiene este su negocio desde hace 12 años. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vajilla, carne y otros para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. She lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Presentacion is 55 years old, is married and has 2 children. She cooks and sells typical traditional foods from her restaurant, where she cooks from a wood fired stove. She also sells “Chicha,” (a fermented drink) made from yellow corn. Chicha is known as the drink of the Incas. She has had this business for 12 years and is asking for this loan in order to invest in tableware, meat, and other items for her business. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Muhamadamin

texts.en:
Muhamadamin S. is 49 years old. He is married and has one child.  Muhamadamin sells men’s shoes in the central market of Dushanbe  and has done so for many years and has lots of clients. 

Muhamadamin‘s business is the main source of income for his family. He requests a 7500 Somoni loan to increase the range of goods he sells. Muhamadamin would like to thank everyone for their support and he promises to pay the loan on time.  
 
-----------------------------------------------------
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchass goods for selling.

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a talented tailor. She started this project in her house two years ago with basic tools, tailoring for the neighbors. Now Khadra is well known and customers come to her from different places. Khadra has one son named Arkan, who is 28 years old and a Palestinian NationA. Authority employee. 

Khadra came to FATEN and received a $1000 loan to purchase a tailoring machine to help her enhance her work and finish it faster. Khadra would like to develop her small workshop into a bigger one and start employing other women who need a job in the city.

Khadra appears in the picture above, working.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 22 años, convive con Viky, de 21 años, producto de su amor nació Mario de 3 años, a quien crían y educan en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (localidad de Metrado). Desde hace ya 3 años que se dedica a la siembra de café y plátanos, todas las mañanas sale a cuidar la hectárea de café que sembró en su terreno de cultivo y cuando den fruto los venderá en el mercado central de ciudad. Cada quince días recoge plátanos para poder venderlos en su localidad; también cría gallinas de chacra; que son muy solicitadas en la capital. A Jesús le disgusta mucho cuando llegan las malas hierbas a las plantaciones de plátanos ya que su control resulta un grave problema; por ello siembra mayor cantidad de café y esta juntando mayor capital para poder sembrar a gran escala y así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y está agradecido con su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de trabajar y apoyarlo incondicionalmente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 2 costales de abono de cuatrocientos soles para sus cafetales, producto que cosechará en estos meses.
texts.en:
Jesús, age 22, lives with Viky, age 21. The product of their love, Mario, is 3 years old. They are raising and educating him in their own home, located in the Peruvian forest in the community of Metrado.

For 3 years, Jesús has been involved in planting coffee and bananas. Every morning, he leaves to care for the hectare of coffee he grows on his farmland, and when the fruit is ripe he sells it in the central market of the city. Every 15 days, he gathers bananas in order to sell them in his community. He also raises poultry, which is much sought after in the capital.

It upsets Jesús a lot when weeds come into his banana grove since their control causes serious problems. For this reason, he is planting a greater quantity of coffee. This requires greater capital in order to be able to plant on a large scale and give a better quality of life to his family.

This is Jesús’ second loan with MFP, and he is grateful to his communal bank for giving him the opportunity to work and for its wholehearted support. With the loan that he is applying for he will buy 2 sacks of fertilizer, costing 400 soles, for his coffee plants, a product that he will harvest in the next few months.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Dina Pangasian's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina P., 53 years of age, is married. She is a resident of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Dina is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dina P.’s Group.

Dina is married to Zosimo, a motor cab driver. They were blessed with four children, three of whom are now at their adult stage and the other one is still school age. To help her husband, she decided to engage in a micro business, particularly in operating a sari-sari (variety) store and vending some snacks. 

For 10 years already, she has been able to maintain the said business activity and at this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000.00 Philippines pesos a month. This amount is so helpful to her family income. 

Upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, being an awarded coop for Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006, and being awarded for CUMI Performance Award 2010, she undoubtedly joined the cooperative in the year 2009. 

As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of 10,000.00 pesos as her fourth loan to be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, loan repayments to PMPC, house renovation and for possible business expansions.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing sari-sari (variety) store and snack vending business

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. AZUCENAS inicia su tercer ciclo  en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Esta asociación está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta: la señora Alicia,  la tesorera  la señora Martha y la secretaria de actas la señora Claudia.

La señora  secretaria Claudia es una mujer joven de 26 años de edad, está desde la fundación del grupo, las señoras la eligieron para este cargo considerando sus habilidades para manejar el cuaderno de actas.

Desde hace seis años trabaja en la venta de dulces, inicialmente el negocio era de su mamá, sin embargo, ahora ella se hizo cargo del mismo.  Su solicitud de Bs. 2000.- será invertido en la compra de mercadería, es decir variedad de dulces.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como: tejidos de chompa, venta de medicinas naturales, venta de productos de uso personal y domésticos (chiflería: venta de papel higiénico, peines, pilas, agujas, cepillos de dientes, pasta dental, etc), pastelería, proveedor de “aceros arequipa”, venta de dulces, venta de joyas, venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Azucenas” (Lilies) is starting its third loan cycle as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. This Communal Bank consists of eight members, seven women and one man. The following members make up the Board of Directors: Sra. Alicia (President), Sra. Martha (Treasurer), and Sra. Claudia (Secretary of Records).

Sra. Claudia is a young woman who is 26 years of age and serves as the group secretary. She is also the founder of the group. The other women elected her to her position because they considered her ability to handle the record books. Claudia began selling sweets six years ago. This business originally belonged to her mother, but now she is the person in charge. Her loan request of 2000 BOB will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, specifically various types of candy.

With respect to the other members of the Communal Bank, they engage in the following types of business: weaving blankets, selling natural medicines, selling toiletries and household products (toilet paper, combs, batteries, needles, toothbrushes, toothpaste, and other items), making pastries, distributing steel products, selling candy, selling jewelry, and selling cosmetics.

loans.use: Purchase candy to sell

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a housewife; she prefers to stay at home and do her household duties. She is very cooperative and is always ready to help her family overcome life's difficulties. She lives in Samundri, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived in her house, which is located in the Christian colony, a residential area of the city, for over 20 years.

Razia has a son who is a painter by profession, painting walls and buildings on order. His clientele base is building and house owners hire him on a contract basis. Razia couldn’t educate him due to poor financial conditions. He contributes to his family financially through his earnings.

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s delivery business. He has been in this business for over 7 years. He uses his donkey cart to load items such as construction supplies and fruits and vegetables and delivers the items to designated places. With this loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because the old cart has become rough and rotten, preventing him from loading it fully, which negatively affects his earnings. Razia is hopeful that an investment will help her husband continue his work and serve his customers better.

Razia is a regular lender with Asasah; this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, Razia is holding a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy a new donkey cart for her husband's delivery business

loans.name: Tuliya Group

texts.fr: Ushindi B. M.  est  présidente du groupe Tuliya, âgée de 31 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants.  Son mari est  vendeur des pommes de terre.  Elle vend aussi de pommes de terre comme son conjoint. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre, reçu de leur tontine  une somme de 300$, plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Elle installe ses produits  dans un dépôt – marché - secteur Nyabushongo.  Il y a 9 ans qu’elle exerce ce business. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  5 sacs de pommes de terre, le reste pour  l’épargne. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire une belle maison, plus tard acheter un véhicule de transport de ses marchandises.  La cliente Ushindi B. M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Tuliya est  composé de 36 membres.
texts.en: Ushindi B. M., the president of the Tuliya group, is 31 years old, married, and a mother of seven children.   Her husband sells potatoes and she sells potatoes as his spouse. She began this business with her own capital, 300$, raised through her tontine. Later she benefitted from a loan from Hekima. She installs her products in a warehouse within the Nyabushongo sector market.  She has conducted her business for nine years. This new loan should help her stock up with five sacks of potatoes and the rest will be savings. In addition, she hopes to buy a plot and build a beautiful home and later, to buy a transport vehicle for her merchandise. This client, Ushindi B. M., thanks Hekima for its actions that help the poor who are excluded from traditional banking. It should be noted that this Tuliya group is composed of 36 members.

loans.use: Five sacks of potatoes and the rest for savings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To meet needs for genenral store

loans.name: María Gloria Ascensión

texts.es: María Gloria Ascensión P. D. de 43 años, vive junto a sus tres hijos y una sobrina, junto a los cuales reside en el municipio de Sensuntepeque. María posee una venta de productos plásticos, ropa interior, y en esta temporada también surte su negocio con productos navideños. María es una persona muy responsable en su hogar ya que es la única que trabaja por sostenerlo, ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de plásticos como: depósitos para el agua, botellas, platos y otros más, los cuales se venden durante todo el año. De esta manera ella espera mejorar sus ganancias y darles  una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: María Gloria Ascensión P. D. is 43 years old.  She lives together with her three children and a niece in the town of Sensuntepeque.  María has a business selling plastic products, underwear and, during the current season, she also stocks her business with Christmas products.  María is a very responsible person within her household as she is the only one who works to support it.  She is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of plastic products such as: water containers, bottles, plates and other products.  She sells these products all year round.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits and provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: To buy plastic products to sell

loans.name: Amistad Eterna Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal Amistad Eterna, es un grupo de 9 mujeres que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Esta Banca Comunal es parte del centro focal de Senkata, están iniciando su primer ciclo.
Cada una de ellas tienen negocios propios, de diferentes tipos, como ser: venta de carne de oveja, venta de abarrotes, tienda de barrio venta de dulces, venta de ace y jabón, venta de refrescos, venta de comida.
Para su organización, la B.C.  Amistad Eterna cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Basilia, una tesorera, la señora Bartolina y una secretaria de actas, la señora María.
 
La Presidenta, la señora Basilia, es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus seis hijos.   El negocio de la señora Basilia es la venta de comida, ella comenta que inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia hace cinco años atrás. Actualmente vende comida a las siete de la mañana, todos los días, en un lugar llamado puente Vela en la Zona de Senkata.  La señora  Basilia recibe colaboración de sus hijas para la venta de la comida.
La señora presidenta está ingresando como cliente a Pro Mujer por primera vez, cuando se le consulta que es lo que le gusta de la institución, ella responde "la capacitación".
texts.en:
The communal bank  Amistad Eterna is a group of 9 women who have decided to unite to receive loans, training, and medical care. This communal bank is part of the focal center of Senkata and they're beginning their first loan cycle. 

Each member has her own distinct business, including: sale of lamb meat, sale of groceries, a neighborhood sweets shop, sale of oil and soap, sale of soft drinks, and food sales. 

In terms of organization, Amistad Eterna is directed by a committee comprised of a president, Basilia; a treasurer, Bartolina, and a secretary, María. 

The president, Basilia, is 36-years-old. She lives with her husband and six children. She sells food, and she says that she started the company with her own initiative five years ago. Currently she sells food at 7 a.m. everyday in a place called Puente Vela in the Senkata area. Basilia's daughters help her sell the food. She's joining as a client of Pro Mujer for the first time. What she likes most about the institution is the training.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Renacientes (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Renacientes esta conformado por 9 mujeres muy luchadoras, alegres y trabajadoras quienes se esfuerzan día a día para crecer más en sus negocios y sacar  adelante a sus familias. Nuestras socias viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida y admirada por muchos debido a la belleza colonial de su centro histórico, de su naturaleza y su gente que es calida y muy amable.

La Señora. Marcia S. es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive en el sector de Miraflores, este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que cuenta con grandes amigas con quienes se distrae.
Nuestra socia se dedica a laborar en una distribuidora de plásticos actividad que la realiza hace 2 años, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. También se dedica a la venta de ropa, inicio este negocio con su primer crédito que realizo en el banco comunal, vende en su tiempo libre y fines de semana.
Doña Marcia tiene 25años, es casada y aun no tiene hijos, su esposo labora como ebanista, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa. Su meta es tener su casa propia. 

La Señora. Sonia U. es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive por el sector de Chilcapamba, tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 17, 15, 12, 8 y 7 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Sonia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos, hace apenas 6 meses se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ternos de niño y libros, estos productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad.
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 créditos y le gusta  por que tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes conversa en cada reunión saliendo de su rutina, con el dinero de su crédito va a comprar pollos para iniciar  esta actividad. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Renacientes community bank is made up of 9 very hard-working, happy women who work hard every day to grow in their businesses and get their families ahead in life.  Our members live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is well known and admired by many people owing to the colonial beauty of its historic center, its nature and its people who are warm and very friendly.

Marcia S. is a member of the Renacientes community bank.  She lives in Miraflores sector.  This is her third loan as a member of the community bank which she likes because she has some great friends there with whom she enjoys herself.

Marcia has been working for a plastics distributor for 2 years.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  She also sells clothes.  She started this business with the first loan she received through her community bank.  She sells her products in her spare time and on weekends.

Marcia is 25 years old, married, and does not have any children yet.  Her husband works as a cabinetmaker.  They do not own their own home and so live in a rental property.  Marcia will invest her new loan in buying more clothes.  Her goal is to own her own home.

Sonia U. is another member of the Renacientes community bank and lives in Chilcapamba sector.  She is 35 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 17, 15, 12, 8 and 7.  Her eldest three children are studying in high school and her two youngest are attending elementary school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They do not own their own home but live in a rental property.

Sonia takes care of her housework and her children.  She has also been selling cosmetics, children's outfits and books for 6 months.  She sells these products all around the city.  Sonia has been a member of the community bank for the past three loan cycles.  She likes it because she has some very good friends with whom she gets to chat during each group meeting which takes her out of her routine.  Sonia will use her loan money to buy chickens so that she can start out in the chicken business.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy clothes and chickens

loans.name: Nancy Nduta

texts.en:
Nancy has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 48 years old and married to Sammy K.. Together they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She repaid all her previous loans in full and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future Nancy hopes to buy more land and to practise large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
En las montañas de una vereda de Sonsón Antioquia en Colombia, vive Claudia Claudia patricia C., una jóven que a sus 29 años de edad decidió desde hace algunos años aportar para cubrir los gastos de la familia con su propio trabajo. 

Fue así como motivada por la ilusión de mejorar su calidad de vida, la de su esposo y la de su hija inició con la confección de prendas, oficio que aprendió desde hace algunos años. Su esposo se dedica a las labores del campo mientras que ella además de ser ama de casa y madrugar desde muy temprano confecciona sobre pedido las prendas de sus vecinos y conocidos, así mismo se las ingenia para elaborar muñecos de diferentes estilos. 

Para mejorar su negocio, Claudia necesita de un crédito para comprar materia prima para elaborar algunas manualidades que le permitirán mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia C. lives along the Sonsón Antioquia Road in the mountains of Colombia. She is a young woman who is 29 years of age. A few years ago, she decided to cover the family expenses through her own work.

Motivated by the hope of improving her family’s quality of life, Claudia started producing garments. She learned this skill a few years ago. Her husband works in the fields while she performs her duties as a homemaker and seamstress. In the early morning hours, she begins sewing based on the orders she receives from neighbors and acquaintances. In addition, she makes dolls in different styles.

To improve her business, Claudia needs a loan to buy materials for producing some of her handicrafts. This will enable her to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Komilahon's Group

texts.ru:
Комилахон Вахидова, 28, лидер этой группы, молодая мама троих детей и к тому же уже больше десятка лет вовлечена в бизнес разведения и продажи скота. На данный момент ее домашнее хозяйство состоит из одной коровы и 4 кур. Птицеводством Комилахон решила заниматься сравнительно недавно. Оно приносит небольшие доходы , но все же помогает покрывать кое-какие расходы. Супруг, так же как и старший сын работает в частном строительстве. Бизнес  приносит 2 000 сомов прибыли в месяц. Немного, но Комилахон сумела скопить маленькую сумму для постройки нового коровника. Когда она узнала, что нужно собрать группу единомышленников, Комилахон ни на минуту не сомневалась кто будет членами ее группы. Она очень сильно хочет закупить больше мелко рогатого скота для откорма и разведения, также как и остальные члены группы, планирующие потратить кредит на развитие бизнеса. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
Komilahon V. is 28 years old. She is a leader of this group and is a young mother of three children. Besides that she has been involved in business of breeding and selling cattle for more then a decade.

At this time there are one cow and four chickens in her household. Relatively recently Komilahon decided to start breeding poultry. It brings her a small income, but still helps to cover some expenses. Her husband as well as her oldest son works in private construction business. It brings 2000 soms of income a month. Not very much, but Komilahon was able to save a small amount to build a new cow house. When she found out that she needs to bring together a group of like minded people Komilahon has not for a minute doubted who will be the members of her group.

She very much wants to buy more of small horned cattle for feeding and growing, as well as other members of the group who plan to spend the loan on developing their businesses.

loans.use: to buy small horned cattle

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro Antonio H. vive en la ciudad de Medellín y hace 28 años trabaja como vendedor ambulante por las calles del centro de esta ciudad. Pedro aprendió empíricamente de este oficio y le ha dedicado su vida al comercio informal de dulces, cigarrillos y chicles trabajando largas jornadas sin descansos desde las 8 am hasta las 7pm. Con este trabajo ha sostenido a su familia y gracias a su negocio en la calle fue que conoció a su esposa con la que tiene 4 hijos y quien también es vendedora ambulante.
 
Como Pedro quiere crecer su negocio y poder tener más surtido de productos, ha decidido acceder a un préstamo con el fin de capitalizarse. Las ganancias que obtenga le servirán para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y arreglar su casa la cual se encuentra en muy mal estado actualmente.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio H. lives in the city of Medellín where for 28 years he has been a peddlar throughout the streets in the city center.  Pedro learned his trade very well and has dedicated his life to selling sweets, cigarettes and chewing gum.  He works tirelessly from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  With his earnings he is able to support his family and thanks to his job in the street he was able to meet his wife, who is also a peddlar, with whom he has four children.

Since Pedro wants to expand his business to offer a wider variety of products he decided to ask for a loan to buy assorted sweets.  He plans to use his earnings to improve his lifestyle and carry out some household repairs his home is in need of.

loans.use: To buy assorted sweets

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo.
Se dedica a la venta de plantones, como son coco, ficus, gras, bijao y otros, lleva 6 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, que le han servido para comprar otro terreno donde pueda seguir haciendo sus almácigos, todo ésto gracias a la ayuda de su esposo quien es ingeniero agrónomo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 carretilla nuevo, 10 sacos de abono, 2 litros de remedio para las plagas, 3 kilos de aldrin para las hormigas.
Teniendo la ayuda de su esposo le es más fácil porque tiene toda la sesoría y las indicaciones para que las plagas no afecten a sus plantas.
Sus préstamos han sido invertidos íntegramente en su negocio, quiere tener más variedad de plantas.
Está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos quien ha ayudado en el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Manos Unidas communal bank in the Yarinacocha district of the Ucayali department.  She is 32 years old, married, and has one son.

She sells plants such as coconut, ficus, and others.  She’ been doing this for six years with the help of loans from the Manuela Ramos organization.  They have helped her buy a plot of land that has allowed her to continue planting, with the help of her husband who is an agricultural genius.

She will use the money from this new loan of 2,500 PEN to buy a new wagon, 10 sacks of fertilizer, 2 liters of fungicide, and 3 kg of ant poison.

It’s easier with her husband’s help because he has the knowledge for preventing blights.  She has invested all he loans into her business and she wants to have a greater variety of plants.  She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization, which has helped her grow her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tree farm

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Try S., 43, is married with two young children living at home in the Kompong Cham province. 

She is a farmer who works for less than US $1 each day and her husband raises pigs. Her husband, Sork Pov, typically makes about US $2 each day as a pig farmer. 

Try S. would like a loan of US $1,200 to purchase more pigs to breed and also to purchase feed for the pigs. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. is not available.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed and also to purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Elfie

texts.en:
Elfie L. is 26 years old and single.  She lives in the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. Elfie owns and operates a specialized retail store.   Her main source of income comes from selling products like shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  Elfie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Elfie joined Kiva partner Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Elfie requests a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase sugar, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks to sell in the community. This loan will be her second from GDMPC.  She will use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC):

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks to sell in the community.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah is 43 years old and lives in West Point. She’s a student in the eight grade and is married with three children between the ages of 11 and 20, all of whom are attending school. She has been selling used clothes and other assorted goods for the past eight years. She doesn't experience any difficulties about her business.

Siah is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build her own house and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.  Mercedita has been in this business for two years and earns additional income from sari-sari (variety) store.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Hernane

texts.en:
Hernane is a married man with 5 children. He is a farmer who tills land in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Hernane grows rice and vegetables. He works hard to earn money and feed his family.

Hernane plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest. Hernane's dream is for his children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Belgica

texts.es:
La señora Bélgica, es casada con el señor Dionisio,   con quien procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales dos ya están casados y dos están  a su responsabilidad  y son: Pilar de doce  años  y la más chica es Ana Cristel de siete años.

    Ella solicito la presta para invertirlo en la compra de útiles escolares para surtir su pequeña papelería en donde lleva dos años y cuatro meses, en lo  que nos cometa que le va bien ya que con ellos está logrando tener un mejor ingreso

    Lo que lo inspiro fue su familia ya que también quiere aportar con los  ingresos de la casa y así juntos con su esposo mejorar su calidad de vida y darle lo  mejor a sus hijos que aun están con ella.

     Lo que más desea es que su papelería crezca día con di apara  así seguir apoyando a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando y terminen una carrera.
texts.en:
Bélgica is married to Dionisio.  The couple have four children, two of whom are already married and two of whom are in their care: 12 year-old Pilar and their youngest, 7 year-old Ana Cristel.

Bélgica requested a loan to invest in buying school supplies to stock her small stationery store that she has run for two years and four months.  She tells us that her business is doing very well as she is making good income.

What inspired Bélgica was her family as she wants to contribute towards her household income and, together with her husband, improve their quality of life and provide the best for their children who still live with them.

What Bélgica most desires is for her stationery store to continue to grow so that she can continue supporting her children who are in school and ensure that they continue studying and finish a degree course.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as pencils, composition books, notebooks, colored pencils, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres, vecinas y amigas, de ciudad del Este se han agrupado, del cual surge el comité denominado Mujeres Unidas, el cual actualmente se encuentra en el 3er. ciclo. Este se forma gracias a la gestión de una de las miembros, ella al enterarse sobre el programa de la Fundación, motivo a sus amigas y vecinas.
Todas ellas tienen un propósito en común, que es el de conseguir mas ingresos para llevar a sus casas. Trabajan incansablemente, todo dentro de un ambiente de unión y cooperación.
La Sra. Clotilde es cocinera, ella se dedica a esta profesión hace ya unos años. Se considera como una cocinera excelente ya que muchas personas vienen a llevar la comida que ella prepara. Sueña con algun dia poder abrir su propio comedor.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de carnes, verduras, fideos y demás para la elaboracion de las comidas que elabora.
texts.en:
14 women, neighbors and friends from Ciudad del Este came together to form the 'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) committee which is currently in its third loan cycle.  The committee was formed thanks to one of its members who found out about Fundación Paraguaya's program and motivated her friends and neighbors to join.

All the members of this committee have a goal in common, that is to make more income for their households.  They work tirelessly in an environment of unity and cooperation.

Clotilde is a cook and has been in this profession for some years.  She considers herself to be an excellent cook as many people come to buy the food that she prepares.  She dreams of some day opening her own eatery.

Clotilde is requesting this loan to buy meat, vegetables, noodles and other ingredients for making the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony, 41, is married with two children, aged 18 and 14. He has been a farmer for 20 years, primarily growing rice to sell. According to Tony, he earns about 13,000 PHP a month from farming. With these earnings, he is able to provide for his family's needs and send his children to school.

Tony is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. He hopes that his business will grow and for his children to finish college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 41 years old, single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she has earned a living for the last 10 years by running a retail store. She earns about PHP 3,000 a month, which allows her to meet her everyday expenses. Earlier this year, she joined GDMPC and is applying for her first loan, for PHP 5,000, to buy groceries and school and office supplies to sell to her customers. She hopes to earn enough money to renovate her house so that she has a better place to live in.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merah

texts.en:
Merah is married with 2 children. She is 32 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga.
Merah sells grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 7500 doing this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase housing materials needed to finish her house.
Merah has been a member of PMPC for almost a year.

loans.use: to purchase plywood and pay for carpenters.

loans.name: Balsie Mary

texts.en:
Balsie Mary is 37 years old and lives in Poblacion, Mahayag. She is married with one child.
To earn a living, Balsie Mary has a business selling vitamins. She earns about 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of business. Balsie Mary has a requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase vitamins for her business.
Balsie Mary has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Balsie Mary would like to expand her business in rural communities.

loans.use: to purchase more vitamins for her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children. 
Emma has a pigpen that sells grown & matures pigs. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy animal feed for pigs.
Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin, age 24, earns his living by running a butcher shop. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. He also grows tea for extra income.  

He joined Faulu Kenya so that he can save his money and access business loans. So far, he has gained a great deal of knowledge on business management through training. This has helped him to improve his business.

Martin, who is still unmarried, hopes to expand his business and employ more people. He has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy a cow for slaughter and sale.

loans.use: to buy a cow for slaughter and sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 41 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is married and has four children aged between 1 and 19, three of whom are presently in school and living at home. For the past ten years. Beatrice has been selling fresh bonnie fish in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. Beatrice is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh bonnie fish for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh bonnie fish

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 29 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus cuatro hijos, a los que quiere mucho y desea poder darles una buena calidad de vida. La actividad que realiza Sandra es el transporte de pasajeros, para lo cual cuenta con un auto, que le fue heredado por su madre. Desde entonces ella y su pareja, se encarga de administrar y manejar respectivamente el vehículo. Con el tiempo el vehículo sufrió una avería grave, por lo que en estos momentos se encuentra inmovilizado y guardado en cochera. Por ello solicita capital para hechar andar nuevamente su carro y generar las ganancias que diariamente percibe, pues es más de un año que este trabajo le ha generado los ingresos para su familia. Su anhelo es obtener otro vehículo y tener una flota de carros y formar su empresa de transporte. Este sería el primer crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la reparación de su vehiculo, como la compra de repuestos de auto.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 29, is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She lives with her partner and their four children, who she loves dearly and wants to provide a better quality of life. Sandra provides passenger transportation services with an automobile that she inherited from her mother. She manages the vehicle while her partner is in charge of driving it. Over time the vehicle has sustained major damage. For this reason, it is inoperable and being stored in a garage. Sandra is requesting capital so that her vehicle can be put back into commission and begin generating a daily income. She has been supporting her family through this business for more than a year. Her wish is to obtain another vehicle and have a fleet of cars to start a transportation company.

This will be her first loan with the MFP organization. She hopes to receive support from everyone so that she can continue her work. The amount she requested will be invested in repairs to her vehicle and the purchase of spare parts.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her vehicle and to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is widowed with 3 adult children. 

Rosenda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 3000PHP to purchase fertilizer for her corn production.  Rosenda has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Rosenda hopes to expand her business and be the supplier to a large corn manufacturer in the country.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn production

loans.name: Joyce Nculubi

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 30 years. She describes herself as ambitious and honest.

Joyce operates a retail store where she sells farm and home good products. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. It is located in Athiru shopping centre. Joyce describes her biggest business challenges as the increased cost of farm and home product goods.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm and home products. Her business goal is to expand the general store within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy farm and home good products

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is Isatu who is 26 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 10 and 3 years. She has one additional dependent living with her. In 2008, Isatu established her provisions, school uniform, slippers, and foodstuff business. She began her business because she wanted to raise funds to pay her fees to further her education. Working seven days a week and six hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more provisions, uniform materials, and slippers for her business. In the future, Isatu plans to help her husband build a house for their family and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, uniform materials, and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Loine

texts.en:
Loine is 39 years of age and is married with 6 children. Loine owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business.    

Loine needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase weed-killers, such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Loine joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Loine's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers

loans.name: Sara Amparo

texts.es:
La Sra. Sara  tiene su negocio de venta  de frutas y verdura en el mercado, tiene más de diez años de vender en ese mercado. Ella es viuda ya no tiene hijos a su cargo, actualmente vive con unos de sus nietos a quien le ayuda con sus estudios.
Ella vende de lunes a sábados desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde, su clientela son visitantes del mercado.
Sara acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como es frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Sara sells fruits and vegetables at the market, and has had this business for over ten years. She is a widow with no dependent children. She currently lives with one of her grandsons and helps him with his studies.

Sara works from Monday to Saturday, from 5 am until 2 pm. Her customers are people that visit the market.  Sara visited the CEPRODEL office to request a new loan to purchase merchandise for her business, such as fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Malimba Women Group

texts.en:
Bondu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Bondu was born in a place called Gbanna Kandor, in eastern Sierra Leone, about sixty-six years ago. She is married to a farmer and the couple have three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. 

For eight years now, Bondu has been selling plastic bowls and soap. This is the first loan that Bondu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Bondu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy plastic bowls and soap-making materials in large quantity in order to produce a large quantity of bars of soap for sale.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls and soap-making materials in large quantity in order to produce a large quantity of bars of soap for sale.

loans.name: Obabakir

texts.ru: Обабакир мужчина, который занимается куплей и продажей скота. Сам работает в колхозе трактористом, его зарплата не велика всего 200 сомони в месяц.Поэтому он большую часть времени уделяет уходу за скотом. у него сейчас 10 баранов, и из-за зимнего периода у него закончился корм. Он решил на полученный кредит купить несколько мешков корма. А в начале лета планирует получить кредит на увеличение голов скота. Он благодарен всем кредитным организациям , что они дают ему возможность выполнить запланированной цели.
texts.en:
Obabakir is engaged in buying and selling cattle. He works at the kolkhoz (collective farm) as a tractor driver, but his salary is not high, only 200 somoni per month. Therefore, he devotes most of his time to care for livestock. 

Obabakir currently has 10 sheep, and because of the winter season he has no food left for them. He decided to take a loan to buy several sacks of food. At the beginning of the summer he plans to take a loan to increase the number of livestock. He is grateful to the organizations, which give him the opportunity to meet his planned objectives.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport and drastic weather changes. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes. Her business goal is to be stable within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Childebek

texts.ru: Чилдебек, 48 лет,вдовец, один воспитывает 3 сыновей и 4 дочерей, самому старшему ребенку- 24 года, самому младшему - 8 лет. Образование у Чилдебека - среднее, он работает сварщиком, также в качестве дополнительного дохода, много лет занимается животноводством. Дети всячески помогают по хозяйству. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе, в бизнесе наблюдаются хорошие успехи. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, теленок, 2 нетели и 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 7,200 сом (KGS), заработная плата - примерно 8,500 сом (KGS). Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и воспитание детей. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, и улучшения материального положения семьи, Чилдебек обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Чилдебек является третьим членом группы "Тамара", всего в группе состоят 3 человека. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, воспитание детей и улучшение материального благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Childebek is 36 years old and a widower who raises his three sons and four daughters alone.  His oldest child is 24 years old and the youngest is 8.  Childebek has a secondary education and works as a welder.  As an additional source of income, he has also been involved in animal husbandry for many years.  His children take an active part in the farm work.  Thanks to his very hard work and back-breaking labor, Childebek has been quite successful in his business.  He currently has three cows, one calf, two heifers and ten sheep on his farm and he makes a monthly income of 7,200 som (KGS) in addition to the 8,500 som (KGS) he makes as a welder.  However, this amount of money is still insufficient for a decent life and to raise his children.  

Childebek wants to further develop his farming business and improve the material situation of his family and, for this reason, he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy a few calves.  Childebek is the third member of the "Tamara" group which comprises a total of three people.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further develop his business, educate his children and improve his family's material well-being.

loans.use: to purchase some calves in order to increase the his family's income.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
My name is Patricia D. and I sell juices, churros and cookies. I have been running my business for four years. My flow of clients is very good because my business is located at an ideal spot at the entrance of a hospital in the capital of the country. I am able to support my family with this business. My goal is to increase my inventory and product sales which would enable me to continue supporting my families financial needs and make some improvements to my home.

Mi nombre es Patricia D. me dedico a la venta de jugos, agua, churros, galletas, tengo mi negocio desde hace 4 años, mis clientes son my buenos ya que estoy ubicada en la entrada a un hospital de la cuidad capital, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es poder incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y mantener mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de jugos en lata y caja, agua en bolsa y en botes, bolsas, churros, hielo, galletas

loans.name: Irada

texts.en:
Irada has 4 hectare plot of land. She plans to buy 100 kilogramms of clover seed to grow clover. Irada also breeds cows and wants to buy 2 cows. 
Irada has run this business for 15 years. She lives in Salyan region Yenikand village. She is married, has 4 children.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to bring about her plans. 
With this business she will meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy clover seed and 2 cows

loans.name: Moses Njibwakale

texts.en: Moses started his business in 1990 with capital from sales of his farm produce. His business includes buying cattle from the nearest markets and selling them at a higher price to farmers or at Slaughter houses. Through his business, he has been able to educate his twelve children up to secondary school levels. With a second loan from PEMCI, he will increase his stock and improve his market base by selling in a variety of markets. This will bring him more customers.

loans.use: To increase on his stock

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. runs a small shop from which she sells provisions and bags of clean drinking water. She is 37 years old, married and has three children. She would like to buy more merchandise and drinks to sell to her customers, and has come to LAPO for a loan to make that possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Lauiula

texts.en: As a 46 year old wife and mother of 2 schooling and 5 working children who is taking care of her in-laws, Lauiula thinks that the income from her business is not enough to take care of her family.  Together with her husband, they work in their taro plantation, which is also the sole source of income.  Thus, she requested aid from SPBD and with this loan, and plans to expand her business in order to earn more to cater for the entire family.

loans.use: Expand business and buy more bananas and yams

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. Murage is 36 years old and is married with two children. He lives in the Embakasi constituency of Nairobi city. John started his business in 2005 after getting his initial capital of Ksh.30,000 (USD 460) from savings, which he earned doing a part-time accounting job at a company known as Georgia Kenya Export.

With the initial capital, John purchased stock for a mini-shop, including items like margarine, flour, sugar, salt, milk, bread, juice, snacks, candies, and cereals such as maize (corn), beans, green grams, rice, etc. Fortunately he did not have to pay rent for the shop because the building belongs to his father and allowed him to operate free of charge. Because of his father’s good will, John was able to stock his shop with goods and also purchase a scale, which is handy in any shop for weighing of items like sugar and cereals.

The business has continued to grow over the last two years and the number of customers has increased as well -- so has the demand for new products like fresh meat, vegetables and dairy products. John has to meet his customers’ demands if he is to remain in business. He has therefore decided to start stocking these items, which are in very high demand in his area. The only impediment to this is a lack of coolers, which he will need in order to keep the products fresh. John is therefore requesting a loan of USD 1200, which will enable him to purchase the two coolers that he needs to expand his business and satisfy his customers' needs.
