The repayment period for this loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase two coolers

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo C. is 44 years old, single and lives with his brother in a neighborhood in the center of San Estanislao. He has a business in the main market of San Estanislao.

He is a shopkeeper and sells electronics, cellphone accessories, cds mp3 player, radios and other products. Thanks to his good prices and the high quality of his products, Lorenzo has a lot of customers.

Lorenzo hopes to make his store bigger next year, and for this reason he is asking for a loan to buy merchandise in bulk so that his will increase considerably.

El señor Lorenzo C. tiene 44 años de edad, soltero, vive con su hermano en el barrio centro de San Estanislao y tiene su negocio en el mercado municipal de dicha ciudad.

El señor es comerciante, el mismo se dedica a la venta de artículos de electrónica, accesorios para celulares, cd´s, mp3, radios entre otros. Gracias a sus buenos precios y la calidad de sus productos, Lorenzo, posee una gran cantidad de clientes.

Desea ampliar su salón de ventas el próximo año, y en esta ocasión, solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades ya que por fin de año las ventas aumentan considerablemente.

loans.use:
purchase of merchandise like radios, cds mp3 and dvd players, flashlights etc.

compra de mercaderías como radios, cd´s, mp3, dvd, linternas, etc.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela B. lives in Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan, with her family. Together with her husband, Jameela wants to purchase a second-hand Rickshaw, a three-wheeled local vehicle, so that her husband can provide transportation services part-time (during the day he works at a school).  So far, he has been able to make about US$5 a day from the transportation services. To supplement the family's income, Jameela stitches clothes for people in the city. She hopes that the loan will help her family increase their earnings.

loans.use: Purchase of a rickshaw

loans.name: Sulastri

texts.en: Sulastri is 21 and doesn't have any children.  She and her husband I. have a small shop infront of their house where they sell vegetables, groceries, etc. They could earn $15 a day with a small profit. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $75 to add her inventory. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her inventory

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Ediberta is a single mother, a situation that forced her to have an economic activity that would help her support her children. She also works as a cleaning lady in houses. In a government sponsored program, she learned how to make crafts and with that she worked creating decorations and noticed that in her town there is no notions store, so she combines the three activities.

Thanks to her enthusiasm, she has a great demand. On some occasions she does not have enough merchandise to offer to her customers and this is why she is requesting a loan for US $300 which she is determined to pay in a period of 5 months. With this money Edilberta will be able to buy more merchandise to help her business and two children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Edilberta es Madre soltera, situación que la obligó a tener una actividad económica que le ayudase ha mantener a sus hijos, también realiza labores domesticas en casas, en un programa de gobierno logró aprender a realizar manualidades y con ello se dedicó a realizar adornos y observo que en su pueblo no había mercería por lo que combina las tres actividades.

Gracias a su entusiasmo, la demanda que tiene es grande. Y en ocasiones no tiene la mercancía suficiente para poder atender a sus clientes es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Edilberta podrá comprar más mercancía para sacar adelante su negocio y a sus dos hijos.

loans.use: buying merchandise (Comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is a motivated young businessman from Zaporozhye, a city in the central part of Ukraine. He operates his own key duplication business on the south side of Zaporozhye. Igor’s business has grown in the four years since he started and he is making preparations for further expansion. Recently, he purchased a small kiosk that he’d like to remodel to use for an additional location. He rents one of his business places, but by owning, he can help keep his overhead costs down. Igor has around $3000 invested in his business and he makes about $700 profit each month.

Igor has requested a short term loan of $300 to help with expenses involved in opening his new business location. Igor has proven to be a smart, responsible business owner. We are happy to have this opportunity to assist with the ongoing success of his business.

loans.use: Help to open a new business location

loans.name: Abdul Habib

texts.en:
This is A. H., a young man who’s  25 years old and is the owner of a spare parts shop. He lives in Kabul right now.
He wants to buy some materials for his shop to improve his small business and find more customers, so he has applied to AFSG to take out a 50,000 Afghanis (US$ 1050) short-term loan to achieve his purpose.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her workshop and buy more materials for sewing

loans.name: Merly Benidia

texts.es:
Mrs. Merly Benidia G. Púa, a member of the “Las Margaritas II” Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin region of Peru, in the Province of San Martin, District of Banda de Shilcayo and works as a street vendor of sweets.

She sells sweets as a street vendor at a variety of tourist attractions and amusement centers in the Morales District and downtown Tarapoto. She tells us that her husband began selling sweets as a street vendor and when she saw how well it was going for him, she decided to do it as well.

The loan of 800 soles ($275), which will be repaid over 4 months, will give her the capital to purchase cookies and crackers in a variety of flavors and brands in individual packages, bags of candies in different flavors, boxed gum of a variety of brands, chocolates, etc.

Merly is 44 years old and is a very responsible and dedicated woman. She wishes to get ahead and support her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Merly Benidia G. Púa, socia del B. C “Las Margaritas II”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria.

Ella vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria por los diversos recreos turísticos y centros de diversiones del distrito de Morales y el Centro de Tarapoto, nos cuenta, que primero su pareja se dedicaba a esta actividad, ella vio que le fue muy bien y es rentable, la motivó a dedicarse a esto.

El préstamo recibido de S/. 800.00 que pagará en 4 meses, con dicho capital comprará galletas en paquetes de variados sabores y marcas, caramelos en bolsas de diversos sabores, chicles en cajas de diferentes marcas, chocolates, etc.

Ella tiene 44 años de edad, es una mujer muy responsable, decidida, con deseos de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale sweets.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 37, is a divorced woman with three children, ages 18, 15 and 11. She also takes care of one other child who is two months old. She began selling clothes in 1999. Judith works from 8AM to 8PM and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Judith has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 16 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas son pequeñas empresarias informales y actualmente están en 5to. Ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, beneficiándose con un crédito promedio de 750.000 mil guaraníes para cada integrante.

La señora Wilma es la presidenta del comité y como tal es la que mas exige se cumpla a cabalidad las normas que regulan éste programa y entre ellas, destacamos la exigencia de acudir puntualmente a las reuniones semanales, y las que se ausentan deben informar con anticipación el motivo de su inasistencia, caso contario es apercibido por la comisión.

El comité tiene proyectado como otros comités de la zona la de realizar una chocolatada con sorteo de regalos para los niños en su día, que será el día Sábado 16-08-08, así también una característica de este comité es el buen trabajo que vienen realizando en su comunidad como la limpieza de las cuadras, pintata del cordón de la calle, lo cual demuestran que en esa zona hay un grupo de gente muy unido.

Las señoras de este comité poseen actividades diversas entre ellas hay vendedoras de comidas, vendedoras de chipa que es una comida típica muy consumida en nuestro país, despensas, venta de bebidas, otras elaboran y venden dulces y otras poseen comedores donde diariamente dan de comer a personas que trabajan o viven en la zona.
texts.en:
This committee is comprised of a 16 female workforce in the Cabanas company in the city of Caacupe. They all have small informal enterprises, and are in the fifth cycle of the female workforce program committee. This allows them to take advantage of an average credit line of 750,000 guarnies for each member. Wilma is the president of the committee, and as president she organizes the goals and regulates the program. Among the women we emphasize the necessity of attending the weekly reunions and require people to properly notify the group if they need to miss one. The committee has projected like other committees of the area to hold a “chocolatado” which is a very large gathering, and hold drawings for children’s gifts on the 16 of August 2008. Another characteristic of this committee is the great work they are presently doing in the community cleaning the streets, and painting the lines on the road. All of which demonstrates that in this community there is a group of very united people. Amongst all of the women of this committee there are many diverse activities that they take part in, such as food vendors, producers of “chipa” a very typical dish and is highly consumed in our country. There are also everyday product vendors, refreshment vendors, others make and sell candies, and others have food stands where they provide food everyday for the people who work in the area.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials for the production of chipas.  For example starch, cheese, vegetable oil, and others will purchase cloths to sell, consumer goods, coal, refresments.

loans.name: Mwajuma's Mwanzo Mgumu. Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 38 years old.  She is married with 6 children between the ages of 7 and 18 years old.  She has been a clothes, home utensils and fish seller since 2004.  Everyday she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.
 
Mwajuma is now looking for a loan to improve her business by adding to her current stock.  She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Sharifa.

loans.use: To improve her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Candida Del Rosario

texts.es:
El nombre del cliente es Candida del Rosario M. su edad es de 70 años  su  estado civil es de casada no tiene hijos a  su cargo su compañero de vida tiene un negocio propio, el sueño que ella tiene es poder continuar atendiendo su pequeño cafetín, el cual esta ubicado en la empresa Enitel, donde alquila un pequeño local, de esta manera lograr su auto sostenibilidad, por consiguiente sus ingresos fijos y aporte al hogar.


La señora Candida del Rosario cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo el cual tiene un negocio de servicios telefónicos, la señora M. tiene ocho años de dedicarse a esta actividad ofreciendo todo tipo de refrigerios, golosinas y otros sus mayores deseos es poder establecer un negocio en su casa  y para ello requiere contar con el apoyo nuestro y hacer realidad su proyecto,  la señora M. trabaja con fundación león 2000 desde hace cinco años, manifiesta que agradece a fundación  el apoyo que le han brindado y espera que se le siga apoyando para poder cumplir con su sueño que es lo que tanto desea.
texts.en:
The nameof the client is Candida del Rosaria Montaya and her age is 70 years. Her marital status is married. She doesn't have children in her charge. Her life partner has his own business, the dream that she has is to be able to continue attending her small cafe, which is located in the Enitel area, where she rents a small space, and in this way to attain her self sustainability, to meet her bills. Mrs. Candida del Rosario counts on the help of her husband, who has a telephone services business. Mrs. M. has 8 years dedicated to this activity offering all types of tidbits. Her biggest hope is to be able to establish a business in her home, and for this, she requires our support. to make her project a reality, Mrs. M. has worked with the Leon 2000 Founation for five years, and thanks to the foundation's support, she has achieved and continues to continue the support to complete her dream which is all that she wants so much.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital

loans.name: Emsada

texts.en:
Emsada was born in 1978 and she lives in Rostov, a suburb in Bosnia.  She is married and has two children who are 5 and 11 years old.  Her husband has seasonal work, operating a tractor for local farmers.  Between his jobs, Emsada supports her family by growing vegetables and selling milk from her cow.  

Emsada requests a loan of 1,200KM from Women for Women International to buy a second cow.  She hopes that the additional income from selling milk and milk products will help to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica O. is 56 years old and married with eight children. She sells provisions like tomato paste, detergent, milk and soft drinks. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. 

She is indeed grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Shahmurad

texts.en: This kind man was born in 1948. He is married, has four children, and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region of Kurdmahmudlu village. He has been breeding cattle for 10 years and is requesting a loan to buy two calves to increase his business. This will help provide better for his family.

loans.use: To purchase calves for breeding business

loans.name: Nancy Reyna

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Nancy es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene un molino de granos en su casa en donde brinda servicios de molido, también Nancy compra cereales de las feriantes que le llevan a su domicilio, los cuales los procesa y los vende en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, arveja.
Los sueños de Nancy son tener una ferretería y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Community Bank "Buena Suerte" (meaning Good Luck).

Nancy is married, she is 39 years old and she has 2 children. Nancy owns a grain mill in her home where she provides milling services. Nancy also purchases cereals from vendors that come to her home, and then processes them and sells them in the different markets in the city.

Nancy requires a loan in the amount of 3000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of wheat, grain, and sweet pees. Nancy's dream is to set up a hardware store and to purchase a car.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wheat, grain, and sweet peas.

loans.name: Nassuna Aisha Group

texts.en: Aisha is the leader of this four-person group.  She is a 30-year-old single mother of five children between the ages of 13 and 19. All her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She rents a one-room house where where she lives with three of her children; her other children live in the village with her mother. They have electricity but no piped water in their home. The family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a ladies salon in Ndeeba. Aisha works seven days a week and uses public transport to get to and from shopping in Kampala. Aisha averages about seven customers a day and works mainly with women and children.  Aisha has been in this business for ten years. She has been a member of MCDT for four years and this is her eighth loan. She wants to buy more braids and creams for her salon.

loans.use: To buy hair creams and braids

loans.name: Zuhra Begum Javed Akbar Bhatti Group

texts.en:
My name is Zuhra begum and I am a 44-year-old lady. I quit school after completing the eighth standard because my father had little financial resources. I own a two-room brick house in Lahore, a city in Pakistan, and have been living in it with my family for the last 10 years. I am married to a man named J. A. B. and he is an electrician by profession. He also sells electrical supplies (wires, switchboards and switches). I am a mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. My elder son is involved in his father’s business. The others are getting an education from a  school located near our house. My elder daughter works in an office for a monthly wage. I operate a ready-made shawl-selling business. I buy shawls from a famous bazaar in Lahore named “Azam Market and Ichra” and sell in the community. I have been doing this work for the last five years. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I’m applying again for a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires, switchboards and switches) for my husband’s business. 

I’m a group leader of some more women in my locality. Iram baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Kosar begum baji and Azra parveen baji each wants a loan to buy embroidery material (beads, colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.  Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her mobile phone-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies to sell

loans.name: Noami

texts.en:
Naomi A. started her trading business seventeen years ago at Eguase, a suburb of Moore where she lives. Naomi prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality smoked fish, fresh tomatoes, onions, pepper etc. and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She also sells fresh vegetables like carrots, green pepper etc. in the community. She is now 42 years old and married with four children who are currently in school.

She has been stuck for funds to make business progress due to the economic crisis in the country. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of assorted fishes and vegetables to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance. Naomi belongs to a village bank called 'Won som' which means 'let all help'.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables like pepper and tomatoes, smoked fishes etc.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Раджабова Назира  1962  года рождения, замужем имеет одного ребенка. Она получила средне специальное  образование делопроизводителя. Но по специальности устроиться на работу не смогла. Сейчас она работает специалистом в макаронном цеху.  С ней работают несколько инвалидов, им платят  заработную плату и обеспечивают жильём. Назира получила кредит на покупку муки, для изготовления макарон. Первый кредит получила в прошлом году. На ремонт оборудования для изготовления макарон.
texts.en:
Nazira R. was born in 1962, she is married and has one child. She received a degree in business management, but she was unable to find a job in this profession. Currently, she is working as a specialist in a pasta producing plant. She works with several disabled people and receives a salary and housing. Last year, Nazira received a loan to purchase flour for pasta production. She requires a loan to repair equipment for pasta production.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.
Julia es separada, tiene 56 años y 2 hijos, Julia vende ropa variada y calzados de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza a trabajadores de distintas instituciones, también vende artefactos pequeños. Además Julia brinda servicio de preparación de comida para diferentes eventos.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 2550 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos y ropa.
Julia sueña con que la empresa de sus hijos sean prósperos, su ultimo hijo culmine su profesión.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank Legión. Julia is separated, 56 years old, and has 2 children. Julia sells a variety of clothing and shoes according to her clients’ orders; she sells to workers from various institutions, and also sells small items. In addition, Julia provides catering services for different events. Julia needs a loan of 2550 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of shoes and clothing. Julia dreams that her children’s ventures are successful, and that her last child finishes his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Mercedes es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes estudia antropología y vende ropa variada, artefactos dependiendo de los pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza de casa en casa y en instituciones, sus productos los adquiere en las ciudades de Tacna, Moquegua.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de un artefacto.
Los sueños de Mercedes son tener un local estable y propio, culminar sus estudios y sacar adelante a sus hijos con una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Rosas (Roses) Communal Bank. Mercedes has a partner, is 32 years old, and has two children. Mercedes studies anthropology and sells assorted clothes and devices, depending on the orders of her customers. She makes her sales door to door and in institutions. She acquires her products in the cities of Tacna and Moquegua.

Mercedes needs a loan of 1000 PEN which will be invested the partial payment of a device. Mercedes’ dream is to have her own stable location, complete her studies, and to get her children ahead with a better education.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: As partial payment for a device

loans.name: Ramosa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Ramosa, ella vive en la provincia D. Calca en el distrito D. Huarán, situado dentro del valle sagrado perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

La socia tiene 49 años ella es casada, tiene 4 hijos y los últimos hijos tienen (20, 22) años ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, nuestra socia venD. granos (maíz, habas, cebada, trigo y papas); ella también se dedica a la compra y venta D. palos, y a vender hormigón, piedras, adobes todos estos últimos para materiales D. construcción, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios. 

Nuestra socia está muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado debido a que en la zona no se encuentra la banca financiera, ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. sus deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This associate is Sra. Ramosa. She lives in the province of Calca in the district of Huarán, situated within the sacred valley in the department of Cusco. Sra. Ramosa is 49 years old and is married. She has 4 children - the last 2 are 20 and 22 years old. She alternates her household activities with commerce, selling grains (maize, broadbeans, barley, wheat and potato); she also buys and sells poles, concrete, stones, and adobe, the latter materials for construction. She is seeking a loan to be able to reinvest in her different businesses. Sra. Ramosa is very thankful and values the loan granted to her, as in the region there isn't a financial bank. She promises to fulfill the payments for her debt in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Kosar Parveen Niaz Ali Group

texts.en:
Kosar parveen baji is a wife of N. A. and has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. They both have a business making & selling plastic bottles. Kosar baji stays at home and prepares the bottles while N. A. goes to different shops and clinics to sell them. They started this business 4 years ago; they are special in this work because they do it well. Kosar baji currently needs a loan to advance their business. She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Salamat baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Amna kosar baji wants a loan to buy calling cards to sell. Suraiya nasreen baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to sell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Kosar baji is seated in the middle of the baji’s and is showing her plastic bottles”.

loans.use: To buy plastic for making plastic bottles to sell

loans.name: Ekuah

texts.en: Ekuah G. sells food stuffs and fruits at Abura. Ekuah has received junior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Ekuah has been selling food stuffs and fruits since 2005. She is responsible for helping the children to attend school. Her loan will be used to supply more food stuffs and fruits to customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To supply more food stuffs and fruits to customers.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is married and has three young children, ages eight, five, and one-and-a-half.  She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin, near the center of the city.  

In Porto-Novo, Jacqueline sells rice and beans to passersby on the street. She also sells shoes from her home. Jacqueline buys her products at the Ouando Market, the largest market in Porto-Novo. 

She is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner, to buy beans and peanut oil to use in her dishes. Currently, she has a stock of beans at home and plans to use the loan to replenish her supplies when they run low. In the future, Jacqueline hopes to expand the variety of food that she sells.

loans.use: Peanut oil and beans

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy C., age 43, is from Parola, Tondo, Manila, a shanty town near Manila Bay. She is married to Ramon, age 50. They have 2 children.

Amy has been managing her general store for 5 years. She started with just a handful of biscuits to sell to children and a few canned goods. Now, her general store has grown. She makes a monthly profit of at least P8,000.00,  especially on peak months.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2002 and was among the Intramuros Branch’s pioneer members. She needs a loan of P10,000.00 to use as additional capital for her growing general store.

It has been her dream to convert her general store into a larger grocery chain some day. She also works hard to support her children’s education.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Lupeta borrower group in Nzonwa, Mbeya. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 16, 14, 10,  and 6 years old. She also cares for other 3 dependents.

Ester has owned a cafe business selling food for 2  years, she works 6  hours a day and she  earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000  Tanzanian shillings.

This is Ester`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more food commodities to her cafe business.

With the additional profit she  gains from the use of this loan, Ester hopes to save money, pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to her cafe business

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy responsable en sus pagos, viven en un mismo Barrio, donD. se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "SAN MIGUEL", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 4º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada por socias responsables y activas, son muy unidas entre ellas,  como presidenta esta  la señora Magda G. P. ,ella es lider D. su grupo,muy sociable,  tiene tienda D. barrio en su domicilio venD. almuerzos, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como transportista. Como tesorera esta la socia Dominga C. quien es, muy responsable es casada tiene 4 hijos ella tiene su tienda D. barrio,  el credito lo utiliza para  aumento D. capital. Como secretaria esta la socia Patricia V. es soltera estudiante no tiene hijos el credito lo utiliza para aumento D. capital en venta D. productos AVON.

loans.use: AUMENTO DE CAPITAL

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 32 años de experiencia en la ganadería y en la agricultura, con estas labores, junto con su esposo, sacaron adelante a sus hijos que ahora son mayores de edad. Pero Segundina se sigue dedicando a sus cultivos, pues aun tiene dos menores hijos a quienes solventarles los estudios.  Los animales que cría son vacas, ovejas y pollos, ella misma acondicionó su granja en un espacio de su casa, y es con la venta de estos animales con los que solventa los gastos de su hogar hasta que llegue la época de cosecha.

Esta es la quinta oportunidad en que  tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y está muy comprometida con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Segundina is 59 years old, and lives with her husband and two of their children in their own home. She has 32 years of experience in cattle raising and agriculture, thanks to which, she and her husband raised and educated their older sons. Segundina continues planting, however, as she still has two young sons to put through school. Segundina raises cows, sheep, and chickens. She herself started her farm in a plot near her home. She uses what she earns selling animals to sustain her family until harvest time. This is Segundina's fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She belongs to a community bank and she is committed to paying her installments on time. The loan she is requesting today will be invested in fertilizer for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 3 hijos; Evelin de 8, Maycol de 5 y Tatiana de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda de abarrotes de Antonia es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrir.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en la bodega principal de su barrio.

Este el quinto préstamo de Antonia con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará mas provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 35 years old. She is a happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her 3 children, Evelin who is 8 years old, Maycol, 5, and Tatiana who is 2. Her children are the motivation for all her effort. Antonia's grocery store is one of the most busy in her neighborhood. Her great charisma and kindness have made her the favorite of her neighbors, who do not hesitate in doing their shopping since very early because they know hers is the first store to open. What she likes best about her work is chatting with her neighbors about the things that happen in the neighborhood. She has been working on this for 4 years and thinks that the hardest thing is having to be all day long inside her store, since she has to tend to it continuously if she doesn't want her sales to decrease. In the future, she hopes her business grows and becomes the main grocery store in her neighborhood. This is Antonia's fifth loan with MFP. She knows that if she pays it on time she will have access to another one with more ease and without bringing complications to her communal bank where she is well loved by the rest of her partners. With the two thousand and five hundred soles requested she will buy more provisions for her grocery store and in that way increase her stock of products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey N. lives in ThommoN. village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, and she is also a water lily seller. Her husband, Mr. Oem Savuth, is a teacher who can make a small salary to support the family. He spends a lot of moN. on transportation because his work place is far from home. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Srey N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work. Mrs. Srey N. has three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study because this child is only four years old. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Benkola sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 27 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de commerce. Elles font le petit commerce d’articles divers. Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents  ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce nouveau prêt servira à  acheter,  une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires, d’habillements et de produits cosmétiques. Les articles sont achetés en gros à Bamako et le tout  est revendu sur place au marché et au bord du goudron à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles espèrent  réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont partagés entre  la nourriture, la santé et les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group of the Benkola association are married women who are, on average, 27 years and have three children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the village of Konobougou, located in the district of Barouéli, in the region of Ségou, in the Republic of Mali. These women are known among neighbors and clients. They are all active in selling a variety of materials, and collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to constantly have financial support for their activities. They are currently on their third group loan and correctly reimbursed the two previous loans. This new loan serves to purchase a large quantity of food products, clothes and cosmetics that are purchased in Bamako and re-sold at the open air markets to a clientele composed of both women and men. They are hoping to each earn an average profit of 35,000 FCFA [approximately 80 USD] per month, which then go to paying for food, health and other activities.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of materials/products

loans.name: Suma Chuyma Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “German Busch”, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Suma C.” que significa “Buen Corazón” tiene 8 integrantes, todas tienen diferentes negocios como: venta de fruta, elaboración de muebles, venta de comida, ferretería, venta de ropa, atención de llamadas y otros. Su presidenta es Victoria V. quien indica que el grupo se formo con amigas y vecinas de la zona  que viven cerca del Centro Focal, lo que les gusta de Pro Mujer  es el servicio de salud, porque  les atienden a ellas, sus hijos, esposos y familiares, además les agrada mucho las capacitaciones que imparten en Destrezas en Negocios ya que les orienta a administrar mejor sus negocios.
texts.en:
You will find the Suma C., which means Good Heart, Communal Bank in the German Busch community center. It has eight members, and they all have different businesses like selling fruit, making furniture, selling fruit, hardware store, selling clothes, calling services, and others. The president, Victoria V., says that the group is comprised of friends and neighbors in the area where they live near the community center. What they like about Pro Mujer is the health service because it takes care of them, their children, their husbands, and their relatives. Also, they are very pleased with the trainings given about business skills. They train the members to administer their businesses better.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca B. is from the village of Tiaman, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Francisca is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Francisca sells ready to wear products in the local communities. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Francisca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en: Zorigbaatar S. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Tosontsengel soum in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. The family lives in a "ger", or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, 6, attends a local primary school while his wife stays at home with the youngest daughter, 2. Zorigbaatar is an extremely busy young man who currently operates three businesses. During the warm months, he operates a car washing service, charging between 2,400 and 4,000 tugrugs (1.5-2.5 USD) per car. During the winter months, he operates a skating rink and charges his customer 500 tugrugs per hour to skate. All year round, he uses his carpentry skills to make and sell wooden products. In his carpentry business, he has sales between 500,000 and 800,000 tugrugs per month with a profit of 150,000 and 250,000 tugrugs. He hopes to eventually build a large workspace where he can operate his car washing business year-round. He says: "My wife and I are young and we have many hopes and aspirations for the future." Zorigbaatar is requesting a loan of 500,000 tugrug (approx. $344 USD) in order to purchase feed for his family's livestock and carpentry equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his family's livestock and carpentry equipment for his business.

loans.name: Path

texts.en: Mrs. Path P. is 28 years old and earns a living as a pig breeder. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and normally earns about $3 a day. In addition, she sometimes goes fishing with her husband in and around the river, where there are a lot of fishermen. She currently cares for two kids, who attend school. Path requests a loan to buy more pig food and piglets for her pig stall.

loans.use: To buy more pig food and piglets.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco” desde hace 7 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de juegos artificiales.

Maria nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  carrizo, nitro, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una pequeña empresa de juegos artificiales bien implementado. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las bromas de las socias y la alegria que hay en el grupo
texts.en:
Sra. Maria has been a member of the Cristo Blanco community bank for 7 years. She lives in the Juliaca district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 44 years old and partnered with 2 children. She dropped out of high school in her third year and now makes a living selling fireworks. Maria tells us that she used her first Movimiento Manuela Ramos loan for S/.300 new soles to increase her working capital. Her next loan, for S/.500 new soles, will be used to buy supplies for making fireworks. Her dream for the future is to establish a small, well-run fireworks business. What she most likes about the community bank are the jokes she shares with the other members and the fun they have as a group.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for fireworks business.

loans.name: Blanca Nuvia

texts.es:
Doña Blanca es muy dedicada a su trabajo, es madre soltera, tiene una hija mayor la cual le ayuda en el negocio para atennder a sus clientes. Blanca es muy responsable y logro sacar adelante a su hija sola.
Blanca se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los dias para arreglarse y luego atender a sus clientes.
en estos momentos necesita un prestamo para comprar mas fardos de ropa, en el lugar donde ella compra los fardos estan clasificados por el tipo de ropa, quiere comprar ropa que no sea caliente, como camisetas, calsonetas y camisas de vestir.
blanca necesita el credito para salir adelante con su negocio, las ganancias que obtenga las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca is a single mother who is dedicated to her work. She has an adult daughter who helps with her business by attending to the customers. Blanca is very responsible and was able to support her daughter by herself. She wakes up at 6am every day to get dressed and later tend to her customers.

At the moment, Blanca needs a loan to buy more bundles of clothing. The place where she acquires her inventory assembles the bundles based on the type of clothing. She wants to buy clothes that are not too hot, such as T-shirts, bathing suits, and dress shirts. Blanca wants to access this loan so that she can get ahead in her business. The income she generates is needed to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of clothing

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en:
Tohir is an enterprising man, active and very hardworking. He has always wanted to have his own business and he made this happen 13 years ago when he started up his own business selling flour, sugar, oil and vegetables. He is married and has seven children. This business, apart from being his dream, is the way Tohir can earn a living for his family and educate his children. Starting wasn’t easy, but with his and his family’s hard work, they have been able to get ahead. Tohir has put all of his effort into making his business grow. He is just missing one little push, which is why he needs a loan of 4500 Somoni, which he will use to buy merchandise to stock his store. With this, he hopes to offer a wider variety and better service to his customers, which is how he hopes to ensure that they will prefer his store. This will help him grow as a small business owner. You can be an important part of the development of this store. You can support Tohir and his family. With your help, he can do great things.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Samnang C. is the village bank president who was selected by the members of this group which consists of nineteen-members located I. Sdau Kanlaeng village I. Kandal province. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose. With the loan, too, they hope to increase their income to improve their family living.

Mr. Samnang C. works I. security I. a private company and receives a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Chreb Loem, is on the staff of an organization. I. order to travel to work, Mr. Samnang C. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for transportation.

This couple has three children who are all students I. the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: John Francisco

texts.es:
John Francisco P. C. tiene 46 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos entre los 8 y 10 años de edad. En la vía Polonuevo, municipio de Santo Tomás de  gente amable, hospitalaria, jovial y sobre todo buenos anfitriones; John tiene su negocio de comprar, criar y vender cerdos y cabríos; él está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Santo Domingo por valor de $2.000.000 para invertirlo en cerdos jóvenes y alimentos para ellos, como purina, maíz y soya.
Antes John compraba cerdo en pie y cabríos por libras para poner su carne en vitrinas, pero poco a poco se dedicó a comprar para engorde, reproducción, selección y venta, proceso que ahora realiza en sus porquerizas. 
El sueña con tener un gran capital para comprar animales para el engorde y la posterior matanza, otro de sus sueños es tener adecuadas en un 100% las instalaciones de la porqueriza. Para John en el verano se presenta su mayor desafío, pues los cultivos como la yuca, maíz y el millo no prosperan y son la materia prima para el engorde de los animales, igualmente se pierden los pastos y se disminuye en un 70% la producción de este alimento, entonces John lo tiene que comprar de contado y más costosos para conservar en un estándar de calidad sus cabrios especialmente, de todas maneras siempre vive muy contento y disfruta de esta finca que está muy cercana a Santo Tomás, municipio famoso por el turismo de feligreses en su Semana Santa.
texts.en:
John Francisco P. C. is 46 and lives with his wife and 3 children, ages 8-10 on Via Polonuevo, town of Santa Tomás. There people are friendly, hospitable, happy and especially welcoming. John has a business of buying, raising and selling pigs and goats. He is using his first loan with the Santo Domingo Foundation of $2,000 to buy young pigs and food for them, such as purina, corn and soy. In the past John bought whole hogs and goats by the pound to sell the meat, but little by little he started buying the animals to fatten, breed, select and sell-which is what he now does on his pig farm. His big dream is to have the capital to buy animals to fatten and then slaughter. Another one of this dreams is to have aqueducts in 100% of his pens. For John summer gives him his biggest challenges for his crops of yucca, corn and millet don't do well, and these are the main foods needed to fatten the animals. He also loses the grass and his production drops 70% of the feed. Then John has to pay cash and it's more expensive to keep up the quality, especially of his goats. However, he always lives happily and enjoys his farm which is very close to Santo Tomás, a town famous for its religious tourists during Holy Week.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Paul Kiprotich

texts.en:
Paul Kiprotich R. is a thirty-six-year-old maize farmer in Kipsangui in Eldoret, Kenya. He is married to Peres R. and together they are blessed with four beautiful children.

Paul has been a farmer for four years now and he sells maize after harvest when he gets a monthly income of five thousand shillings. He also has a clinic in the same area.

Paul came to know about KADET through other KADET clients. This will be his first loan from KADET and he plans to use the loan to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

In the future, Paul wants to buy more land and become a large-scale farmer in Eldoret.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Abdullah-E-Mubina Group

texts.en:
Abdullah is a member of Abdullah-e-Mubina group. He lives in Khir Khana, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with four children, one son and three daughters who are enrolled in school.

He has got a shop in which he does embroidery work. He designs different kinds of clothes and does very beautiful embroidery work on them. He needs the loan to purchase embroidery materials and expand his business as well.

He hopes to be a good businessman in the future and that he will progress.

loans.use: purchase embroidery materials and expand his business

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa B. est un célibataire de 25 ans qui vit dans une famille élargie à Hamdallaye “Zantiguibougou”, un des quartiers périphériques de ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  B. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié  il y a environ trois ans au commerce notamment la vente d’articles divers (huile alimentaire, sel de cuisine, spaghetti, savons etc.) dont il dispose une place au niveau du marché avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménages. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui, il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
 Avec ce deuxième prêt, il compte acheter 4 futs d’huile alimentaire, 15 paquets de maggi, 5 sacs de sel, 2 cartons de spaghetti, 2 cartons de savon, 1 carton de sardines , etc. 
Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre en détail, au  comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 190 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Drissa B. is a 25-year old single man who lives in an extended family in Hamdallaye "Zantiguibougou", one of the peripheral districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having had several unsuccessful activities, Mr. B. started a business three years ago selling various products (edible oil, kitchen salt, spaghetti, soaps, etc.); he has a place in the market where he sells to a customer base made up essentially of housewives. He is in great demand from his customers owing to the quality of his products. In order to satisfy his ever increasing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his second individual loan. The previous loan was repaid on time. With this second loan, he is planning on buying four barrels of edible oil, 15 packets of "Maggi" stock cubes, five bags of salt, two cartons of spaghetti, two cartons of soaps, one carton of sardines, etc. He gets his supplies from local wholesalers before selling them retail for cash and on credit. With this loan he is planning on making a monthly profit of 190,000FCFA, which will be used essentially to expand his business, to contribute to the household expenses and to pay off the interest on his loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase diverse products

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre, Mujeres Emprendedoras se conformó en fecha 17 de mayo del 2006, mediante las promociones que realizó la Asesora en la zona, y gracias a la actual Directora General se comformó el Comité, que se encuentra integrado por 19 mujeres y  siguen trabajando  con el mismo entusiamo y esfuerzo,  ya se encuentra el 14º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Señora Marciana Oporto es una de las integrantes y trabaja en su casa como ama de casa y tambien posee una Despensa bastante surtida, por lo que tiene una buena clientela ya formada.
Tiene intenciones de incrementar sus ingresos mediante la ampliación de su despensa, a la cual desea agregar más productos de artículos de ferretería y electricidad para el hogar, como focos, portalamparas, etc. que son muy solicitados por los por los pobladores, ella desea adquirir en gran cantidad  ya que el costo se abarataria bastante y por ende aumentando sus ingresos para concretar este objetivo ella solicta el prestamo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) Communal Bank was formed on May 17th of 2006, because of the publicity done by the advisor in the area. Thanks to the current general director, they formed the group, which is comprised of 19 women. The women continue working with the same enthusiasm and effort. They are in their fourteenth cycle, and they work in a cohesive and supportive way within the program. Marciana Oportoa is one of the members. She works in her house as a housewife, and she also has a well stocked grocery store. She has a good customer base. She plans to increase her income by expanding her grocery store. She wishes to add more hardware and electrical products for the home. She will add things like light bulbs and lamp holders, etc. People request these items a lot. She wants to get a large quantity because the price will be a great deal lower. She wants to do this to increase her income. She is requesting the loan in order to meet this objective.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hardware and electrical products for the home like light bulbs and lamp holders, etc.

loans.name: Ramon Victor

texts.es: El joven Ramon Victor L. E. tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su esposa la joven Paola Dominguez y su hijo pequeño en la Colonia Jicaro Galan de San Lorenzo, Valle. Ramon se dedica a vender leña, tiene un pickup de su propiedad el cual utiliza para transportar la leña a diferentes colonias de San Lorenzo y Nacaome, una ciudad aledaña, en los dias de la semana. Durante el fin de semana, Ramon viaja hasta la capital de Tegucigalpa para vender pescados y camarones. Siendo un joven emprendedor, su sueño es establecer bien el mercado de sus productos para poder contratar a un asistente que le ayude con el negocio.
texts.en:
This young borrower is Ramon Victor L. E.. He is 21 years old and he lives with his wife, Paola Dominguez, and their young child in Jicaro Galan, a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, a town located in the Valle department. Ramon engages in selling firewood: during the week, with his own pickup truck he transports firewood to the different neighborhoods of San Lorenzo and of the neighboring town of Nacaome. During the week-end, Ramon travels up to the capital city of Tegucigalpa to sell fish and shrimps. Being a young entrepreneur, he dreams of profitably setting his products up in the market in order to hire an assistant to help him with his activity.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel K. is 44 years old and married to a hotelier. He has three children aged from six to ten years old. He and his wife hope to give their children a good education to the university level. His business is located at Mwingi, which is served by Thika branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. He has been selling assorted goods, which include handkerchiefs, padlocks, sunglasses, watches, torches, batteries and other items to the local people. He has been doing this business for thirteen years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He will use his loan of Kes 20,000 to increase his stock of assorted items to meet the needs of his customers. He hopes to one day be able to run his business on his own premises. He describes himself as very hardworking, innovative and patient.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of goods for his retail shop.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia C. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax de Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old. Virginia is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Virginia sells fruits and vegetables to the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Xavier Ordem

texts.pt:
Xavier Ordem Gazolinha  nasceu na Provincia de Zambézia, é casado, pai de 3 filhos  de 7 aos 17 anos de idade, todos  vão a Escola. fez o ensino médio não deu continuidade devido a distância que o separa de casa a universidade. Vive na casa propria e  Responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em zambezia enviando lhes em cada semestre 2.000.00mt.

Xavier é recrutado para tropa, compriu 2 anos, e de seguida é chamado para fazer um curso de formação Básica intesivo nas Forças Armadas.Hoje é Policia com catagoria de Investigador criminal (PIC) trabalha 24 sob 24 horas sendo 2 dias de trabalho e 2 dias de folga consecutivamente, auferindo mensalmente um valor de 5.500.00mt,  com ajuda da sua esposa conseguem construir uma capoeira e iniciar com a criação de pintos para aumentar a renda familiar. Mas como não tinham  fundo suficiente  e com muitas encomendas, assim aproxima a Hluvuku e Kiva e solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume da sua criaçao, tem criado por média 4x100 caixas de pintos gastando um valor de 30.000.00mt e tendo de lucro um valor de 10.000.00mt dependendo muito mais das mortalidades e o tempo de venda.


Este é o quarto empréstimo de Xavier na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 22.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos para aumentar a sua criação. Os empréstimos anteriores foram no valor de 14.000,00mt, 15.000,00mt e de 22.000.00)mt foram usados na criação de pintos.
texts.en:
Xavier Ordem Gazolinha was born in the Zambezi province. He is married and has three children ages 7 to 17 who all attend school. Xavier attended school through high school, but did not continue due to the distance from his home to the university. He lives in his own home and supports his parents who live in Zambezia, sending them 2.000.00mt every 6 months. Xavier was recruited to be a soldier. He completed 2 years and then was called to do an intensive basic training course in the Armed Forces. Today he is a police officer with the rank of criminal investigator (PIC). He works two 24 hour shifts followed by two consecutive days of rest, earning 5.500.00mt per month. With his wife's help he was able to build a coop and begin raising chickens to increase his family's income. However, he did not have sufficient funds and had many orders, so he came to Hluvuku and Kiva to request a loan to increase his flock. He has raised 4X100 boxes of chicks, spending 30.000.00mt and with a profit of 10.000.00mt depending greatly on mortality rates and the time of sale. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku and his second with Kiva. It is for 22.000.00mt which he will use to purchase chicks to increase his flock. The previous loans were for 14.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt and 22.000.00mt, which were also used to raise chicks.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
N. Edith lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she rents and which has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

Edith has a business running a retail shop. She has been in this business for over ten years and she works seven days a week. She sells her products retail in a shop and her main business challenge is seasonality.

Edith has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.

Edith’s goals and aspirations for her business are to make profits to improve on her standard of living, and to own a wholesale shop. She would also like to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Eberth Americo

texts.es: El señor Ebert Américo M. R. se dedica a la actividad de chofer de mototaxi , vive con su esposa y sus menores hijos en su domicilio ubicado en Santa Rosa de Lima Ica , su esposa se dedica ala venta de juguetes y adornos para niños tiene un puesto en el mercado Toledo de esta manera ayuda a solventar los gastos familiares conjuntamente con su esposo . El solicitante requiere el crédito para mantenimiento de su mototaxi y mejorar su calidad de vida, presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales por tal mótivo se propone otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en: Ebert Américo M. R. is a moto taxi driver. He lives with his wife and their young children at their home Santa Rosa de Lima Ica. His wife sells toys and decorations for children and has a stall in the Toledo market, which enables her to cover household expenses alongside her husband. The applicant would like a loan for the maintenance of his moto taxi and to improve his quality of life. He has good personal and professional references; for this reason, he is recommended as a loan recipient.

loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old. Concepcion is married and has four children. Her eldest is 15 years old. To make a living, Concepcion owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Concepcion has been engaged in farming for over 20 years. She now grows pigs when she is free of farming duties. She plans to acquire more piglets to raise.

Concepcion joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs, piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase thread to make clothing

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros. En este lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura en gran parte.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa, ella tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de 19 y 9 años, el mayor en el colegio y el pequeño en la escuela, el esposo trabaja como pre vendedor en la Coca Cola.

Ella es una gran ama de casa y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia hace 4 años decidió poner un negocio de comida en sus casa en el que trabaja los fines de semana desde las 8am hasta las 19h00, ahora ha decidido también preparar comida de lunes a viernes  en una clínica que  va hacer inaugurada en Portoviejo, allí va a vender comida tanto para los médicos como para los pacientes que lleguen a ese lugar.

Es para eso que solicito este crédito, espera comprar algunas cosas que aún le faltan como: platos, cucharas, ollas, y otros artículos necesarios. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la forma de trabajar de la institución.
texts.en:
The Colon Communal Bank meets once every two weeks in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is the capital of Manabita, which is known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by so many hills.  The people there mostly work in agriculture.

That is where we meet Rosa.  She is 39 years old and married.  She has two children, ages 19 and 9.  The oldest is in high school, and the little one goes to elementary school.  Her husband works as a pre-seller for Coca Cola.

She is a great housewife.  In order to help her husband with the family expenses she decided four years ago to establish a food business in her house.  She works there on weekends from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has now decided to also prepare food on Monday through Friday in a clinic, which will be opened in Portoviejo.  She will sell food there for the doctors as well as the patients who come to the clinic.

That is why she has requested a loan to buy some things that she still needs.  She will buy things like plates, spoons, pots, and other needed things.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank.  She likes the way the institution works.

loans.use: To buy plates, spoons, pots, and glasses

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda T. is a married woman who lives in Purok Kenon, Brgy. 7, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 businesses: food production/sales, a general store and an entertainment business. Her husband, Larry T., is 49 years old and works as a laborer to earn his living. He also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children aged between 19 and 24 years old. Gilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for the general store and spices for her food production business. She wants to continue to save up for her children's future education and for home appliances. Gilda T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund operations of her businesses

loans.name: Muhtar

texts.en:
Muhtar M. is 45 years old, married and has two children. Muhtar was born to a low-income farmworker’s family and, from early childhood, had engaged in farming. After graduating from college as a drilling foreman, he had to return to his native village in order to take care of his mother, who stayed alone after his father’s death. In his area of the country, cattle breeding is the main activity, that’s why Muhtar decided to engage in livestock breeding also.

 He started this business with 9,000 KGS and managed to broaden his business with milk cows, whose milk he and his wife, Shailoogul, sell to the local diary factory. In 2009, Muhtar obtained his first loan for purchasing cattle and repaid it without any delays. Now, Muhtar plans to use this loan of 135,000 KGS to buy cows, which will increase their milk sales. With the revenues, Muhtar wants to pay for a good education for his children. 
Muhtar is very positive and hard-working person, who believes that his efforts will lead his family to prosperous future.   

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ARCO IRIS” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Cascada. Cuenta con nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Justina, por la tesorera, la señora Soledad y como secretaria de actas Ericka.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de verduras y macramé, tejido de mantas, ropa de bebé, carnicería y tienda, tienda surtida, venta de coca, tejido de mantas, macramé y ferretería, ladrillos, cemento y estuco.

La señora Justina presidenta de la asociación “Arco Iris”, actualmente tiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y sus cuatro hijos.
La señora Justina comenta que tiene dos negocios, el primero es la venta de verduras los días jueves y domingo en la zona de Villa Mercedes, en su puesto ella vende diferentes tipos de verduras, en esta época de fin de año, en la que se celebran las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo ella indica que hay mayor venta de choclo (maíz), camote y yuca.  El otro negocio es la venta de artefactos como radios, televisores, bicicletas, de manera ambulante, la estrategia es tomar un solo producto e ir a las zonas comerciales de la ciudad de El Alto (la Ceja de El Alto) y exponer el producto hasta lograr venderlo.
Con el crédito de este ciclo la señora Justina indica que comprará verduras para su puesto y radios, televisiones, bicicletas.
texts.en:
The "Arco Iris" ("Rainbow") communal bank is starting out on its first borrowing cycle, and meets in the Cascada community centre. There are 9 members. The bank's committee is made up of the president, Señora Justina, the treasurer, Señora Soledad, and Ericka as secretary. The women's businesses relate to commerce, production, or service industries, and include: selling vegetables and handicrafts, weaving blankets, selling baby clothes, a butcher's shop and grocery, a grocery store, selling coca leaves, making and selling handicrafts, and selling hardware, bricks and cement.

Señora Justina, the president of the "Arco Iris" communal bank, has built a home with her partner and their 4 children. She states that she has two businesses: the first is selling vegetables, on Thursdays and Sundays, in the Villa Mercedes area. At her stall she sells different types of vegetables, and at this time of year, when people are celebrating Christmas and New Year, she reports increased sales of corn, squashes and yucca. The other business is selling goods such as radios, televisions, and bicycles. The way she sells these is to take one single item and go to the commercial districts of the city of La Ceja de El Alto, and expound the item until she succeeds in selling it.

With this loan Señora Justina says she will buy vegetables for her stall, as well as radios, televisions, and bicycles.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, radios, televisions, bicycles

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 53 years old. Carmelita is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 22nd loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sari Usaha Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut P. is a 28-year-old woman with one child in junior high school. She is the leader of Sari Usaha. The 10 members each received a loan of 1,300,000 IDR. Ni Ketut P. used her loan for a pig farm business in Melaya. From this business, Ni Ketut P. was able to improve her family's economy with a profit of about 220,000 IDR per month. The profit she collected was used to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
