Pictured here is Binta B.. The 34-year-old was born in Kabala. She has two children who are attending primary school and her husband is a businessman.  

For 5 years now, Binta has been selling house building materials such as nails, door locks, and paint brushes. Binta is seeking a loan of SLL 5,000,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand her business. With this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her existing stock.

loans.use: To buy home building materials such nails, locks, and paint brushes to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. Despite his young age, he has been running his own farming business since 2007. He cultivates all type of vegetables and fruits according to the season. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. This allows him to better monitor product quality during the year. He helps his father cover the household expenses. He has obtained three Kiva loans and he was very satisfied with the results. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. He estimates that with the coming harvesting, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: Ghwar

texts.en:
Ghwar is a 47-year-old married man living in Chtoura with his wife and five children. 

Ghwar has worked in agriculture since 2005. He plants fruits and vegetables depending on what's suitable for the season. He works hard to raise his plants in a clean and healthy atmosphere. He tests the soil from time to time to see its quality. 

Ghwar is well known in the market. Most of his clients are wholesale businessmen, in addition to a few friends, neighbors and relatives. Most of the dealers wait for his products.

Ghwar is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy necessary seeds to plant. This is his first loan, and he hopes to have positive results. He hopes to expand his business and buy his own land.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Boriz

texts.es: La señor Boriz es padre de dos hijos por los cuales lucha en la vida por darles una buena educación, la actividad que tiene es la venta de dulces en una unidad educativa por la cual la rotación es diaria y opta con un crecimiento  gracias al crédito otorgado por la institución, el inicio de su negocio fue hace mucho tiempo atrás de manera muy simple y humilde obteniendo buenos resultados por el crecimiento del alumnado siendo esto así el esfuerzo de una persona con deseos de crecer en la vida realiza su trabajo todos los días a partir de las 07:00 pm hasta las 18:30 pm, para así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y familia, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como dulces y chocolates, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Boriz is a father of two children, for whom he struggles to geta good education. His activity is selling candies at a school. The turnover is daily and he has had growth thanks to a loan given to him by the institution. He started the business a long time ago. It was simple and humble and he obtained good results as the student body grew. It has been due to the hard work of a person who wants to grow in life. He works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 6:30 p.m. in order to give his children and family a better quality of life. With the money from the loan, he will buy merchandise such as candies and chocolate. He is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and candies.

loans.name: Luis Raul

texts.es: Luis tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un menor hijo. Vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es urbana y está en vías de crecimiento. Gana la vida brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros. Cuenta con un auto el cual utiliza todos los días. Su punto de negocio está en los exteriores del Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande, muy conocido y con bastante movimiento. Desea utilizar su préstamo para hacer unos arreglos a su taxi por ejemplo cambiar su sistema de combustible. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio y sus ganancias para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Su visión es un día tener una flota de taxis que sea su propia y que alquile a otros conductores. Luis goza de muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Es muy trabajador y entregado a su familia. Siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Luis is 38 years old, single, and has a young son.  He lives in his parents’ home in Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region in northern Peru.  His community is a growing urban community.

Luis earns his living by offering transportation services.  He has a car that he uses daily and his point of business is in the Moshoqueque market, a large, very well known marketplace with lots of movement.

He wants to use the money from this loan to make some repairs to his taxi, such as replacing the fuel system, so he has seen fit to request a loan of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  His main goal is to continue to grow his business to be able to provide a better life for his son.  He hopes to have a fleet of taxis and drivers some day.  Luis comes with very good personal and professional references.  He is a hard worker, dedicated to his family, and works for their well being and development.

loans.use: to make repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Then

texts.en:
Mrs. Then was born in 1972 and is married to Mr. Lor, who also was born 1972. They have two children who are attending the local school. 

She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow rice. Aside from farming, they also cultivate mushrooms for their family living. 

Currently, they want to cultivate rice in the dry season, buy they do not have enough money to grow it. Thus, Mrs. Then would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing rice. 

Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing rice.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo J. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 57 years old. Ricardo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ricardo raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for over 21 years and earns approximately 13000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ricardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Ricardo is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Ricardo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, age 48, earns a living from buying and selling motorcycle and bicycle products, such as tires and bolts, in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. Editha is widowed and has four grown children. She lives in the village of Poblacion, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental.

In 2010, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. 

Editha is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of the hardware products she needs for her business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Editha from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of the hardware products she needs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 54 years old and married with four children. 

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Amelita is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

Amelita has been farming sugarcane for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 35 años de edad. Actualmente, Yanet vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Yanet se dedica a la venta de comida desde las 7 de la manaña hasta las 2 de la tarde todos los días. Ya es un año y medio se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, leche y otras cosas. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Yanet was born in the city of Quillabamba, in Cusco department (Peru).  She is 35 years old and currently lives in the city of Cusco together with her two children.  Yanet sells food from 7.00am to 2.00pm, every day.  She has been in this business for one and a half years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Yanet needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, noodles, milk, etc.

Yanet is a responsible and hard-working person and, owing to these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's "Mosoc Killa" community bank.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 43 años,  vive en el caserío de Punray, ahí formó su familia junto a su esposa con quien convive desde hace 22 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos a los que cuidan con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia. La zona donde habita, es un paraje alejado, que aparte de poseer un buen paisaje tiene tierras muy fértiles. Desde muy joven comenzó su camino por la agricultura, aprovechando las cualidades de la tierra. Ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en los sembríos de habas, arveja, papa y maíz, los cuales cuida constantemente, ya que necesita de los nutrientes necesarios para poder adquirir productos de calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver crecer sus productos, sin embargo teme que tanto sacrifico no reciba buenas ganancias al momento de su comercialización, debido a la variaciones del precio de este producto en el mercado. Por tanto, acaba de iniciar con la crianza de animales menores como chanchos y gallinas, que son vendidos a buen precio después de engordarlos; así se genera ganancias extras mientras espera la temporada de cosecha y comercialización de sus productos alimenticios. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde esta contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Además se compromete en ser puntual con las cuotas. Félix sembrará dentro de poco papa de las variedades “canchan y yungay” por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su sembrío, por lo que augura una producción de 200 sacos.
texts.en: Félix is 43 years old and lives in the hamlet of Punray. There he started his family, together with his wife whom he has lived with for 22 years. They have 7 children, whom they look after with great love and tenderness, in their own house. The area they live in is a remote spot, which not only has beautiful countryside but also very fertile soil. When he was very young, Félix began to find his way into agriculture, making the most of the quality of the soil. He now has 5 years' experience sowing beans, peas, potatoes and maize, which he takes care of constantly. He now needs the nutrients necessary to ensure a good quality crop. What Félix likes most about his work is being able to see his produce grow; nonetheless he worries that all the effort may not turn into good profits when the time comes to sell, thanks to fluctuations in the price of products at the market. Because of this, he has just begun raising small animals, such as pigs and hens, which sell for a good price once they are fattened up. In this way he can generate aditional earnings while awaiting the next harvest season and the sale of his produce. He belongs to the “Nueva Jerusalén” communal bank, and this is his 7th loan with [field partner] MFP, where he is happy to know that he can access the financial support he needs. He vows to be punctual in meeting his repayments. On receiving the support, Félix intends to plant potatoes, of the varieties "canchan" and "yungay". He will invest the money in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers to begin a successful planting: following this he predicts he should be able to produce some 200 sacks of potaoes.

loans.use: To buy sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.ru: Валичон житель города Худжанд. Ему 23 года. Он женат. Детей не имеет. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Валичон предоставляет услугу, он развозит людей по маршруту Худжанд - Нов и обратно. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомобиля Газель, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Valijon is a resident of Khujand. He is 23 years old, married, and does not have children.  His wife is a homemaker. Valijon  provides a taxi service.  He drives people on a route from Khujand to Nov and and vice versa. He has been doing this work for two years. He is taking out a loan to repair his vehicle (he has a Russian-made Gazelle) in order to provide a safe service.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bungohko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Emmanuel has a small retail shop that sells hardware, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase hardware materials for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Emmanuel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Emmanuel hopes to expand his business.  Emmanuel is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase hardware to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 43 years old. She is married and has eight children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items, such as shampoo and groceries, to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lilibeth has borrowed and paid sixteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns income from food vending.

Lilibeth aspires to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sodbileg

texts.en:
Sodbileg is a 29-year-old widow who lives with her mother, son, and daughter.  They live in the outer ger district (a district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her mother is retired while both of her children attend the local public school. 

Sodbileg specialized in hospitality management at a local institute in 2005.  Since then, she has worked in restaurants for three years.  Currently, she rents a small restaurant which is located in a local district of the city and has been renting the restaurant since July of 2009. The restaurant received a special serving license when she started renting it, but now her special license has expired.  Sodbileg needs 900,000 MNT to renew the license, but she only has 300,000 MNT.  

So, she is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to renew her special serving license. She is a hard-working, young mother who wishes to do all the best things for her children.

loans.use: to renew her special serving license.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos dos quais um menor e o outro frequenta a escola. Fez 9ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 
Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, trabalha como cozinheira na Univercidade Pedagogica ha mais de 2 anos e tem um salario de 4.500.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE UMA CASA (barrotes, chapas, pedra, cimento, areia, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 7.000.00mt, para a sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Arsenia was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of two children, one of whom goes to school and the other of whom is still below school age. She completed school herself through the 9th grade, but wasn't able to continue out of financial constraints. She lives in her own home with her family, who she supports.

She has never left her hometown and has worked as a cook at the Teaching University for two years and earns a monthly salary of 4,500 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] that goes to her household expenses and also some savings in her personal bank account.  

She has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which she plans to buy construction materials (bricks, boards, cement, etc.) so she can continue building her home. Her first loan was in the amount of 7,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] and 10,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] for this work. 

She plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to finish her home and provide a more comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, boards, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Abdukholik

texts.ru: Абдухолик проживает в районе Гиссар. Он женат. Ему 40 лет. У него четверо детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Он работает в пекарне. В основном он печет лепешки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки дров, муки и угля.
texts.en: Abdukholik lives in the Gissar district.  He is 40 years old, married and has four children.  He has a secondary education and works at a bakery.  Abdukholik primarily bakes flatbread.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of firewood, flour and coal.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, flour and coal

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora florentina cuenta con 44 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Aurelio, tienen 2 hijas, rubí y Johana, quienes estudian primer año de secundaria y sexto año de primaria, se dedica a la matanza de marrano y venta de carne, desde hacen 3 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijas adelante, y así ofrecerles una muy buena calidad de vida y tener una mejor solvencia económica, para apoyarlos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de más marranos.
La meta que tiene doña flor (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad), es la de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que lo que en verdad quiere es poner una carnicería, para tener más variedad y así mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le ayudara para apoyar a sus hijas con sus estudios profesionales.
“Le doy las gracias a FRAC y los donadores de kiva, por confiar en mí y brindarme todo su apoyo” MUCHAS GRACIAS.
texts.en:
Sra. Florentina is 44 years old and married to Sr. Aurelio. They have two daughters, Rubí and Johana, who are in the first year of high school and in sixth grade respectively. Florentina has been butchering pigs and selling the meat for three years.

She says that she decided to start this business as a way of helping her daughters to get ahead, offering them a better quality of life and better financial stability, and supporting them with their studies. The loan she received will be invested in the purchase of more pigs. The goal of Doña Flor (as she is known in her community) is to grow her business more. What she wants most is to open a butcher shop so that she can offer more variety and improve her income. This would allow her to support her daughters with their professional studies.

Florentina says, “I express my deepest thanks to FRAC and the Kiva lenders for trusting me and providing me all of their support.”

loans.use: to buy more pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31 year-old single mother with one child.  She supplies cakes and mandazi to the residents of Kitengela market, where her clients are both male and females. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES.6,000 per month.

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET customer. She is applying for her first loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy flour, baking powder and cooking oil to make more cakes and mandazi.  She will use the extra profit to open another outlet at Isinya or Mlolongo.

Mary hopes to become the best cake seller at Kitengela market.  She is very focused and visionary.

loans.use: To buy flour, baking powder, cooking oil.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, solamente él trabaja y su oficio principal es la ganadería, también herrería y hace viajes, su iniciativa lo llevo a trabajar en lo propio, no tiene ayudantes y tampoco tiene un horario definido.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar dos vacas, este dinero del préstamo le ayudara para crecer, teniendo mayores beneficios con la producción de leche.
La aspiración de Luis es ofrecer los lácteos a más clientes, aumentando el número de ganado y la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife and three children.  He is the only one that works and his main occupation is raising cattle.  He also does metal work and does hauling.  His initiative led him to work for himself; he has no helpers nor does he have a fixed work schedule.

For the moment, he’s asking for a loan to buy two cows.  The money from the loan will help him grow earning better benefits from the milk production.  Luis’ goal is to sell dairy products to more customers increasing his herd size and improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch is 47 and is married with three children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorian sites. Toch is a farmer and her husband works in road construction. The couple works so hard every day to earn income to help cover the family’s expenses. 

Toch is requesting a 1,200 USD loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to increase its income. This will be her first loan through KREDIT, a longstanding KIVA partner. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 30 year old a married woman with five children between the ages of 16 and four years. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling beer in Kator, South Sudan for five years. Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with five children.

Mary Jane has a shop that sells food seasonings, snacks, and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mary Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sopheavy

texts.en: Sopheavy, 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is a teacher. Her husband is a garment worker and a rice farmer. Her daughter is also employed as a garment worker. Sopheavy is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to grow rice during the dry season. In the future, she would like to purchase land to grow more rice and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to grow rice during the dry season

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela, es natural de San Vicente de Cañete, popularmente conocido como Cañete, esta ciudad está ubicada alrededor de una hora y media al sur de Lima, Cañete, con sus playas de arena, ruinas pre-incas, y la producción del adorado nacional licor de Perú, el Pisco (una especie de aguardiente de uva), ha sido durante mucho tiempo un destino turístico para los peruanos adinerados. Pero la verdadera Cañete es una ciudad cálida y tranquila con una gran población afro-peruana, los restos de un camino indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto con otros cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañado durante el 2001 y 2007 terremotos Perú, pero ha soportado como lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia. Estela es una mujer que tiene un preciosa hija de apenas 1 año de edad y vive junto a su pareja en casa de su madre.

Ella trabaja en el campo desde hace un año y gracias a esos ingresos y a los que le brinda su pareja pueden pagar los gastos que necesitan asumir como familia. Estela siempre trata de salir adelante y así es como con mucho esfuerzo, debido a que el trabajo en el campo es duro y agotador, ha podido ahorrar un total de S/.3, 000, este dinero se junto con la finalidad de comprar una moto taxi para trabajarla y mejorar sus ingresos. Ella necesita la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva para pagar la moto al contado y así podrá percibir los ingresos necesarios para brindarse una mejor calidad de vida junto a su pequeña familia. 

Esta idea de negocio le permitirá convertirse en independiente al largo plazo y así con mucho más esfuerzo, dedicación y motivación de su familia, Estela podrá cumplir su sueño de “Comprarse varias motos para trabajarlas y también comprarse un propio terreno”.
texts.en:
Estela is a native of San Vicente de Cañete, popularly known as Cañete.  This city is located about an hour and a half to the south of Lima. Cañete, with its sand beaches, pre-Incan ruins, and production of Pisco, the adored national liquor of Peru (a kind of grape brandy), has been for a long time a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians.  But the real Cañete is a warm and tranquil city with a big Afro-Peruvian population.  The remains of an indigenous trail are located here and the influence of the Spanish empire is evident. The city, located along the Pacific Coast, was damaged in the 2001 and 2007 Peruvian earthquakes, but it has endured this as it has done over the greater part of its history.  

Estela is a woman who has a precious daughter who is barely a year old, and she lives with her partner in her mother's house.  She has been farming for a year, and thanks to this income and the income provided by her partner, they have been able to pay their family's bills.  Estela always tries to get ahead, and so with a lot of effort, as farming is hard and exhausting work, she has been able to save a total of 3,000 Peruvian soles.  She has been saving up this money with the goal of buying a moto-taxi (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) that she could use to provide transportation services and so increase her income.  She is requesting the assistance of the Kiva lenders so that she can pay for this moto-taxi with cash.  With the moto-taxi, she will be able to earn the income needed to provide a better quality of life for her small family.

The idea of this business is that it will allow her to become independent over the long run.  So with much more effort, dedication and the motivation of helping her family, Estela will be able to achieve her dream of "buying a number of moto's to work, and also buying some land."

loans.use: to buy a moto-taxi

loans.name: Daniella

texts.en: Daniella is a 33-year-old married woman. She describes herself as very determined. She operates a a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are households. She describes her biggest business challenge as being inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more maize, beans and rice. Daniella's business goal is to run a large scale supermarket within five years.

loans.use: To buy more maize, beans and rice.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is forty-seven years of age and is married with three children.

Sesilia owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Sesilia needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 350 or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Sesilia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sesilia's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Ireng Group

texts.fr: La Cliente M'buhendwa est une Couturière  depuis 13 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Ireng» âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 étudient et 2 autres sont gosses. Elle fait ses travaux au marché central de la ville. Son conjoint est un commerçant. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir  pour acheter des nouveaux matériels : une machine à coudre, Tissus, fil, aiguilles,ciseaux etc. Elle démarra avec de  fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire un atelier de grande envergure, scolariser et  nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
The client, M'buhendwa, has been a seamstress for 13 years and is a member of the "Ireng" business group. She is 37 years old, married, and has five children - three of whom go to school and two of whom are too young. 

She works in the central market of her city. Her spouse is a merchant. She is asking for a loan from Hekima in order to grow her business. This new loan will help her buy new equipment: a sewing machine, fabric, thread, needles, scissors, etc. She started with funds from her husband. 

In the future, she would like to build a larger-scale studio, and to educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for supporting female entrepreneurs and granting them loans without collateral.

loans.use: buy new equipment: sewing machine, fabric, thread, needles, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is 25 years old, has 4 children and lives in Komomange H village in Kuria East sub-county, Kenya. Komomange H village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a local spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Christine and her community may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Christine works as a subsistence farmer but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Christine and two other promoters in her community, including Ann and Anna, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Christine will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Christine wants to be a promoter because she believes that the chlorine kills germs in water making it safe to drink.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Christine’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Jlg-016(A)-Thanneerpalli Group

texts.en:
Selvarani is a 27-year-old married woman hailing from Karur district of Tamil Nadu in the southern part of India. She lives with her small child and her husband.

She does not have a toilet at home. Thus, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, the family members are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in her family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Selvarani has formed a group with two of her friends who are also facing similar problems. So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives, they now seek a loan of INR 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these three hardworking, rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet.

loans.name: Eden Eli

texts.en:
Everyone knows my business as \\\"La Troca Intima\\\". I have been selling intimate apparell for men and women for five years. I have been able to establish a good clientelle that purchase my clothes that they later resell in their stores. With the profits of my business i have been able to build my house and support my family. I am in need of making some repairs to my home so I need to be able to increase my sales to cover the costs.

Loan Use: Purchase underwear for men and women

Todos conocen mi negocio por su nombre particular LA TROCA INTIMA, me dedico a vender ropa intima de dama y caballeros, tengo cinco años de vender en el mercado de esta ciudad. He logrado obtener mi propia clientela quienes me compran buenas cantidades de ropa para vender en sus aldeas. Con los ingresos que he obtenido de las ventas logre construir mi casita y cubrir los gastos de mi familia. Ahora necesito hacerle algunas mejoras a mi casa, por lo que necesito comprar mas mercaderia para satisfacer a mis clientes brindandoles ropa interior variada y de esta manera tener mejores ingresos para reparar mi casa.

loans.use: Compra de ropa interior para dama y caballero.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Auntie B, as she is called in her community, sells a variety of goods from a table-top. Her sales are expanding and she wishes to open a mini-supermarket where she can sell her goods but she has no money to realise this. As hardworking as she is, she is seeking a loan of $1000 from Kiva to help her realise this dream.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria A. lives in Benin City, Edo State,  Nigeria. She is 48 years old and is married with five (5) children. She started her business in the year 2002. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her food sales business

loans.name: Yay

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Yay got married in 1978 and has 7 children: 3 sons and 4 daughters. She started a business buying and reselling fresh fish in 1997. Her husband is a rice farmer and all of her children study at the local school.

Mrs C. has taken out 2 loans from MAXIMA in the past. She is now seeking a loan of $300. She will use this loan to buy fresh fish to resell in the local market. She is capable of handling the loan and can repay it without any problem.

loans.use: Buying fresh fish to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 30-year-old mother of 3 and a runs a small pharmacy in the Tandika area. She is a trained nurse and has been running her pharmacy for the past three years. She is in need of $550 to help her expand and stock more drugs in her pharmacy.

loans.use: Expand

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
"I would like to build a wall around my house to provide more safety and protection for my family, but I have not been able to do that because of lack of funds. Nevertheless, I hope that little by little I will be able to make improvements to my home as it is the inheritance for my children. I request a loan of $500 to construct a wall around my house."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

“Me gustaría poder construir una barda alrededor de mi casa, para tener más seguridad y protección para mi familia, por falta de dinero no he podido hacerla pero confío en que poco a poco podré irle haciendo mejoras a mi vivienda ya que es el patrimonio de mis hijos”.Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner una barda alrededor de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construct a wall around a house for protection.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. M. is a single mother and lives in her in own house in La Libertad. She started the business to provide her son every opportunity. Her inventory has been growing as she’s been able to become less dependent on her suppliers and been able to buy her products at lower prices which have increased her profits. The loan will be used to increase the variety of perfumes and clothes as she has a small amount of these products but not enough to satisfy the demand for new products. In the case of the clothes she would like to invest a good sum of money in order to be able to go to the border and purchase a large amount of styles.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. M., es madre soltera vive actualmente en casa propia en La libertad, lo que la decidió a emprender el negocio fue la necesidad de poder sacar adelante a su hijo, en la actualidad su inventario a ido creciendo a podido ir independizándose de los proveedores que la visitan y a si poder comprar con precios mas baratos sus productos lo cual le deja mejor nivel de ganancia, el financiamiento lo necesita para ampliar el surtido de perfumería y ropa ya que tiene hasta la fecha algunos productos pero no es lo suficiente y quiere ofrecer variedad de productos nuevos, además en el caso de la ropa quiere invertir una buena cantidad de dinero para poder ir a la frontera y hacer una compra mas grande.

loans.use: To buy basic necessities to sell in her store.  To increase perfume sales and buy clothes.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina P. is a hard working woman who has sold a variety of fruits in the market of Santa Ana in Chinandega for the past 26 years. She is a very happy and humble woman. She began her business with her own savings of $500.00, which she collected over a long period of time.

Today, she is a widow and has no children and so she is looking for a way to commercialize her sales in order to be able to support herself and her humble home. Mrs. Josefina has been supported by CEPRODEL for 4 years, obtaining loans which she invested directly in her business by purchasing fruits, through which was able to make a living and pay her bills. She has currently had 24 previous loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Josefina P. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace 26 años se dedica a la venta de frutas de todo tipo en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega. Se caracteriza por ser una dama muy alegre y humilde. Su negocio lo comenzó con un capital propio de C$ 500 obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros propios de largo tiempo.

Actualmente es viuda y sin hijos y por tal motivo debe de buscar la manera de cómo comercializar sus frutas para así poder mantener su humilde hogar que esta compuesto solamente por ella. Desde hace cuatro años, la señora Josefina se ha apoyado de Ceprodel, obteniendo préstamos que los ha invertido directamente en su negocio para la compra de las frutas y sustento con los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente tiene un record de 24 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To purchase fruits.

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
Bahodir A. is 25 years old. He is married with one child and lives together with his parents and younger brother.

Bahodir is a cattleman. He has been raising cattle for the last four years. Currently his household owns cattle to the value of 8000.00 Somoni which is about US$2,000. The business is the main source of income allowing Bahodir to support his large family.

Bahodir is planning to purchase more cattle and fodder. He requests 2000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for the term of seven months. This is the first loan for Bahodir and he promises to pay the loan in a timely manner and thanks all for supporting him

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Mrs. Huy N., age 50, has seven children, and she and her husband raise pigs on a piece of land at their house. They earn about $5 a day. Two of their children are garment workers who each earn $80 per month. Three children are students, and two others are married and live separately.

Mrs. N. is requesting her second loan from Credit MFI. She plans to use the loan to increase her business breeding pigs by purchasing more pigs. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy food for the pigs.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to expand the herd

loans.name: Anisa's Tunda Group

texts.en:
Anisa is married and has one child, age 7. She owns a general store, which she opened in 2000. Every day, Anisa works from 7 am to 5 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more items for her sales business. Anisa will share this loan with her sub-group member Editha, who owns a fish sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for sale

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Miss Karen, 27 years of age, managed to set up a food and beverage business in her parents’ house, where she lives. Her parents have always thought of her well-being and supported her in all the decisions that she has had to make. As a single mother, she has many responsibilities and great aspirations as well. One of those goals is to expand her business and sell fruit, like her parents do. However, he small budget has not been favorable lately, so she is requesting that we support her with a loan that will be invested in the fruit market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Karen a sus 27 años ha logrado establecer un negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas en la casa de sus padres, con quienes vive y quienes le han apoyado en todas las decisiones que ha tomado pensando en su bienestar.Ella siendo madre soltera tiene grandes responsabilidades y grandes aspiraciones también, siendo una de ellas ampliar su negocio y dedicarse también a la compra y venta de frutas como sus padres.Pero su bajo presupuesto no le ha sido favorable en estos últimos tiempos y solicita le apoyemos con un préstamo que será únicamente invertido en iniciar su proyecto de venta de frutas.

loans.use: Set up fruit market

loans.name: Bank Of Hope Africa Romano 5 Group

texts.en:
Amparo lives with her husband and three teenage children in the province of El Seibo. She owns and runs a small mini-market commonly called a “colmado.” Colmados are just like grocery stores but everything is sold in small portions so that the poor only have to buy what they need. This will be Amparo’s first loan with Esperanza. With the loan money, Amparo plans to buy more products for her colmado so that she can offer more to her community.

Amparo has great plans for the future, although she is content with her life. More than anything, she wants to grow closer to God. But she also wants to be able to proviD. better for her three children so that they will always have good food and be healthy. She already owns her own little house, which she is very thankful for. One day in the far-off future, she would love to be able to buy a truck, a great luxury here where most everyone has horses or motorcycles. But she blushes to mention this because she feels so blessed already and so thankful to be able to keep progressing.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people. All 5 associates are new to Esperanza and live in the same community as Amparo. They will be joining a group five of the already established Bank of Hope called Africa Romano. They have known each other for over 10 years and are more than willing to vouch for one another to be able to receive the loan together. In a group loan, if one person is not able to pay, the other members of the group are responsible to make up the difference.

loans.use: To grow her mini-market in order to better provide for her 3 kids.

loans.name: Dina's Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Dina is 26-years-old, married and has two children, ages 18 and 12. She sells clothing and owns a farm, which she started in 2006. She works from 8AM to 8PM each day at her business, earning a monthly profit of approximately $80.

Dina has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with maize sales and clothing sales.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to increase inventory

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Pascual Páez tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos, vive en el barrio San  José de Carepegua es  propietario de una curtiduría, vive en casa propia siempre  se ha caracterizado tener muchas ganas de progresar  y salir adelante.

Es un señor muy trabajador y emprendedor, que cada vez más va progresando como comerciante, y en su  microempresa da  oportunidad de  trabajo a  muchas  personas  humildes de la  zona 

Con  el  crédito comprará  cueros.
texts.en:
Pascual P. is 35 years old and is single without children. He lives in the area of San Jose de Carepegua and is the owner of his own hide tannery. He has his own home and has always been characterized as having a lot of motivation and being able to get ahead. He is an intelligent and very smart man who continually is improving as a business woman. His micro business gives many humble people from the area opportunities to work. With this credit she will purchase hides.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hides

loans.name: Unity 2036-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Filta P..  She is currently in the business of selling tea and is requesting a loan to buy more sugar.  

Filta is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant.  She has 3 children ranging from age 9 to 21 and her children go to school.  Each week, Filta makes approximately 70 Sudanese pounds in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more sugar.  

Filta is joined in her small group by Mary Abddalla, Susan N., Julia A. and Wilma Wulujaali.  Mary Abddalla has a business selling bread at the market and wants to expand her business.  Susan N. is currently operating a business in selling goods like bedsheets, soap and shoes at the market and wants a loan to expand her business.  Julia A. operates a business selling fried eggs, meat, beans, fresh fish, etc. at the hotel and wants to expand the hotel.  Wilma Wulujaali is currently in the business of selling chacoal at home and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar

loans.name: Arely Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Arely es una señora trabajadora desde muy joven se ha dedicado a las ventas ambulantes de cosméticos y otros, tiene 40 años de edad, casada y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte, tiene tres hijos que ya son independiente, su esposo es comerciante y vende en un mercado que se llama oriental, se dedica a la venta  de llantas usadas y siempre ha apoyado a su esposa. La Sra. Arely ha logrado poner una pulpería, con ganancias de los productos de la venta de cosmético y con dinero que su esposo le ha dado, ya lleva cinco años en este negocio, pues aunque las ventas a veces son bajas no se deja de vender. Con la solicitud de dinero es para invertir en capital en la compra de mercadería varias para surtir la pulpería y atraer más clientela con su variedad de productos. Alargo plazo es tener mas inventario, captar mas clientes y poner una vitrina de venta de cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
Arely is a hard-working woman who, from a young age, has dedicated herself to selling cosmetics and other items door-to-door. She is 40 years old, married, and lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte in the capital city of Managua. She has three grown children who are now on their own. Her husband is a merchant who works in a market called the Oriental selling merchandise such as used tires, and he has always supported his wife. Arely has managed to install a general store using funds acquired through her cosmetics sales as well as money contributed by her husband. She now has spent five years in this business and, even though sales are sometimes slow, she never stops selling. With the request for this loan, she would like to invest in the purchase of additional varied merchandise to supply her store with, to be able to attract more customers by offering a wide variety of products. Long-term, she would like to have a greater inventory, capture more customers, and add a sales display window for her cosmetics and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Adakou Edith

texts.fr: Madame C. Adakou Edith est une femme divorcée et mère de deux enfants qu’elle élève seule. C’est une femme très dynamique malgré le fait qu’elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études. Elle s’est lancée dans le commerce en ouvrant une boutique d'alimentation générale. Mais avec son divorce, elle est la seule à faire face aux besoins de ses enfants. Cela a pesé sur son commerce qui ne se développe plus par manque de moyens. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour relancer et développer son commerce en faisant une nouvelle commande d’articles afin de réapprovisionner sa boutique, faire de bénéfice et faire face aux besoins de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Adakou Edith C. is a divorced woman and the mother of two children who she is raising by herself. This is a very energetic woman despite not having had the chance to attend school. She got started in commerce by opening a grocery store. But with her divorce, she is alone, coping with the needs of her children. This weighs upon her business, which is no longer improving due to a lack of funds. She is requesting this loan to reinvigorate and develop her commerce by ordering new merchandise for restocking her store, to make a profit, and to address her children's needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with merchandise

loans.name: Hans

texts.es: Hans tiene 33 años, es soltero, pero tiene una hija y vive con  sus padres.El está dedicado a la venta de fertilizantes, negocio compartido con otras personas con quienes se asoció hace 3 años, dentro del negocio lo más resaltante es que estos fertilizantes son muy demandados por los agricultores y Hans atiende a estos clientes con mucho respeto, ya que son compradores claves y permanentes, lo que hace rentable su negocio. Sin embargo, a pesar del desagradable olor de los fertilizantes, lo importante es que Hans disfruta de su trabajo junto a sus compañeros. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha ha sido muy cumplido en sus pagos. Con la cantidad solicitada desea independizarse y abrir su propia tienda de fertilizantes, para ellos requiere de 2000 soles.
texts.en:
Hans is 33 years old and single, but he has a daughter and lives with his parents. He makes a living selling fertilizers, a business he shares with other people and have been working together for three years. The most outstanding thing is that these fertilizers are in high demand by farmers, and Hans tends to the clients very respectfully, since they are permanent and key components to the business and make it profitable. Of course, aside from the unpleasant odor of the fertilizers, the important thing is that Hans enjoys working with his associates. This is his fifth loan, and he has always been very punctual with his payments. With the loan he is requesting, he plans to become independent and open his own fertilizer store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open his own fertilizer store

loans.name: Merwais

texts.en:
Merwais is a shopkeeper. He has a retail shop where he works together with his father. Now he wants to open another shop where he can work alone and start a new business. He has a good number of customers in the area where his shop is located. He would love to grow his business more.

Merwais has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and buy more goods to sell retail like baskets, shampoo, and other necessary things for his shop. He is sure that he can further his business and repay the loan.

Merwais is very happy about this loan and he hopes that he will become stronger in his business to become one of the great business dealers in the future.

loans.use: To buy oil, flour and complete his stock

loans.name: Dina Mercedes

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Dina es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Dina junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de materiales de construcción como agregados, ladrillos, sus ventas lo realiza en su local y también llevan a domicilio para lo cual cuenta con una movilidad. 
Dina necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago para la compra de un carro pequeño.
Los sueños de Dina son comprar mas carros, ampliar su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Banco Comunal Llamkasum, which means “Let’s work together” in Quechua.

Dina lives with her husband, is 31 years old and has two children. Dina, together with her husband, sells construction materials such as aggregates and bricks. She sells out of her shop and also has a delivery service for which a vehicle is important.

Dina needs a loan of 2100 soles, which she will invest in part of the cost of a small cart.

Dina dreams to buy more carts, expand her house and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part of the cost of a small cart

loans.name: Adjakossi Kokou

texts.fr: Monsieur koganou réside dans le quartier d’agoè assiyéyé il tient une boutique de jeux vidéo qu’il a appelé « PLAYSTATION », dans son quartier il est le seul a faire cette activité dans son quartier et cela marche bien pour lui, il veut acheter une autre playstation 2, une télévision un ordinateur P3 des bancs, ventilateurs et transfo c’est pourquoi il demande à wages un crédit, il est marié et a deux enfants à sa charge.
texts.en:
Mr. Kognanu lives in the Agoè Assiyéyé area. He has a video game arcarde which he has named "Playstation." In his area, he is the only one in this business, and this works well for him. He would like to purchase another Playstation 2, a television, a P3 computer, benches, fans, and an electrical transformer. This is why he is seeking a loan (through Wages). He is married and has two children in his care.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy video games, computers, benches, and fans for his store

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.en:
Maria Ines Bordón lives in the Jhuguá Nanó neighborhood of Itá, Paraguay. At her home there, she runs a business that makes and sells tobacco cigarettes. When asked how long she had been doing this work, Ms. Bordón laughed, reflected, and finally decided it had been more than thirty years. She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase large quantities of tobacco from the vendor who grows it in a nearby barrio. The vendor only sells the tobacco in Itá two or three times per year and Ms. Bordoón said she needs to be prepared with enough capital to make a sufficient purchase. Once the tobacco is purchased, she makes new cigarettes each week and over the weekend brings them to the town of San Lorenzo to sell.

Ms. Bordón has worked hard at her business to support her five children. This is the second loan she has requested from Fundación Paraguaya and she said that she had no difficulty making payments on her first.

loans.use: To purchase tobacco in large quantities

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Eulalia tiene un puesto en el mercado D. Carmen Alto en donD. venD. papa, producto que compra D. los productores y también Eulalia se dedica a L. siembra D. papa en sus tierras D. Alpachaca.
Eulalia necesita un  préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. papa.
Eulalia sueña con tener carro propio para transportar sus productos y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Eulalia is a member of the Nobleza (Nobility) Communal Bank. Eulalia is 34 years old with one son and lives with her domestic partner. She has a stand in the Carmen Alto market where she sells potatoes which she buys from farmers and which she also grows herself in her fields near Alpachaca. She needs a loan of 2,000 Sols which she will invest in purchasing potatoes. Eulalia dreams of having her own car to transport her products and she wants her daughter to one day become a professional person.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes.

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.en:
S. Sharafniso is 48 years old. She and her husband have two children. To improve her family position and support her husband with family expenses, Sharafniso started her business six years ago. She bakes “lepeshka,” the national bread, at home. Her son helps her with the business.

Sharafniso sells the majority of her products from her place. However, her mother (pictured) is also running a trading place in the central local market for selling the lepeshka. Sharafniso is doing all the best to ensure her children with the best future. Now she requests $1,000 for the term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase flour on a wholesale basis. Sharafniso is grateful for all supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Moussa est un tailleur installé au quartier Grand Mbour dans la ville de Mbour située à 70 km de Dakar.Il gére un atelier de couture.Sa clientelle est essentiellement composée des habitants du quartier.Il n 'a jamais eu de crédit au niveau de la caisse.Il est agé de 27 ans il n 'est pas marié.Avec le crédit qu'il sollicite il veut acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre plus performante à fin de mieux répondre aux nombreuses sollicitations des clients devenus plus exigeantes face aux changements de la mode.
texts.en:
Moussa is a tailor working in the Grand Mbour district in the town of Mbour, situated 70 km from Dakar. He runs a sewing workshop. His clientele is essentially composed of residents of his neighborhood. He has never had a loan from this institution. He is 27 and not yet married. With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to buy a new higher-performance sewing machine so that he can better fill the numerous orders from his clientele which has become more exigent as styles continually change.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Una integrante del comite Nino Jesus es la Sra. Maria I..  Ella tiene 34 años y tiene dos hijos. Es una Sra muy sacrificada que se dedica en la venta de comidas. La compra de sus productos lo realiza en el mercado de abasto para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus hijos le ayuda en los trabajos de la casa y ella dice que con la ayuda que la Fundacion Paraguaya le dio está mejorando su situación económica y ayuda a su pareja con los gastos de la casa, tambien en los gastos escolares.    

Las otras integrantes de este grupo son: 

Sebastiana G..	 Reciclaje.
Martha S. de M. 	 Venta de merceria.
Basilia R.G..	Venta deropa.
Sonia R.V. G. 	Vendedora Ambulante.
Teofila A. R.	Venta de verduras.
Maria D. I..	Vta de comida.
Maximina G. R. 	Venta de ropas.
Eugenia M.. 	Venta de frutas.
 Olga M.. 	Venta de ropas.
 Elvira B.. 	Recicladora.
Marta A..	Venta de Bebidas.
Mirta C..	       Despensa.
Ines G..    	Termos Forrados.
Patricia B..   	Reciclaje.
Pamela V.. 	        Modista. 
Margareth V..  	Modista.
Lidia G..	 Venta de Bijouteri. 
Lucia T.. 	Venta de ropa.
Mercedes M..	Venta de Carbon.
 Nelly Z..	Venta de hamburguesa.
texts.en:
One member of the Niño Jesús Group is Mrs. Maria I.. She is 34 years old and has two children. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who works selling food. She buys the products she needs to prepare her foods in the supply market. Her children help her with the housework and she says that with the help that Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya has given her, her financial situation is improving and she helps her husband with the household expenses and school costs. The other members of the group are: Sebastiana G. - Recycling Martha S. de M. - Sale of sewing supplies Basilia R.G. - Clothing sales Sonia R.V. G. - Street vendor Teofila A. R. - Sale of vegetables Maria D. I. - Food sales Maximina G. R. - Clothing sales Eugenia M. - Sale of fruit Olga M. - Clothing sales Elvira B. - Recycling Marta A. - Beverage sales Mirta C. - Dispensary Ines G. - Insulated Thermoses Patricia B. - Recycling Pamela V. - Dressmaker Margareth V. - Dressmaker Lidia G. - Jewelry sales Lucia T. - Clothing sales Mercedes M. - Sale of charcoal Nelly Z. - Hamburger sales

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothing: pants, traditional skirts, t-shirts, blouses, shirts; Sale of detergent for home use; Dispensary sale of: noodles, rice, flour, oil, powdered soap

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Primavera”, vive en el Jr. Coronel Bardales S/Nº, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos varones, que son su principal motivo para salir adelante.

Es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora que a pesar de haber tenido bajas en su vida, logro salir a adelante y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendió su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras en la región. Fue generando más ingresos de sus ventas, así empezó a comprar más y mas productos para vender. 

En la actualidad tiene muy buena clientela y ya es muy conocida, por sus clientes, ella vende recorriendo las calles, en las afueras del mercado o donde encuentre mayor movimiento, cuenta con lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita para preparar sus comidas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 invertirá comprando verduras como: papas, frijoles y maní en sacos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando nuevas bandejas, para poner sus productos y dar más confianza a sus clientes.

Victoria, se siente aún con muchas fuerzas para seguir adelante y poder cumplir con sus metas y sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the La Primavera Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Coronel Bardales S/Nº, San Hilarión district, San Martín province, San Martín deparatment. She is 35 and married. She has two sons, and they are her primary motivation for getting ahead. She is a fighter and a hard worker, who, in spite of having had hard times in her life, was able to get head. With her husband’s help, she started her small business of selling vegetables in the region. Her sales were generating more income, so she started to buy more and more products to sell. She currently has a good client base. She is well known with her customers. She sells traveling the streets, outside the market, or wherever there are a lot of people. She carries everything a housewife needs to prepare her meals. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy sacks of vegetables such as potatoes, beans, and peanuts. She will use part of the money to buy new trays to display her vegetables and make her customers more confident about shopping with her. Victoria still feels great strength to keep going forward and to be able to accomplish her goals and dreams. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her establish her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more vegetables and new trays

loans.name: Bamidele

texts.en:
K. has been selling provisions and drinks for the past five years. She is 33 years old and married with three children. They live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. 
K. says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Herber Noe

texts.es:
Herber Noe C. Ruiz es un joven señor de 26 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de un  año de edad,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Desde hace 4 años Herber se dedica a la siembra de tiquisque, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Cosa Rica como en otros países.

Herber considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida, logrando ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad, la cual se ve frecuentemente azotada por las inclemencias del tiempo y el desempleo.

Actualmente Herber desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢300,000 (Trescientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del tiquisque. 

Herber es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Herber Noe C. is 26 years old, lives with his wife and small one year old son in a small rural community in Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala, located in Alajuela province. There they work in business having cattle (beef and dairy) and agriculture growing basic grains such as rice, beans, corn and more. 4 years ago Herber began growing “tiquisque” or corms of taro, a tuber with a pleasant flavor, rich in nutrients, widely grown and in high demand in Costa Rica as well as other countries. Herber believes that thanks to this project, he and his family have little by little improved their quality of life, becoming active in community development, which frequently is impacted by bad weather and unemployment. Today Herber wishes a loan for ¢300,000 colones, to help prepare his fields, buy seeds, fertilizers, manure among other items needed to guarantee an optimal crop of corms of taro. Herber is a member of the Datraban Communal Bank, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and economically in addition to actively participating in the microloan organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de sacs de maïs  à Lomé dans le quartier Amoutivé, cette dame ayant à sa charge 04 enfants sollicite de WAGES un prêt lui permettant d’agrandir son commerce avec l’achat de 20 sacs de maïs et aussi assurer le transport de sa marchandise. Ceci devra  lui permettre de subvenir encore plus aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
A retailer of sacks of corn, this lady has four children to support in Lomé in the Amoutivé district. She is requesting a loan from WAGES allowing her to expand her commerce through purchasing 20 sacks of corn and also to cover the transport of her merchandise. This should enable her to provide for her family even more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Alrey

texts.en:
Alrey, or “Cablay,” as he is known, lives in Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is a farmer. He graduated from a vocational course in auto diesel mechanics, but due to lack of job opportunities, he end up helping his parents on their farm, which allowed him to save for his future.  

Alrey plants rice and some vegetables on his parcel of land twice a year. His need for additional capital made him decide to borrow PHP 10,000.00 from Kiva lenders. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and pesticides to maintain crop production. 

With his patience and sacrifices, he can earn a net income of PHP 12,000 per harvest season, which he uses to meet the needs of his family and to pay his debts.  He hopes that he can produce more rice and vegetables to earn more income.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Mr. B. Jackson is a forty-two-year-old man who owns a retail shop at the central market. He has two kids and they are both in school.

Mr. B. Jackson has a retail shop selling mostly essential products. He is using the loan for expansion of his business: that is, purchasing sugar, flour, soap, rice, cooking oil, paraffin, and other items for sale.

Mr. B. Jackson is very happy and he hopes to work hard and even open up other shops to generate more income to cater for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda es una mujer activa y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 52 años, es madre de cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, ella  tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes en general y bebidas, también se dedica a la costura, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es cerrajero. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo que obtuvo  fue de 300 soles que invirtió en una vitrina para exhibir las golosinas.  En la actualidad ella necesita un préstamo de 2,500 que será invertido una parte en productos para  su tienda como arroz, leche, yogurt, fideos, azúcar, etc. y la otra parte  invertirá en gaseosas. La meta de Rayda es tener una tienda bien implementado de abarrotes.

loans.use: Invertirá una parte en productos para  su tienda como arroz, leche, yogurt, fideos, azúcar, etc. y la otra parte  invertirá en gaseosas.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón Pampuyo” ubicado en el centro poblado de Corazón Pampuyo del distrito Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos, vive en Ticaraya, ella estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado porcino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado vacuno para engorde, luego lo vende en la feria de Chaca Chaca, también se dedica a la chacra.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse su casita en Yunguyo.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros ya las charlas.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilaria is a member of the community bank “Corazón Pampuyo” located in the population center of Corazón Pampuyo in the district Pomato, providence of Chucito and the department of Puno. She is 33 years old. She’s married in a civil marriage. She has three children. She lives in Ticaraya. She completed her secondary education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She began her loan with the amount of $100 (300 PEN), which allowed her to increase her capital for her business of buying and selling pigs. Now, she requires a new loan of $550 (1500 PEN), which will allow her to buy cattle to fatten, later she will sell it in the market of Chaca Chaca. She also farms. Her biggest desire is to be able to buy herself a little house in Yunguyo. She likes savings and lectures.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana O. is from the village of Tipolo. She is 45 years old and is single. Feliciana owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Feliciana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Feliciana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena O. is from the village of Lawis Panalsalan. She is 61 years old, is married and has three adult children.

Lucena owns and operates a business building "nipa"-huts, houses built of palm trees, where many of the local community members live.
