She often works in the field with palm trees, weaving the leaves to form the roofs. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Lucena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

Lucena is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in tools to expand her hut-building business

loans.name: C3756 Abahujwenimana Group

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 29 years old and is married with three children with ages 1, 6 and 8. In addition, she takes care of one dependent from another family who is 16 years old. Marie Rose lives in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Marie Rose is the president of a group called Abahujwenimana. This is the group's second successful year in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. The hours of their business require that they work from early in the morning until late in the evening, depending upon customer traffic on any given day.

The members of this group, after having the idea of improving their business and increasing their sales, are requesting their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, these members plan to carefully source and then purchase a larger quantity of vegetables and fruits hopefully at lower prices. The group believes this will satisfy the needs of their customers and result in more profit for Abahujwenimana.

With this profit, they will reinvest in their business so that in the future, loans are not necessary; they can rely on equity and cash on hand. Also, they all plan and hope to continue taking care of their families and loved ones.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 51 años, está casado con Celia, de 48 años, quien tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa; con ella tiene 4 hijos mayores que viven en la ciudad y estudian en busca de un futuro mejor.
Él es agricultor, siembra papa, maíz y alverjas en sus propias tierras; cada día es de sacrificio, porque debe dedicar casi todas las horas del día en cuidar sus cultivos porque aunque no vive con sus hijos les manda dinero a la ciudad y debe trabajar para ayudarlos a salir adelante junto con su esposa. Ellos comercializan los productos que cosechan y obtienen buenas ganancias económicas que como él mismo dice: “me alcanza para poder vivir, porque aquí el que no trabaja no come”, y sabe que se gana más dinero durante la temporada de cosecha.
A Víctor le gusta ser agricultor porque es lo único que aprendió desde muy pequeño y supo poner en práctica lo aprendido para sacar adelante a su familia y lograr progresar. 
Para el futuro, tiene muchos planes, entre los que se encuentran empezar con la crianza de cuyes, ya que sabe que la carne de estos animales se vende a buen precio, además es muy requerida por su exquisitez; también quiere empezar a criar gallinas porque les puede sacar doble provecho por la carne y los huevos que podrá comercializar a diario.

Así es él, un hombre que piensa siempre en mejorar; sobretodo en los negocios, visiona qué provecho le puede sacar a cada cosa y así elabora estrategias para salir adelante en el campo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos cuyes para empezar con la crianza de estos animales y en el futuro llegar a comercializarlos en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Victor is 51 years old. He is married to Celia, who is 48. They have a small grocery store in their house. They have 4 grown-up children who live in the city and study so that they can have a better future. Victor is a farmer who grows potatoes, corn and peas on his land. Every day is a sacrifice; he has to spend almost all day on the farm because even though he doesn't live with his children, he and his wife send them money in the city to help them get by. They sell the products that they grow and their earnings are good. Victor says, "I make enough to survive, because here, if you don't work, you don't eat." He knows that more money can be made during harvest time.

Victor likes being a farmer because he learned how to farm at a young age and he knew how to put what he learned into practice to help his family get ahead and progress. He has many plans for the future, including raising guinea pigs because he knows that their meat sells at a good price. In addition, guinea pig meat is highly demanded as a delicacy. He also wants to start raising chickens because he can benefit doubly from selling their meat and their eggs.

Victor is a man who always wants to improve, especially in business. He sees opportunities everywhere and develops strategies to get ahead in the countryside. With the money that he is requesting, he will buy some guinea pigs to start raising. In the future he will raise them in greater quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying guinea pigs

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda B. is presently residing at Susayan, Dalaon, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur and is married with three children.

Florenda is a vegetable vendor at Molave public market. She has been engaged in her business for more than seven months and earns 6,000 a month. It is not the only means of generating revenue since her husband is a farmer and is also supporting the family.

Florenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loan of 4,000 PHP. This loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Florenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be use to invest in expanding her business. This will be the her 2nd loan from PMPC.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mẫn

texts.en:
N. Mẫn Bá is a 57-year-old male living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  He is married and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, N. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  N. has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately $163 a month from this activity.

In 2008, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  

N. is now requesting a new loan of 7.804.000 VND which also will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  The will be his 3rd loan from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of his family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Mẫn Bá (20201060041) là 57 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Anh ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, N. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để B.n.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.804.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông B.o bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông B.o các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en:
T. is a mechanic for a private automotive services company.  He lives with his mother (pictured), wife and two daughters.  Since purchasing the insulated ger (yurt) covering, he has noticed that his family is staying warmer longer and is saving at least 20% on his fuel costs.  He also appreciates that the product is helping him cut down on his own pollution.   

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital city in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To fund a six-layer highly insulated yurt covering

loans.name: Gasilda

texts.es:
La señora Gasilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor” desde hace 10 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes.

Gasilda nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para iniciar su negocio.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc., al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar mercadería a su tienda para obtener mejores ingresos. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Gasilda has been a member of the "Dios es Amor" Community Bank for 10 years and lives in the Juliaca District of the San Román Province in the Department of Puno. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two children. She completed high school and now works buying and selling groceries. Gasilda says that with the first loan she requested through the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 300 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital in order to start her business. She is requesting a loan of 800 nuevos soles with which she will be able to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc. at wholesale prices. Her dream for the future is to increase her store's merchandise stock in order to earn a better income. What Gasilda likes most about her Community Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Invest in a new restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Market gardening

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Mr. Edward K., a 34-year-old businessman, has been operating a carpentry workshop business for over six years. He will the loan to purchase more timber, vanishing paint, nails and other tools to increase both the productivity and the success of his business. His future hope is to own a furniture mart.

loans.use: To purchase more timber, vanishing paint, nails and other tools for his business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza del barrio San Carlos, se formo hace ya más de tres años. Cada ciclo culmina con mucho y ganas de continuar trabajando con el proyecto de comité de mujeres.

Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el décimo cuarto ciclo del programa y entre las integrantes se encuentra la señora Miguela R. quien se  dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Luque donde posee un puesto de venta. La forma de trabajo de la señora Miguela es muy sacrificada ya que se levanta muy temprano para llegar a su puesto de venta y comenzar a vender sus productos.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras (naranjas, papas, tomate, cebollas, manzanas y otros).
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza” (Enterprising Women with Hope) Committee is from the San Carlos neighborhood and was formed more than three years ago. As each loan cycle ends, the women of the Committee want to continue working on their projects. The group is currently in its fourteenth loan cycle with the program. One of the members is Sra. Miguela R. who sells fruits and vegetables at the Luque Market where she has a vending stall. Sra. Miguela’s work requires a great deal of sacrifice because she has to wake up early in order to arrive at her vending stall and begin selling her products. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables (oranges, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, apples, and other products).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Since the early years of their marriage, Eden M. and her husband have cultivated land for rice farming. Their income from this activity is the source for meeting Eden’s family's needs. This livelihood has supported the education of her only child (who is now 30 years old) in college until his graduation from a two-year course in agriculture. While he is not yet employed, he has been a great help to his parents in their rice-farming business.
Compared to the average expenses that a farmer should spend on rice farming, it is now a very expensive occupation because the prices of farm inputs and equipment rentals are higher than before. Eden and her husband, just like all those who had no opportunity to access a loan with low interest, would take a loan from money lenders who charge huge amounts of interest. Therefore, after harvesting and selling the rice, their profit would be very small and not even enough to support their family's basic needs.
As a consequence, Eden and her husband agreed to obtain loans from Kiva partner, ASHI, since becoming a member in 2007. Eventually, life has become easier and enjoyable for her and her family, although their business is still unstable and has not grown so well. Eden is hoping that with the loan she is requesting now, her business would improve a bit further.

loans.use: To purchase rice seedlings, fertlizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy M. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 19 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Joy sells health and medicinal products in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Salimjon

texts.en:
H. Salimjon is 53 and married with one child. He is a very hard-working man who has experienced a great deal throughout his life. For the past three years, he has dedicated himself to providing taxi services. Salimjon is not regretful and is instead very proud of being a taxi driver. It is work where he can be free and make good friends as he is very charismatic. He always has a smile at the ready, and manages to bring out the same from those who ride in his taxi. Happily for Salimjon, business is good. Currently his car needs thorough repair so he wants to borrow 4000 Somoni with which to buy the spare parts needed. He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.        
       

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy spare parts to fix his taxi.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Pedro Antonio P. V.  es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Novireta San Blas, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Adela Cuevas con 38 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.
 
       Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, tiene buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señor muy trabajador.
Ademas del negocio con que cuentan ellos también trabajan en agricultura principalmente para el consumo familiar, también tiene vacas lecheras de donde diariamente obtienen leche para consumir
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio P. V. is from the Novireta San Blas neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 39 years old, and is married to Adela Cuevas, who is 38. They have 2 children who are currently school-aged. They have a store located in their home that has a regular customer base. It generates a good income, and they have good business and personal references as he is a very hardworking man. In addition to this business they also both work in agriculture, mainly to produce for their own consumption. They also have milk cows from which they are able to get milk daily to consume.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, yerba, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase agricultural insumables.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alassane S. habite à Yoff Ndenatte. Il est âgé  de 47 ans. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 4 ans. 
Monsieur S. a choisi l’activité de commerce par passion. Etant donné qu’il vit dans un village ou la pêche  occupe une importante place  il a préféré orienter son commerce vers les matériels  de pêche. Ainsi  il pratique cette activité depuis  qu’il a terminé  ses études primaires.
Monsieur S. est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis avril 2009.Il a déjà  remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de matériels de pêche  tels que filets, hameçons, autres   qui seront destinés a ala vente.
Monsieur S. souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille a travers l’accroissement de ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Alassane S. lives in Yoff Ndenatte. He is 47 years old, married and the father of 2 children between the ages of 2 and 4. Passion led Mr. S. in his choice of business. Given that he lives in a village where fishing occupies an important place, he preferred to go into the business of selling fishing gear. Thus, he has operated this business since he finished elementary school. Mr. S. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since April of 2009 and has already paid back a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs intended for the purchase of fishing gear such as nets, hooks, and other items to be put up for sale. Mr. S. wants to improve the living conditions of his familly through the growth of his earnings.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Yzell

texts.en:
Yzell L. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Yzell is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Yzell owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Yzell has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Yzell joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yzell is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Yzell from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with four children: three girls who are ages 8, 5 and 3, and a boy who is 22 years old. The boy attends college while the other children are still in their lower classes. 

Tabu has been operating her vegetable stall for the past eight years, selling vegetables to her neighbors and passersby. With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to pay college fees for her son, and purchase sacks of potatoes and a sack of coconuts. 

Tabu faces the major challenge of high transportation costs, theft, and seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a retail shop in future. Her major aim of working with Yehu is because of its availability of sustainable financial services to small scale entrepreneurs. She owns a home with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes and coconuts and pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cash crops like coffee, maize and cassava and more retail items like bags of sugar

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: Oscar Danilo tiene 28 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, todos menores de edad. El señor se dedica a la venta de frutas ya tiene 11 años que dio inicio a este negocio ante la falta de trabajo que aqueja a nuestro país, además que él sabe trabajar muy bien en el campo y los trabajos de ese rubro cada día se vuelven más escasos. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de cosechas de aguacate, naranjas y mandarinas. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una pulpería grande en su casa de habitación, y algún día dejarle algo bueno a sus hijos con lo cual puedan mantenerse.
texts.en: Oscar Danilo is 28 years old, married and has 2 children who are underage. Oscar has sold fruits for 11 years; he started his business due to a lack of work that affects his country. He works well in the countryside but jobs in that field are becoming scarce. He wants to use the loan to buy crops of avocadoes, oranges and mandarins. His dream has always been to have a large grocery store in his home and to someday leave his children something that will be able to support them.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Thou's Group

texts.en:
This loan group is made up of five borrowers who are shown in the picture. The group leader, Mrs. Thou M., is 41 years old. She currently is a widowed mother of two children. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dR. seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing crops. This is an annual action with which she has had great success. Currently she wants to plant more vegetables in her farmland in order to earn extra income for the family needs. Mrs. Thou M. said that she doesn’t have capital to make it possible. So Mrs. Thou M. is looking for a loan to use to purchase seeds for planting in her farmland.

There are four other borrowers in this group who have requested a loan as follows: 
Mrs. P., a farmer, is asking for a loan to buy more nets and hooks to fish for extra income. 
Mr. K. needs a loan to purchase nets and traps for fishing activity.
Mrs. S., a fish catcher, is asking for a loan to buy some nets and hooks to support her fishing business.
Mrs. R., a farmer, is hoping to make additional income by requesting a loan to purchase fishing tools to fish.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting in her farmland.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es: Pelagia, de 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 47 años y de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales el primero es mayor y los dos menores aún estudian en el colegio; y juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante. El día empieza desde muy temprano para esta empeñosa mujer, pues luego de atender a sus hijos, emprende su negocio de venta de gaseosas y cervezas afuera de su casa. Esta muy satisfecha pues su labor le genera regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar; además considera que es un trabajo tranquilo ya que  lo realiza desde la comodidad de su casa y no descuida la crianza de sus hijos. Manifiesta que empezó con algunas gaseosas y en la actualidad vende bastante, sobretodo durante los fines de semana, ya tiene algunos clientes fijos y les brinda su mercadería a crédito; y como ya se acerca la época veraniega desea aumentar su mercadería. También tiene planeado para el futuro empezar a vender algunos productos comestibles y helados. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Pelagia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de cajas de gaseosas y cervezas que necesita para abastecer mejor su negocio.
texts.en: Pelagia is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her husband José who is 47 and her three children.  One of her children is grown up and the two younger ones are still attending school.  Together they work hard to get ahead.  The day begins very early in the morning for this determined woman since, after seeing to her children, she starts work in her business selling soda and beer outside her house.  She is very happy because her work makes her regular profits which allow her to help her husband with the constant household expenses.  She also considers it to be a calm job because she can work from the comfort of her own home and not neglect her children.  She says that she started out with some soda and now sells quite a lot, especially on a weekend.  She has some regular customers and she offers them goods on credit.  As the summer season is approaching she would like to increase her merchandise.  She also plans, in the future, to begin selling some food products and ice cream.  This is her fourth loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner because she doesn't want to let down the people who made the loan possible.  The loan will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Pelagia is planning to invest the loan in the purchase of a large number of boxes of soda and beer which she needs to better stock her business.

loans.use: To buy boxes of beer and soda in order to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Caselda Montefalcon's Group

texts.en:
Caselda M. is from the village of Sangay Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married, and has one school-aged and two adult-aged children. Caselda is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Caselda M.’s Group.

To make a living, Caselda owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Caselda has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Caselda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Caselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Caselda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third one taken out by Caselda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: For additional inventory and working capital

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to make his shop larger

loans.name: Maribel Ynes

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años, de estado civil soltera, realizo estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer  préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de frutas.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con el cuál comprará ocho cajas de manzanas, uvas, plátanos, naranjas y piñas, los cuales se venden en el mercado de Bellavista  junto con mamá.

Su sueño es alcanzar sus metas relacionados a su carrera de Turismo.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, responsabilidad y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the “3 de Mayo II” Communal Bank in the district of Puno, province of Puno and department of Puno, she is 22 years old and single, she has a higher education.

Maribel has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years, her first loan was of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles and she invested it in her fruit stand.

Her new loan is of S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, she will use it to buy eight cases of apples, grapes, plantains, oranges and pineapples, which are sold in the Bellavista market with her mother.

Maribel’s dream is to reach her goals related to her tourism degree.

What Maribel enjoys about her Communal Bank is its punctuality, responsibility and solidarity.

loans.use: To buy different quantities of fruits like apples, oranges, pineapples and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy yeast, flour, oil, baking powder, etc., in order to produce a larger quantity of breads for sale

loans.name: Handaa

texts.en: Mrs. Handaa is 49 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has one daughter, who is married and lives separately. Mrs. Handaa has been running a retail sales business since 2000. She buys different tools, instruments, hardware and spare parts from wholesalers and sells them at Khar Khorin, the second largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. She has taken a loan from Credit Mongol before and repaid it on time. Her business is doing very well. In the future she is planning to build a new family house on her plot of land. Therefore she is trying to save some money by increasing her business profit. This time, she is applying for a loan to increase her working capital, inventory and to buy more tools and instruments for resale.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and to buy more tools, hardware, and instruments for resale.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Jalia has a business selling shoes, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jalia hopes to generate greater profits, pay school fees and provide for other basic needs at home. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Jalia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: El señora María dedicada a la elaboración y producción de pan y empanadas ya hace un par de años atrás, esta actividad lo realiza en su domicilio, la producción y venta de sus productos  ya es conocida en su zona por realizar pan casero durante toda la semana, tiene ya muchos clientes, también reparte en algunas tiendas del lugar, empleando un pequeño horno domestico, el sueño de la señora es ampliar su negocio y contar con un horno mucho mas grande para producir mas pan y repartir a mucha mas gente, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. María comprara insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de sus riquísimos panes y empanadas, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora con ganas de superación, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: María has made and produced bread and empanadas for a couple of years. She does this activity from her home, producing and selling her products. She is already known in her area for making homemade bread the whole week long. She already has a lot of customers and also distributes to some stores in the area. She uses a small non-commercial oven. Her dream is to grow her business and have a much bigger oven and produce more bread and distribute to a lot more people. With the money from the loan, María will buy materials and ingredients to make her delicious breads and empanadas. She is a very responsible and hardworking person who wants to get ahead. She is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered in granting the loan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina G. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Regina is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Regina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, in the local community. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Regina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Regina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yeni; la socia tiene 31 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como ladrillos,yeso,cemento entre otros más la socia lleva un par de años en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja ella es masajista de profesión pero actualmente no ejerce su carrera ya que tiene su hijo muy pequeño que necesita de ella es por eso que la socia se dedico a este negocio con su pareja.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más material de construcción para así poder tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the ” RICHARY RUNA” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

The associate is Señora Yeni.  She is 31 years of age and lives with her partner and her child.  The associate alternates her activities with the business of selling contruction supplies such as bricks, gypsum, cement and more.  The associate has had this business for two years, which she works jointly with her partner.  She is a masseuse by profession but at present she does not practice her trade because she has a very small son that needs her.  That is why the associate is dedicated to this business with her partner.  

The associate requests the loan to buy more building materials in order to be able to have more variety to offer her clients.  

The associate is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials in order to have a greater variety to offer her clients.

loans.name: Elvira Natividad

texts.es:
Elvira Natividad H. A. tiene 29 años, es soltera vive  con la madre y el padre y los hijos (2), en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  LA SOLEDAD se encuentra ubicada en el recinto EL TAMBO  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca y además cría aves como gallina y patos.

Elvira se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca también tienen gallinas los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en El Tambo y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos y alimento para sus aves.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es trabajar muy duro para tener dinero para sus hijos ya que no tienen papa y ella tiene que ver la manera que no les falte nada.

Le gusta ayudar a mis hijos hacer la tarea.
texts.en:
Elvira Natividad H. A. is 29 years old.  She is single and lives with her mother and father and her two children in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

The members of the La Soledad communal bank are located in Recinto El Tambo in Chillanes canton.  This communal bank has 12 members who work in agriculture, growing cacao, rice, corn, and yucca, and raising birds such as chickens and ducks.

Elvira farms, growing cacao, rice, corn, and yucca.  She also has chickens.  She buys her products in Chillanes and El Tambo, and sells them at the fair on Sundays in Chillanes.

She is asking for the loan to buy supplies for her crops, fertilizers, and food for her birds.  The loan will help her economically to supply her with necessities, and also to face challenges such as infestations, illnesses, and variations in climate.  Her dream is to work very hard to have money for her children, since they have no father, and she has to find a way to give them everything they need.

She likes to help her children with their homework.

loans.use: to purchase crop supplies, fertilizers, and food for her birds

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. is 49 years old and is a domestic farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. She owns a plot of farmland that she inherited from her grandmother. Chea uses this land to grow rice and peanuts to sell. Her husband supports her in her farming business. The couple has five single children, three of whom are employed in Thailand while the others still study in a local school. 

Because her farm is outside of a watering system, Chea is requesting a loan to dig an irrigation well. She plans to use the remainder of her loan to purchase some planks to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to dig an irrigation well and increase the size of her house

loans.name: Wijdan

texts.en:
Wijdan is a mother of six daughters and three sons.  Wijdan's husband is employed by the Ministry of Education and owns a small piece of land where he grows seasonal vegetables. 

Wijdan took out a loan from FATEN to pay her oldest daughter's tuition fees as the father couldn't pay the coming semester's fees due to the dry winter which resulted in  fewer crops and less income.

Wijdan is a conservative woman, therefore, her husband is photographed in the picture above.

loans.use: to pay her oldest daughter's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Cenalisa

texts.en:
Cenalisa is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Cenalisa is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Cenalisa sells coconuts and bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Cenalisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Cenalisa is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional coconuts and bananas to resell. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to resell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 46, is a married and has 11 children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosita has a candle-making business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase wax, muds and other materials for candle making. 

Rosita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase wax, muds and other materials for candle making

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 52-year-old married lady. She is an excellent mother of her four adult-aged children. Esther established a buy and sell business eight  years ago. Then she established a new additional business: a motorcycle with sidecar. She has been engaged in this business for five years with a monthly income of PHP 15,000. To develop her business further, she requested a loan of PHP 50,000 from GDMPC to purchase a brand new motorcycle.

Esther has been a member in good standing of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Esther wants to become a businesswoman who owns a transportation service business.

loans.use: To purchase a brand new motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosanna, 42, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, a welder, and mother of six children, four of whom are already working while the other two are still studying. By the grace of God, Rosanna has managed to support her children’s educational needs. As of the present time she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances for her other two children’s education.

Rosanna operates a small propeller factory. Her husband works as the welder in their factory, while she handles the finances. They offer the propellers to suppliers who sell them to ship or motor boat owners or manufacturers. They earn a profit for every item they sell. Her regular customers are individual, local stores and retailers.  She earns a minimum of Php 1500 in sales every day.

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials and additional equipment, and for maintenance of their existing machines. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosanna dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and additional equipment for her business.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es: Diana  vive en el barrio Santa Maria al suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 12 a 27 años. Desde los 13 años trabajó como empleada del servicio doméstico hasta que cumplía los 40  y decidió seguir su sueño de tener un negocio; aprovechando su conocimiento en la elaboración de fritos,   comenzó con una ponchera en la puerta de su casa y posteriormente agregó papas rellenas, pasteles, almuerzos y ahora comidas rápidas; de esta manera ha logrado surgir con su familia, hoy con hijos adultos y dos menores a su cargo, por los cuales se esfuerza para lograr que ellos cumplan sus sueños y sean un día exitosos.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará una carpa para su carro de perros, y también invertirá en insumos en mayor cuantía, para lograr ahorros en sus compras y trasladárselos a los precios de venta. Su sueño es que sus hijos adultos logren plena independencia y que toda su familia logre  aumentar su bienestar cada dio más.
texts.en: Diana lives in the Santa Maria neighborhood, located in the southwest of the city of Barranquilla. She has five children between the ages of 12 and 27. When she was 13 years old, she started working as a domestic employee, and continued doing so until she was 40 years old. Then, she decided to follow her dream of having a business. She took advantage of her knowledge of how to prepare fried foods and started with just a large bowl in front of her house. She later added stuffed potatoes, pastries, lunches, and now fast foods, and this is how she has succeeded in supporting herself and her family. Today, she has three adult children and two who are still in her care. She struggles for them so that they can achieve their dreams and have successful futures. This credikiva is Diana's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy a canopy for her hot dog cart and to invest in purchasing ingredients in larger quantities. She will be able to carry those savings over to her selling prices. Her dream is that her adult children will achieve complete independence and that her entire family will improve its quality of life each day.

loans.use: to buy a canopy for her hot dog cart and to buy ingredients in larger quantities

loans.name: Anatji

texts.en:
Anatji, a 46-year-old lady, is married to Zeth, a 63-year-old fisherman. They have three children: Alan, a 15-year-old boy, in the 3rd year of Junior High School; Yems, 13 years old, in the 6th grade of primary school; and Yuliana, 8 years old, in the 2nd grade of primary school. 

As the income generated by her husband is insufficient for the family, Anatji works as a stone breaker to supplement her husband's income. She usually sells the stone to the stone supplier but it depends on the number of orders from the supplier. 

Anatji dreams of running a new business that can help her in generating more income for her family.  Anatji is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. She plans to spend the loan on piglets to be raised and fishing net to support her husband in his work. Anatji really hopes that TLM will provide a loan for her new business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to be raised and a fishing net.

loans.name: Chale

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Beira, provincia de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos de idades entre 8 a 29 anos de idade 4 destes ainda vaõ a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condinçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a mãe, o irmão e 2 primos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Sofala para Maputo a procura de emprego, é carpinteiro ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente e este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material PARA CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA PARA RESIDENCIA (areia, cimento, ferro, pedra, e outros.). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, 10.500.00mt, e 13.000.00mt aplicados na habitação.  
Gostaria de concluir a sua obra e comprar um carro para ajudar a transportar o material para a sua carpintaria, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Chale was born in the city of Beira, Sofala Province in central Mozambique. He is married and has six children between 8 and 29 years old; four of them go to school. Chale finished sixth grade and quit school because of financial problems. He lives in his own house and supports his mother, his brother and two cousins who live with him.

He left Sofala to move to Maputo in search of a job. He has been a carpenter for more than ten years and has an income of 15,000 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

Chale has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer, and this is his fourth loan. He is asking Hluvuku for 20,000 meticais to buy materials FOR HOME CONSTRUCTION (sand, cement, iron, stone and other items). The first loans were for 10,000 meticais, 10,500 meticais, and 13,000 meticais and were for housing.

Chale would like to finish his house and buy a car to help transport materials for his carpentry work. To do so, he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy materials (sand, cement, iron, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Donalia

texts.en:
Donalia is 51 years old.  She is engaged in a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She has been selling bananas, avocados and ginger around her  village for quite some time. Usually, she goes to the market to sell all her products where she can dispose them all easily. 

Donalia has been doing this for almost 20 years and is now earning an average net income of PHP 5,000 each month. She feels lucky to have a thrifty type of family since sometimes this monthly earning is sufficient, especially now that all her three children are married. 

In the 20 years in this business, she usually experienced delayed payments from her customers, so she needs to ask for loan assistance to maintain her business operation. Donalia is requesting from ASKI the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy sacks of spices, onions, garlic, and monggo or mung bean, as additional products to sell. She is thankful that ASKI, an MFI partner of KIVA, exists to help her in the business.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Florencia Group

texts.en:
Florencia is 51 years old and lives in P-2 Cogon, Osamiz City. She is married with three children. Teresita has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase canned goods, a sack of rice, etc. Florencia has been a member of PMPC for seven months. In the future, Florencia hopes to be successful in her chosen business. 

Florencia is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, a sack of rice, etc.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a food vending business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major dream is to expand to a bigger restaurant in the future.  

With the KSHS 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase cement and timber to build a bigger restaurant and add more furniture. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement and timber to build a bigger restaurant and add more furniture.

loans.name: Niyar

texts.ru: Niyar zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim lubimim mujem i detmi. Niyar 45 let. Ona uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. Niyar etomu biznessu nauchilas u svoyey starshey sestri.
texts.en: Niyar is married and has two children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her beloved husband and children.  Niyar is 45 years old.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for six years and breeds cattle.  She currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity for sale.  Niyar learned this business from her older sister.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mahoulomin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOULOMIN est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la deuxième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Dossi Laure est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Dossi Laure est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à Valentin un maçon.  Le couple  à trois enfants tous scolarisés  et encore à leur charge. Dossi Laure n'a jamais été à l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Dossi Laure vend depuis cinq ans des sacs de maïs. Dossi Laure s’approvisionne dans le nord du Bénin. Dans  la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Dossi Laure sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOULOMIN, un deuxième crédit.Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The MAHOULOMIN group has three members who are friends and who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  This is the second time that this group has requested financial help from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses.  The group's representative, called Dossi Laure, is the lady raising her hand in the photo.  

Dossi Laure is 34 years old and married to Valentin who is a builder.  The couple have three children still in their care who are all in school.  Dossi Laure never went to school.  In order to cover her needs and those of her children, she has been selling sacks of corn for five years.  She stocks up in the north of Benin.  With the goal of satisfying her customers and increasing both her sales and her income, Dossi Laure is requesting, together with the other members of the MAHOULOMIN group, a second loan.  They repaid their first loan on time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old and married with three children. She is a tailor and has been in the business for the past seven years. She gets a monthly income of KES35,000 from the business.

This is her second loan term from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy more materials for sewing clothes.

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her dream is to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 27 años, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre. Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus cuatro hijos, en una casa de su propiedad, la cual logró adquirir con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Raquel, es la venta de yucas, limones y verduras regionales en un puesto de venta, ubicado en el mercado municipal de su distrito. Es así que debe levantarse muy temprano para comprar dichos productos a loa comerciantes mayoristas. Tiene más de un año dedicándose a esta actividad y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Ella considera rentable éste negocio, gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, asú ayuda a su pareja. Su plantes es ampliar su negocio con mayor inversión, para tener más ganancias. Este sería el préstamo número dos con la institución MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como: yucas, limones y verduras.
texts.en:
Raquel, 27, is a hardworking, cheerful woman.  She lives with her spouse and four children in a house that is her property and that she managed to acquire with much effort.  Raquel’s activity is the sale of manioc, lemons and regional vegetables in a stand located in a municipal market in her district. 

She must rise early therefore to buy her merchandise from wholesalers.  She’s been in business for over a year and to date has worked alone.  She considers this business to be profitable and thanks to it is able to cover her household expenses and help her spouse.  Her plan is to expand the business with more investment to earn higher profits.  

This will be MFP loan #2 and she hopes for support from all of you.  She will use the requested amount to buy such products as manioc, lemons and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy cassava, lemons and vegetables.

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
Saem, 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known as a pre-Angkorean site. 

Saem sells food.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase groceries to resell at her home. 

By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income.  In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. 

This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Dieu Vivant Plus Group

texts.en:
Pierre is the chairman of the community bank named “Dieu Vivant Plus” which is composed of 13 micro-entrepreneurs who are united in the same goal — to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through HOPE RDC. 

Pierre is 53 years old. His main business activity is selling beverages. He buys them in bulk and resells them at the retail level for a profit. He sells his products daily at the market in his area located west of Kinshasa. His business makes a profit of about US $180 per week. 

Pierre started his business in 2000. He is a trustworthy client of HOPE RDC, having seven times obtained and correctly repaid loans. His next loan will allow him to buy twenty crates of beverages to increase his sales in order to make a better profit. The aim of this loan is to reinforce his working capital and provide food for his family. Pierre is married and the father of nine children, whose ages range from 10 to 33 years old. Four of the children attend school.

loans.use: to purchase beverages in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas. Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
During the past six months, this group bred pigs successfully. They maintained the pigs well, away from diseases. They always give the pigs nutritious feeds and vitamins. After five months, the pigs sold out for a satisfactory price. All the group is happy and they continue to borrow to improve their businesses and earn more profit.

Ni Ketut used her loan to purchase a local pig species to make pig roll. This kind of pig is raised for two months and then sold. Ni Ketut hopes this new loan will bring more success and she will earn more profit. She plans to save all the profit for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase a local pig species

loans.name: Rodolio

texts.es: Rodolio, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y de ideas firmes con deseos de superación. Convive con Brin, quien es una mujer y ella también se dedica a la agricultura. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad. Las actividades que realiza Rodolio, es la agricultura y ganadería, para ambas tiene un terreno de 60 hectáreas de extensión,  en donde realiza un  proyecto que tiene en marcha, como es la siembra de palma aceitera sobre 5 hectáreas, puesto que éste producto tiene bastante demanda, por ser un cultivo alternativo. Asimismo posee 02 vacas a las que cría con planes de hacerlas aumentar en número. Pero para continuar con estos trabajo necesita la ayuda de 06 peones que contrata y paga un jornal de 20 nuevos soles diarios cada uno. Comenta que le agrada su vida de campo pues le ha traído muchas alegrías como los ingresos económicos para pagar los gastos propios de su hogar, así como el ver como marcha sus proyectos, y viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, piensa continuar en su actividad e incursionar en otros productos como la caña de azúcar e implementar su ganadería. Este será el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente contento de contar con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus proyectos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles en la compra de madera como marupa y madera blanca, para implementar su granja de animales.
texts.en: Rodolio, age 36, is a hard-working man with solid goals and a desire to succeed. He lives with Brin, who also works in agriculture. They live in their own home with their children ages 9 and 11. Rodolio works in agriculture and livestock. For these activities, they have a 60-hectare plot of land. They have 5 acres of palm trees, since this is a less common product that is in high demand. Rodolio has two cows which he is raising and planning to breed. In order to continue with his work, he needs the help of six labourers whom he will hire and pay 20 Nuevos Soles per day, per worker. He says that he enjoys life as a farmer because it has brought him much happiness and an income to cover his household costs. He enjoys seeing the development of his crops and the good fruit of his labour. He plans to continue with this work and start planting other crops such as sugar cane. He also plans to expand his livestock holdings. This will be his sixth loan with MFP, and he is happy to have financial support for his projects. With the requested 1000 Nuevos Soles, he will invest in the purchase of wood such as marupa and white wood, in order to better outfit his animal stalls.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Mlambogroup

texts.en:
Tariro is a 56-year-old lady and she is a widow. She has four children aged 35, 31, 27 and 24 years and none of the children is still in school. She has three other dependents, her grandchildren, whom she stays with. 

She operates a shop in Masvingo town where she sells cellphone accessories. She buys her products from Harare and she has been in business for two years now. She has two employees who work for her. The challenge she faces in the business is of high competition in the market. She would like to own various branches around the country in the next five years. She has requested a loan of $250 to buy cellphone accessories. With the profits from the business she will be able to get new furniture for her home and take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cellphone accessories

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty-four years of age and is married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of confectionery  such cookies and cakes in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. 

Mary Olepa needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase an additional oven for baking. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 250 or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business. Mary Olepa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Mary Olepa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase an additional oven for baking.

loans.name: Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras que se dedica al destace de cerdos, fritos, chicharon, y venta de cerdos en  pie, ese es el caso de Sara que tiene siesa años de dicarse a esa actividad, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de cerdo en pie, Yessenia hace repostería y hace queques por encargos, Mildred vende ropa y prendas de oro, María vende nacatamales, fritos con tortilla y moronga.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four enterprising members who make a living butchering pigs, in fried food, in fried pork rinds, and selling live pigs.  This is the case of Sara, who has been making a living in this job for several years.

She'll invest the loan in buying live pigs.

Yessenia sells desserts and makes cakes by request.  Mildred sells clothing and gold jewelry.  María sells tamales, fried food with tortillas, and blood sausage.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Noonkokua

texts.en:
Noonkokua has repaid her previous loan due to the good harvest she received. She has used the proceeds to lease an additional piece of land for maize and beans farming.

She has been advanced 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) by KADET LTD, which will facilitate the preparation of the enlarged area of cultivation as well as purchase of inputs like fertilizers and seedlings.

She hopes to use the increased proceeds to diversify into sheep rearing. Her hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.en:
My name is Maria G.. I make and sell tortillas. I have had my business for four years with the help of my daughters that distribute my products. My clients are my neighbors, orders for celebrations and general stores and markets. My business earns enough for me to support my family. My goal is to increase inventory to have a greater production of tortillas. I hope to use the profits to remodel my house and support my family.

Loan Use: Purchase corn four, salt, lime, water, firewood and matches

Mi nombre es Maria G. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años y con la ayuda me mis hijas repartimos el producto terminado, mis clientes son mis vecinos, encargos para fiestas y repartir a pulperias y mercaditos, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion de tortillas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelas mi casa de habitacion y mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, sal, cal, agua, leña, fosforos

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman and a mother of 6. She runs a small machine shop that sharpens cutlasses, hoes, knives and other farming tools. She also retails these items in the outlying farming communities on their respective market days. The major farming season is about to begin in March. She is therefore seeking Kiva's assistance to increase her market share of farming tools. She has been a beneficiary of Kraban's TEACH sessions which will help her manage the loan if it is granted.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 48 year old woman who is married with eight (8) children. She sells used clothing to people in her community. She hails from Benin, Edo State, Nigeria. She wishes to borrow $400 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sales

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
ANA ISABEL IS 34 YEARS OLD. SHE LIVES IN UNION LIBRE WITH HER 3 SONS AND HER SPOUSE, WHO WORKS AS A RETAILER. SHE HOPES TO USE HER LOAN TO SET UP A FOOD SUPPLY STORE IN HER HOME AND TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR IT. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP JOVEL 3.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

ANA ISABEL TIENE 34 AÑOS , VIVE EN UNION LIBRE Y TIENE 3 HIJOS , SU PAREJA TRABAJA COMO COMERCIANTE . ELLA ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO PODER INSTALAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA Y COMPRAR MERCADERIAS PARA ABASTECER LA TIENDA . . PERTENECE AL GRUPO JOVEL 3.

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Beyler

texts.en:
A. Beyler is a 47-year-old married man who has three children. He is a farmer. He is from the Lachin region and right now lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1995, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses.

In 2005 Beyler borrowed US$500 to add to his own savings of $250 and purchased another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled. Beyler applied for a loan of $800 from Normicro to purchase two calves for meat production and expanded his business, considerably increasing his income.

Beyler would like to receive a $1,000 loan in order to acquire 3 small bulls and feed for them. He will repay the loan within 14 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business.

loans.use: To acquire 3 small bulls and feed for them

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu sells utensils in Magburaka town.  She started her business five years ago and has seen her business progress with the previous loans.  She is a 37 year-old widow and has five children.  She is the sole bread winner for the family.  She lost her husband during the brutal civil war in Sierra Leone.  The business provides Isatu with income for the children’s fees and other expenses.  She is requesting for more loan capital for the expansion of the business and she is determined to see her children through their education.

loans.use: Increase her business selling household utensils.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Ever since she married Esperanza has dedicated all of her time to creating beautifully woven and colorful sweaters. She began this work thanks to the initiative of her husband, Vincente, who has worked with this beautiful and noble art since his childhood. Due to their diligence and great desire to prosper, both of them put their full interest and dedication into their work.

Recently they fixed up and began work in a small work shop through which they are receiving a large volume of revenue. They receive so much that they are completely covering the necessities of their home. The great desire of this entrepreneurial mother is to purchase a home and to provide their young five year-old daughter, Melany, with a comfortable home of their own. Melany is the motivation to struggle forward each day.

In order to fulfill the dreams of this young couple a loan is requested. This loan will serve to help them acquire a larger quantity of basic materials which they will use to continue creating their beautiful sweaters. The added revenues from their work will enable them to purchase their home. Let us help this entrepreneurial family to continue to prosper through their noble profession.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Desde que contrajo matrimonio, Esperanza se ha dedicado por completo al tejido de hermosas, variadas y coloridas chompas, trabajo que emprendió gracias a la iniciativa de su esposo Vicente, quien se dedicaba desde su niñez a este bello y noble arte. Ambos desempeñan esta labor con mucho interés y dedicación, gracias a su diligencia y deseos de prosperar. Hace poco acondicionaron e implementaron su pequeño tallercito, mediante el cual están generar cuantiosos ingresos económicos que les posibilita la satisfacción plena de las necesidades de su hogar.El deseo de esta emprendedora madre es comprar su casita y ofrecerle una morada propia y cómoda a su pequeña niña Mélany de cinco años de edad, quien es el motivo importante para esforzarse día a día; para concretar sus anhelos esta joven pareja solicita un préstamo dinero que les servirá para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima para seguir fabricando sus hermosas chompas, y con los beneficios económicos que obtenga poder comprar su casita.Ayudemos a esta emprendedora familia a que siga prosperando con su noble labor.

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials for use in creating beautiful and colorful sweaters.

loans.name: Anuncio

texts.es:
Anuncio Martínez in 43 years old, married and has 4 children.

He has been very hardworking since he was young. His goal was always to open a brick shop and thus create a source of work for the people living in his area. Since he did not have the capital to open this business, he decided to travel to Argentina to work as a mason and thus return with enough capital to open his business.

After much sacrifice he returned to his country to achieve his goal, started his business and now has one of the biggest shops in the area with all of the work that he creates for persons from his town. Through his business he can support his family because he has a good income, and has improved his quality of life and that of his family.

The loan requested will be used to buy materials for his business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Anuncio Martínez tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos.

Desde joven fue muy trabajador. Su meta siempre fue abrir una olería y así generar fuentes de trabajo para las personas de la zona. Como no contaba en ese entonces con un capital para abrir este negocio, decidió viajar a la Argentina para ir trabajar como albañil y así volver con un buen capital y abrir su Olería.

Fue así que después de mucho sacrificio volvió al país para cumplir con su meta, inicio su olería y hoy es una de las mas grandes de la zona, con el trabajo que le proporciona a las personas de su pueblo, puede mantener a su familia ya que le genera muy buenas ganancias, ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
