texts.en: Josephine is 48 years old, married and has five children, the oldest of whom is 23 years old. For the last 22 years, she has made a living by farming rice and raising pigs. She sells her pigs at the local market and makes about 8,000 PHP a month from her work. She has applied for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and farm supplies. She hopes to increase her income because this will allow her to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 33 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She runs a green grocery.  She also sells cereals and does small-scale poultry farming  for extra income.  Previously, she was employed at a supermarket.  

Through Faulu Kenya, Emma has been trained on business management.  This has helped her sustain her business for five years.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  Emma has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy more cereals.

loans.use: To buy more cereal grains to resell

loans.name: Koutediomboulo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Ledit groupe est  composé de quatre femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou (à droite de la photo levant la main) est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un autre enfant confié par un parent.

Elle s’active dans la vente d'arachide et d'huile de palme. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront de participer à l'amélioration les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on October 19, 2001.  The group is made up of four women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their main business is petty trading. Madame Fatou (to the right of the photo, raising her hand) manages the group.  She is 36 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She also looks after the child of a relative.  Her business is primarily that of selling groundnuts and palm oil.  She has great experience in the business, having worked in this domain for many years.  

This loan will allow her to grow her capital stock and better develop her business.  The profits will allow her to contribute to improving the livelihoods of her family (health, diet, clothing, etc...) and to grow her savings.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts and palm oil.

loans.name: Gulzada's Group

texts.en:
Gulzada, 53, is the leader of this group.  Together with her husband who is a pensioner, she has raised a daughter and two sons.  Her daughter and older son are working in Russia and her younger son is taking care of his parents and working as a taxi driver.  

Gulzada and her husband are farmers. They have been cultivating agricultural products almost all their lives.  With this work, they earn money to meet their daily needs. Gulzada has applied for this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her older daughter is a student while her husband works as a construction worker at a private company. 

Dolgor manages a fruit trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2000 and is planning to continue it in the future. With her business earnings, she has been able to buy land where she is planning to build a house, in the future. She is a polite woman who attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase fruits for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús D. Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 68 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, todos independientes.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Se dedica a la venta D. carne, dice que venD. en un mercado D. la zona.  Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace dos ciclos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprar seis degollados D. cordero, lo compra D. las ferias D. la localidad y lo venD. en el mercado, trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos..
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y las utilidades generadas por el ahorro.
texts.en:
Petrona is a member of the “Niño Jesús D. Praga” (Infant Jesus of Prague) communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 68 years old, married and has six children, all independent.  She never went to school.

She sells meat; she says she sells in a local market.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two cycles.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 new soles that she invested in her business.  She will use this new, 500 new sol, loan to buy six lamb carcasses in the local livestock market to then resell in the market; she works together with her husband.

Her dream is to grow in business and improve her income.  What she likes about the communal bank is the easy payments and the profits generated by the savings.

loans.use: to buy six lamb carcasses.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  Christine has a business selling used shoes.  She has been in this business for one year, and she works six days out of every week. 

Christine sells her products at the market, retail.  She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand shoes.   The main business challenges for Christine include seasonality and ever increasing costs of bales of clothes.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing used clothes herself and also to sell wholesale only. 

Christine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
From Uganda, Rose is single with three children, all of whom go to school. She lives in a rental which has piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent, utility bills and food. Rose’s two major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season, which makes movement difficult.

Rose sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market, working six days a week. She has been in business for the last ten years. She is requesting a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goal is to start selling her charcoal on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 54 años, es viuda y vive con su madre en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, zapatos y lo que teje, actividad que lo hace durante 4 años. Su productos son ofrecidos a sus amistades, y al cabo D. un plazo pactado, realiza el cobro. Por otro lado ella siempre administra y pone orden en sus cuentas, para no olvidar quien le debe o no. Con el tiempo ha juntado un capital considerable para comprar más mercadería, y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes. Es la cuarta vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, es una D. las integrantes D. su banco comunal que demuestra ser muy responsable en la devolución D. su préstamo, razón por la que se ha ganado el cariño y confianza D. sus demás compañeros. En la actualidad invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. más prendas D. vestir y zapatos.
texts.en: Francisca is 54. She is a widow and lives with her mother in her own home. She sells clothing, shoes, and items that she weaves. She has done this for four years. She gives her products to her friends, and at the end of an agreed upon period she charges them. She is always the one who manages and puts her accounts in order so as to never forget who owes her money. With time, she has amassed considerable capital to purchase more merchandise and cover her customers' demand. This is the fourth time that she has requested a loan from MFP. She is one of the members of her communal bank who has proven herself to be very responsible in repaying her loans. For this reason, she has gained the affection and confidence of her peers. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of more clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Wangoro A Group

texts.en:
Agneta is the deputy facilitator for Wangoro Group.  She has six children at home, along with her husband.  Agneta and her fellow group members have been part of One Acre Fund since 2010.  Agneta says that her reasons for joining were to be able to grow enough to feed her family, to use the profits for school fees, and to learn good agriculutural and farm finance practices.  

In her most recent harvest, Agneta's farm yielded 10 bags of maize on 1/2 acre, a very good harvest by her measure.  Before joining One Acre Fund, Agneta said that she was only getting 3 bags of maize from her 1/2 acre of land.  

With the profits from her maize, Agneta will invest in her children's education, invest in livestock and save for emergencies.  Other group members say that they will invest in more diverse food crops in addition to continuing maize planting.

In 2012, Agneta's group will plant a total of 5 acres of land with One Acre Fund.  Each farmer will plant between 1/2 and 1 acre of land.   

In this picture, Agneta's Field Officer is on the far left, and the wife of Mark is standing in for him.

loans.use: To plant maize in the 2012 season

loans.name: Florencepin

texts.en:
Florencepin lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 
Florencepin works in the piggery industry for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase pigs for her piggery. 
Florencepin has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for seven years. In the future, she hopes to have a large amount of capital for her piggery. Florecepin is proud to be a member of PMPC because it can help with her financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her piggery.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in an airport community. She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 29. One lives at home and is presently in school, while the older one is working and lives at home. 

For the past twenty-five years Martha she has been selling frozen food (chicken, meat, and pig feet). She makes more profit since she sells very good and expensive products. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, fresh meat, and pig feet for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, fresh meat, and pig feet for her business.

loans.name: Lucila Teresa

texts.es: Lucila Teresa tiene 42 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo.  desde hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, la necesidad de proveerle ingresos a su familia ha hecho que ella busque la forma de tener este trabajo ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante. El crédito es para la compra de ropa en general, cosméticos, calzado, cremas, tratamientos, shampoo entre otros. Su gran meta es poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Lucila Teresa, 42, has two minor children in her care.  She’s had her business for over six years.  The need to provide family income motivated her to find a way of earning a way of living.  She peddles general merchandise.  This loan is to buy clothing in general, cosmetics, footwear, creams, treatments and shampoo, among others.  Her great goal is to be able to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, footwear, creams, treatments and shampoo, among others.

loans.name: Mamadou Sire

texts.fr: Mamadou est  âgé de 43 ans.Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont deux fréquentent l'école du quartier ou il habite.Il évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 1986 et commercialise des produits alimentaires. c'est son fils ainé qui habituellement l'aide  a sa descente de l'école dans les activités de vente au sein de la boutique.Les bénéfices que lui génère son activité lui permettent de supporter les charges familiales. Il est sociétaire de l'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l'achat de denrées alimentaires destinées a mettre en œuvre l'ouverture d'une deuxième boutique , ce qui lui permettra de servir les populations qui sont un peu éloignées de la première boutique.Son principal objectif est la satisfaction des clients. Mamadou veut devenir le plus grand commerçant du coin.
texts.en: Mamadou S., aged 43, has been a merchant since 1986.  He is married and has four children, two of whom attend school.  The oldest helps him with his business after coming home from school. With his business, he is able to meet all the needs of his family.  Mamadou S. would like to open a second shop near the first one to be able to meet the demand of the customers in his neighborhood, where there are not enough shops.  With his two shops, he would like to become an important merchant in his area because he has a large neighborhood shop.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell in his new store

loans.name: Liceth

texts.es: Liceth tiene 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus dos menores hijos, en un casa que es de su propiedad, inmueble que compró con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza, es la venta de bebidas como gaseosas y refrescos, que son ideales para el clima caluroso de la región donde vive. Dicho negocio lo realiza en su casa, para ello cuenta con una congeladora en donde mantiene sus productos a temperaturas frías. Tiene más de un año dedicándose a esta actividad, y da gracias de que sus hijos la apoyan al igual que su pareja. Lo que le gusta de su negocio, es el poder contar con un ingreso económico de esa manera ayuda a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Su plan es ampliar su negocio y comprar otra congeladora. Este sería el crédito número dos con la institución MFP, se siente muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que viene recibiendo y por ello espera nuevamente con su ayuda. Con el monto solicitado, comprará  más bebidas como gaseosas en mayores cantidades, que le permitan tener mejores ganancias, e insumos como frutas y azúcar para la preparación de refrescos.
texts.en:
Liceth, 37, is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  She lives with her spouse and two minor children in a house she owns, an asset she bought with much effort.  The activity she’s in is selling beverages like soft-drinks and fruit drinks which are ideal for the hot weather in the region she lives in.  Her business is home-based and she has a freezer to keep her products at cold temperature.  She’s been in business over a year and is thankful that both her children and her spouse help her out.  What she likes about her business is that she can count on income to help her spouse with household expenses.  Her plan is to expand the business and buy another freezer.

This would be loan #2 with MFP.  She feels very happy and grateful for the support she’s been getting and hopes for your help once again.  She will use the amount requested to buy more beverages like soft-drinks in larger amounts so that profits will be higher and ingredients like fruit and sugar to make the juice beverages.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and fruit.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom (in the photo) is 44 years old and her husband Nov is 52 years old. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children-three sons and two daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment worker, another one is a driver and another one sells chinese noodles. 

Sokhom stays at home. Her husband is a construction worker. Sokhom wants to launch a business selling groceries, but she does not have the capital. Hence she decided to request a loan in the amount of $300 to buy grocery items for sale.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Dildekan

texts.ru: Дилдекан 50 лет, замужем и имеет двух взрослых сыновей.  Дилдекан работает посудомойщицей в кафе  и параллельно занимается откормом и перепродажей скота и полеводством.  Начатое еще в 1990-х годах с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  и насчитывающее две дойные коровы и одну лошадь, сегодня приносит около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.   В данный момент, семья Дилдекан обрабатывает  3.0 га орошаемой земли , где выращивают клевер и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Дилдекан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Дилдекан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашние скотины.
texts.en: Dildekan is 50 years old. She is married and has two adult sons. Dildekan works as a dishwasher in cafe.  At the same time, she is involved in fattenening and selling cattle, and cropping. The business, which she started back in the 1990s with the starting capital of 5,000 som (KGS), includes two milk cows and one horse. The sale of dairy products brings brings about 4,000 som (KGS) per month. Dildekan's family currently works 3.0 ha of irrigated land. They grow clover and perennial grasses. In order to further increase the number of livestock, Dildekan turned to the company "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30.000 som (KGS) for the purchase of bulls. Dildekan plans to use the profit for further increasing the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ansu

texts.en: This is 41 year old Ansu.  He is single, and has two children, seven and four years old. In 2001, Ansu established his men's footwear (shoes and sneakers) business. He began his business because he wanted to be self employed and get a reliable source of income to provide a livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Ansu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now needs a new loan in order to buy more shoes and sneaker for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Ansu plans to move to a shop rather than a stall, build a dwelling house for his family and educate his children well. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and sneakers for his business.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is a 51-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has two children. Son and his wife earn a living running a general store, which they have done for five years. 

Son would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock their store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his existing customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions as well as enable him to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock his store.

loans.name: Tweyombeke Rwentahi Group

texts.en: Moses is 35 years old and is a member of the above mentioned group. He owns a retail shop and has been running it for 11 years. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations and his personal goal is to build a permanent home. His business goal is to expand his business to new markets. Moses needs a loan to buy soda,soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and other general merchandise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old. She and her husband Albert have three children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

She is borrowing her first loan from KADET LTD for 30,000 KES, with which she plans to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for her business. She will save the anticipated profits from the business for her farming project.

She hopes to start a farming business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman having one child. Victoria is 42 years old, residing at Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Victoria owns & operates a business venture, selling seafood products including fish in the local community to earn a living and she's been eight years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

In 2011, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Victoria wants to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver lives in the Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Oliver owns a shop selling different consumable items, especially food.

She is in the process of expanding her business. Limited with her narrow capital base, Oliver fails to cope with the demand from her clients. She sees this as a lost opportunity, which needs to be utilized. From her own savings, she can contribute 20% of the expansion project. She still needs USD 950 to facilitate her plan.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Serhed

texts.en:
Serhed has 2 years of experience in this business.
He applies for a loan of $800 to buy a lathe.
He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region, Gayidish vilage. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy a lathe

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim S. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  He makes his living as a mototaxi driver and can typically make around $4/day of income.  His wife, meanwhile, works at the local garment factory and can earn about $2.5/day.  Moreover, one of his children is also a garment worker, which contributes to their household every month and at the same time, three children are students at the school near their home.  With the loan, S. hopes to purchase one motorbike for his children and also wants to change his old motorbike in order to run his daily business.  In the future, S. expects to run a simple grocery business at his house and hopes to build a concrete house for his family.  If he has the opportunity, he would send his children to the local university.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike for children and to fix his motorbike for business

loans.name: Maria  Benita

texts.es:
Maria Benita is a widow. She has six children, and in order to cover expenses she began her business, selling foods, five years ago. She is originally from the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. Her love for her children and her desire to see them become professionals have motivated her to work very hard every day. Fortunately, she has been able to get ahead with her family and her business, which has grown little by little, thanks to the quality of the products she makes and the good service she provides to her customers.

In order to grow her business Maria is requesting a loan of $925.00, which she will use to buy furniture and also ingredients to increase the variety of foods she offers. She promises to return the loan in 6 months. Please contribute to the growth of this business and be a part of Maria’s achievements. She and her family thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Benita es viuda, tiene seis hijos y para poder cubrir sus gastos inició su negocio hace cinco años, donde elabora y vende comidas, ella es originaria de la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. El amor hacia sus hijos y el deseo de verlos convertidos en profesionistas la han motivado a trabajar arduamente todos los días. Afortunadamente ha salido adelante con su familia y su negocio, que ha visto crecer poco a poco, gracias a la calidad de los productos que elabora y a su buen servicio cuenta con la preferencia de muchos clientes.

Ante la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, ahora Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mobiliario e insumos para incrementar la variedad de sus comidas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y se parte de los logros de Maria, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy furniture and food ingredients

loans.name: Mirsadig

texts.en:
Mirsadig is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is from Salyan region, Khaladj village. He has been in the farming business for 4 years. 
Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve his yield

loans.name: Delmis Argetina

texts.es:
My name is Delmis Argentina, and I’m mainly involved in commerce. I rely on a small home business selling cosmetics, which I then distribute traveling through my community. I have three years of experience in this line of work, which provides income for me to contribute my family’s expenses. It’s important that I mention I’m a single mother and I have three children that depend completely on my income. With the benefits I see in this work, I have built my life, and little by little, I’m improving it.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombres es Delmis Argentina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de cosmeticos, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, cuento con tres años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia. Es importante mensionar que soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijos los que depende totalmente de mis ingresos. Con las utilidades que persibo de este negocio he contruido mi vivienda, la que poco a poco estoy mejorando.

loans.use: Purchase of body cream, shampoo, salts, lotions, lipsticks, and undergarments.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia L. is a single mother with an eleven-year-old little girl that always helps her mother so they can both get ahead together. Zonia began her business making tamales at home and selling them to all her neighbors. Little by little she earned her customers, who recommended her for her rich, delicious tamales. After a while, she realized her daughter was growing up, but lacked a mother figure at her side. That’s why she decided to alter a small part of her house and establish her tamale sales from there.

Nevertheless, the high season is coming when customers have money and there are many parades. Zonia wants to use this time to invest so she can make more tamales and secure greater earnings. Therefore, Zonia is requesting a credit of $925 that she will repay in a span of six months. With this money, Zonia will be able to help her daughter forward and offer her a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Zonia L., madre soltera de una pequeñita de 11 años, quien le ayuda a su mamá para que juntas puedan salir adelante. Zonia comenzó su negocio haciendo tamales en su casa y ofreciéndolos a todos sus vecinos. Poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientes, y la recomendaban puesto que los tamales que hacía, estaban muy ricos. Después de un tiempo se dio cuenta que su hija estaba creciendo y le hacía falta la figura de una madre a su lado. Y fue por es oque decidió adecuar un pequeño espacio en su casa para poder establecerse a vender la comida ahí.

Sin embargo la temporada alta en que todos los clientes tienen dinero y hacen las posadas, es cuando Zonia quiere invertir para poder hacer más tamales y obtener mayores ganancias. Por lo tanto Zonia está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Zonia podrá sacar a su hija adelante y ofrecerle un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients for cooking her products

loans.name: Rashida Riaz's Group

texts.en: I am Rasheeda R. and I live in Faisalabad, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of eight: seven sons and one daughter. Currently, three of my kids are studying while others work. My husband works at a government institute for a meager income and one of my sons sells files that are used in various organizations for legal documentation. Now, he needs to expand his business and therefore requires a loan for this purpose. I shall now like to introduce the other group members of my loan group.They are Yasmeen B. who needs to buy a cow for her family's  business. Kubra B. whose husband wants to buy a rickshaw. Arshad F. who needs a loan for her grocery store. Sardaran B. she is a widow and needs loan to buy her son a donkey cart.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Esperanza M

texts.es:
Esperanza makes and sells decorations for birthdays and other celebrations. Since she was a young girl, she's had a knack for creating beautiful decorations, something it should be noted that not everyone has.

Unfortunately, her business isn't steady because she works to order and celebrations like weddings or religious holidays aren't evenly spread out through the year. Wisely, however, she's applying to Ceprodel, which has already provided her with 3 loans, for a new loan so that she can buy materials to make her products. Since getting those loans, she's been able to create more decorations and, in turn, increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman

La venta de decoraciones como adornos para cumpleaños, recordatorios, adornos de hogar, etc. Son los que muy dignamente elabora la señora Esperanza para luego venderlos a sus clientes. Desde muy pequeña se ha caracterizado por tener la habilidad y destreza de decorar muy lindos adornos. Una virtud que hay que señalar es que no todas las personas tienen este talento pero ella si lo posee desde muy pequeña.

Lastimosamente este no es un negocio fijo debido a que trabaja por encargos ya sea cuando hay bodas, cumpleaños o cualquier actividad religiosa. Sin embargo muy sabiamente para mejorar la situación económica de su negocio acude a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado su apoyo con la entrega de 3 créditos invertidos directamente en la compra de los materiales para elaborar los productos. Desde que obtiene estos créditos, ha percibido mejores ingresos por lo que ha manufacturado mayores cantidades de adornos decorativos.

loans.use: Buy materials to make decorations.

loans.name: Namataba 2 C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Beatrice M.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. Beatrice is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 11 children ranging from age 10 to 34 and three of her children go to school while the others work. Each week, Beatrice makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build houses to rent out. Beatrice has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Beatrice is joined in her small group by Agatha N., Milly N., Grace N., and Alice N.. Agatha N. has a business selling clothes and wants to increase stock. Milly N. is currently operating a poultry keeping business and wants a loan to buy poultry feed. Grace N. operates a poultry keeping business and wants to expand her business. Alice N. is currently in the business of operating a bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more beer.

loans.use: To add capital to charcoal business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia invirtió en compra de colas, bebidas, jugos y confites. Le dio mantenimiento a su congelador fuente de su trabajo.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Debido a que tiene mas variedad de artículos sus ventas aumentaron. Tiene buenos referidos dentro de su sector. Mantiene su horario de trabajo. Sus hijos le ayudan en la atención del negocio.

Información Personal :

Es casada. Tiene 4 hijos. Su esposo trabaja de pescador. Cuando se encuentra libre le ayuda a su esposa en el negocio. Su casita es de caña.

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una mercadería variada para su venta. Artículos como: sabanas, toldos, zapatos, pantalones. Además de incrementar su negocio de bebidas, colas, jugos.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=16602

Description of Business

Cecilia has 4 years experience at her business. She began, selling various things, as a street vendor, something that required that she spend a lot of time away from home. Her husband helped her start a business at home selling juices, soft drinks and other beverages. She works everyday from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.

Purpose of Loan

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her business. She hopes to stock it with other kinds of beverages. She also wants to buy confectionaries. She would like to help her husband, a fisherman, buy fishing gear that he needs.

Personal Information

Cecilia is married. She’s 38 years old and she has 3 children, only one of whom is in school. Her husband is a fisherman. He comes home every 15 days to help with the household. Their house is made of cana (a reed-like wood) and has a dirt floor. Their goal is to have a small house made of cement which would improve the life of their family.

loans.use: Compra de una mercadería variada para su venta

loans.name: Tabu's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Tabu is 53 years old and is a widowed woman with 2 children, ages 26 and 20. She also take care of 1 other child, age 6. Tabu owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Hadija, Maundu and Monica, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio is a member of Senor De Los Milagros, a communal bank.

Rocio is a friendly person. She is 20 years old and she is a single mother of a 2 year old. Rocio sells products such as; vegetables in bulk and sells minor quantities at a local market. Her products are wanted in the city of Lima, and she is dependent on demand. Her products are transported by car and then distributed in bulk.

Rocio needs a loan of 1600 soles, money that will be invested in products.

Her ultimate dream is to own her house, study a major or career, better her business, and provide her daughter with schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Rocío es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.

Rocío es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hija de 2 años, Rocío vende verduras por mayor y menor en el mercado Nery García Zarate, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima, dependiendo de la demanda, sus productos los transporta con carro alquilado y luego distribuye por mayor y también vende por menor en un puesto del mercado.

Rocío necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de camote.

Los sueños de Rocío son tener una casa propia, estudiar una carrera, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a su hija.

loans.use: buy sweet potatoes

loans.name: Indira

texts.en: Indira is a 28 year old woman from the town of Bilalovac.  She is married with one child, who is currently in primary school.  She and her husband support themselves mainly through their agriculture business. They have 3 cows, and have been selling milk to dairies and people in the village.  Her husband also receives a small disability pension from the military. To grow their income, Indira has started her own hair salon, and she is eager to expand her customer base.  She is requesting her first loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of $975, which she will use to buy equipment and supplies for the salon.  For the future Indira hopes to find some new clients while keeping up quality services for her regulars.

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for her hair salon

loans.name: Florinda Gabriel

texts.pt:
Florinda Gabriel M. is 40 years old and a native of Homoine province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. She is married and is the mother of one son who is 20 years old and is a student. She supports her son and lives in her own home.

Florinda went to school until the 9th grade and is currently attending 10th grade. She had stopped due to the poor conditions of her ancestors. She moved with her parents from the province of Inhambane when she was a child, but she doesn't know the reasons.

Florinda works at the Military Hospital of Maputo as a health assistant. She earns a monthly salary of 2,820MT but is unable to save any money. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. The first was for 7,000MT, the second was for 8,000MT, and the third will be for 12,000MT. All the loans were used to purchase construction materials that she is doing in phases. She learned of Hluvuku through colleagues that are clients. She projects in the future purchasing a vehicle for which she will need additional loans.

Translated from Portuguese by jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Florinda Gabriel M. tem 40 anos de idade, natural de Homoine província de Inhambane ao sul de Moçambique. Casada maritalmente e mae de 1 filho com 20 anos de idade e é estudante. Apenas sustenta o seu filho. Vive numa casa propria. Florinda estudou até 9ªclasse e agora está frequentar a 10ªclasse, tinha parado devido a falta de condições por parte dos seus progenitores. Mudou da provincia de Inhambane quando criança junto com os pais e não soube as razões. Florinda é funcionária do Hospital Militar de Maputo como auxiliar da saúde, tem um salário mensal de 2.820,00mt e não faz nenhuma poupança. Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku. O primeiro foi de 7.000,00MT; o segundo foi de 8000,00MT e o terceiro que será de 12.000,00mt. Todos destinam para compra de material de construção estando a construir por fases. Conheceu a hluvuku atraves dos colegas que sao clientes. Tem como projecto para futuro comprar uma viatura, para tal conta com futuros empréstimo.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Norma Karina

texts.es:
Karina’s first loan

Karina is a member of the Communal Bank Glorioso. Karina is single and 23 years old. Karina still lives with her parents and studies accounting in a private university. She is the manager of the family’s cars that provide urban transport in the city of Ayucucho. She also works as a receptionist in her Aunt’s hotel in her free time. Karina sells cosmetics by catalog, products she offers to friends and family, her sales are primarily made on credit.

Karina needs a loan for 1050 soles which will be invested in the purchase of colognes, creams, and cosmetics.

Karina dreams of being a successful professional and of implementing an Internet and phone café.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El primer préstamo de Karina

Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso. Karina es soltera y tiene 23 años, Karina vive todavía con sus padres y estudia contabilidad en una universidad privada y se encarga de la administración de los carros de la familia que realizan transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho, también en sus ratos libres trabaja como recepcionista en el hotel de su tía. Además Karina vende cosméticos por catálogos, productos que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son en gran parte al crédito.

Karina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de colonias, cremas y cosméticos.

Los sueños de Karina son ser una buena profesional, exitosa, implementar una Internet y locutorio.

loans.use: Karina needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase colognes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sobe 2023-1 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Joice K.. She sells fruits like oranges and guava. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Joice is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a policeman.  She has five children ranging in age from age 9 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Joice makes approximately 100 sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. The other members of Joice’ group are Janty Apai, Flora J., Grace P., and Suzi P.. Janty Apai sells simsim and groundnuts. Flora J. sells ice cream and cakes. Grace P. sells cold drinks like soda and juice. Suzi P. sells bread and tea at a restaurant. Each of these women wants a loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.ru:
Муродова Файзигуль, 1966 года рождения и у нее 4 иждивенцев. Она начала свой бизнес с продажи токи. Сейчас ее ассортимент товаров увеличился, это разновидность токи (национальные головные уборы), махси (национальные сапоги) и чапаны (национальное пальто). Свой товар она закупает у поставщиков из Коканда и продает на Центральном рынке Гисарского района.
Для увеличения товарооборота хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони для закупа чапанов.
texts.en:
Fayzigul M., was born in 1966 and she has 4 dependents. She started her business by selling traditional head coverings. Today, her product assortment has increased. She sells a variety of traditional head coverings, boots, and coats. Fayzigul purchases her products from suppliers from Kokanda and sells them at the central market in the Gissar region. In order to increase her inventory she would like to borrow 3500 somoni ($1050) to purchase traditional coats.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase traditional coats

loans.name: Kaneez Sher Ali Group

texts.en:
Kaneez baji is a wife of S. A. and a mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. Kaneez baji and her husband can barely meet the household expenses, so they cannot afford to send their children to school. But they have a dream to give their children a good future. Kaneez baji performs her duties very efficiently. She does household work and runs a grocery shop. Kaneez baji’s husband has a livestock business. He buys livestock to resell. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. Kaneez baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy animals (goats) for her husband and to use part of the loan amount to buy groceries for her grocery shop. As their profits increase, they hope to be able to invest in their children's future.

She is joined in her loan group by two more members. Ghafooran baji requests a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Suraiya baji requests a loan to buy woods for her wood selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Ven Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan includes twenty people in the Liek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Touch V. is a village bank president, who was selected by the members of the group loan. Mrs. Touch V. is 47 years old and the mother of three children, who all attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. S. Phon, is a farmer who owns 0.6-hectare on which he cultivates rice to earn a living.

Mrs. Touch V. is a tailor in the local village. This business is going well, so she wants to expand it. She is requesting a loan to buy more cloth to make dresses for her customers.

loans.use: Buy more cloth to make dresses for her customers

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say K., 43, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She cooks and sells a variety of food in front of a nearby garment factory, earning about US$2 a day. Her husband, Kem Hean, 45, is a construction foreman and makes approximately US$5 per day. The couple has three children, two of whom are employed and one who is in school. Say K. is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase cows for resale. This will enable her to earn additional income to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Keyla Yolany

texts.es: la Sra. Keyla M. de 27 años de edad y residente en la colonia Villanueva, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y enchape de oro los cuales los vende en las colonias aledañas de donde ella vive, tambien vende su producto en las camaroneras del sur del pais ya que ella viaja los fines de semana para vender su producto, poco a poco a logrado adquirir varios clientes, ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, dicho negocio le ayuda a sacar adelante a su hija la cual tiene 3 años de edad, ella es madre soltera porque su pareja la dejo abandonada y no le ayuda en nada y por esa razon es que ella lucha para salir adelante con su pequeña hija, con este credito tiene la intencion de surtir mas el negocio y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Keyla M. is 27 years old and lives in the Villanueva district. She has a business selling clothes, shoes, and gold plating, which she sells in neighboring districts. She also sells her products in the shrimping villages in the south of the country during the weekends. Little by little she is increasing her client base. She has been doing this business for five years, which helps her take care of her three year old son. She is a single mother because her partner abandoned her and doesn't provide any support for her or her child, and for this reason she struggles to carry on with her little daughter. With this loan she plans to stock up her business and provide a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Celia Irma

texts.es: CELIA IRMA TIENE 26 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA Y VIVE JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN LA ZONA  COSMOS 79, DESDE HACE 6 AÑOS ATRÁS. CELIA TRABAJA EN UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO QUE ES E SU PROPIEDAD, CLARO QUE LA CASA DONDE SE UBICA EL NEGOCIO ES DE SUS PADRES. CUENTA CON 6 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA. SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, CELIA OFRECE UN EXCELENTE TRATO A SUS CLIENTES Y RESPONSABILIDAD, SU TIENDA DE BARRIO SE ENCUENTRA EN LA PLENA AVENIDA PRINCIPAL DE LA ZONA. EL CREDITO SERÁ DESTINADO A LA COMPRA DE LLANTAS PARA SU MOVILIDAD. CELIA NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGOS NI EL BURO DE INFOCRED.
texts.en:
Celia Irma is 26 years old, married and has been living with her family in the Cosmos 79 zone of La Paz for the past 6 years. Celia works in her own local shop, which of course is in her parents’ house. She has 6 years of experience and whilst there is competition in the market, Celia treats her customers well and responsibly. Her shop is right on the main avenue in the area. The loan will be used to buy tyres for her vehicle. Celia does not have a bad risk or credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tyres for her vehicle
